loans.name: Norca

texts.es: Norca tiene 32 años, es una madre muy cariñosa y alegre, vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su esposo Adrián de 29 años y su hija Adriana de 2 años. Ella es una mujer que siempre ha luchado por tener una vida mejor, actualmente es la administradora de un hospedaje en el centro de la ciudad de Juliaca, el cual es muy visitado no solo por turistas nacionales, si no también por los internacionales, ya que el servicio que brinda es de muy buena calidad y sus ambientes muy cómodos. Ella disfruta de brindar las mejores comodidades a sus clientes, lleva 10 años desde que incursionó en este negocio y lo más lo difícil para Norca es tener que mantener los ambientes limpios y ordenados todo el tiempo. Para un futuro, anhela que su hospedaje crezca y pronto se pueda convertir en un hotel reconocido, sabe que todavía tiene un largo camino por recorrer y está dispuesta a afrontarlo. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y espera poder pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable y siempre está al tanto de las decisiones de su grupo. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, hará arreglar algunas zonas de su hospedaje que se han venido deteriorando con el paso del tiempo.
texts.en:
Norca is 32 years old and caring and cheerful mother. She lives in her parents' house along with her husband Adrián, who is 29 years old and her 2 year old daughter Adriana. She is a woman that has always fought to have a better live. Currently she is an administrator at a hotel in downtown Juliaca, which is visited not only by domestic tourists but also international guests since the service provided is very high quality and the environment is comfortable. She enjoys provding the best comforts to her clients. She has been doing this for 10 years and the most difficult thing for Norca is maintaining everything clean and orderly all the time. In the future, she wishes that her hotel will grow and become a well known hotel. She knows she still has a long way to go and is willing to do it. This is her first loan with MFP and she expects to be able to make her payments punctually. In her communal bank, she is a very responsible member and is always well informed regarding the decisions of her group. With the 800 Nuevos Soles requested, she will make repairs in some areas of her hotel that have deteriorated over time.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairs for hotel

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 38-year-old mother of 3 who lives and operates her boutique in the Mukuru slums. She  was previously employed in a sewing company until she started her own boutique 3 years ago. She has requested a first loan of Ksh. 20,000 to add stock of ready-made clothes so that customers may have a variety. She hopes that one day she will buy a home, become an importer, and ensure that her children get quality education. She describes herself as focused and hard-working.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock of ready-made clothes

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 50 years old. She works as a fish and meat vendor in her village in San Jose, Santiago City. She is already a widow and thus serves as a mother and father to her son, Orlando. She is glad that through her perseverance, she has been able to give her son the education he wanted. She is also thankful that through the business, she was able to support their daily needs.  

She hopes to sustain the business because it is really a big help for them to surpass financial difficulties, thus she would like to request a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 5,000 as additional business capital.

loans.use: To finance her fish and meat vending business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
“In everything you do, put God first and He will direct your path,” shared Lorna as she believes in this saying. She is a God-fearing resident of Salamague, Lamut, Ifugao. She is now a widow and has four children. Two of her children have already finished a vocational course and the other two are still studying in high school. She wants all of them to finish their studies so that they will get a good and decent job someday.

Lorna is a woman of strong faith and determination. She manages a vending stall in their place. Aside from this, she also roams around their village selling snacks in order to generate additional income.

Wanting the business to become progressive, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders as additional business capital. With this amount, she will be able to increase her merchandise like vegetables and kilos of fish.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Joel Group

texts.en:
In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

The leader of this small group with the group name ‘Joel’ is Paul and he is the one sitting in the group photograph. He is currently in the business of grocery products and sells items like cold drinks, evaporated milk, sugar, biscuits etc. and is requesting a loan to buy a stock in bulk. Paul is 43 years old and is married. He has four children, ranging from age 18 to 4, and his children go to school. He takes delivery of stock in Kumasi central market in bulk and retail to his customers in his shop. He requests for the loan to buy increased stock to upgrade his inventory.

loans.use: To buy stock like milk, sugar, biscuits etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Gunduz

texts.en: Gunduz I. is married and has one adorable daughter. He runs a small grocery business. Gunduz has been in this business for over 13 years. He is a high achiever and a consistent entrepreneur who is very knowledgeable about the market environment. His professional skills and perseverance have helped to ensure the rapid growth and success of his business. Gunduz is requesting a loan for 1607 AZN to increase the assortment of his sales inventory. He is hoping that this loan will help his venture grow and generate extra profits. We believe that Gunduz 's ability to identify tasks critical to his business success and set up a system for accomplishing them will allow him to continue growing in the sphere of private entrepreneurship.

loans.use: purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Rali

texts.fr: S. Rali est née le 11 Août 1958 au Cameroun en Afrique. Rali vit depuis son jeune âge au quartier Agbokou à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Rali est une veuve et mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés, dont un est à sa charge. Rali vit seule avec ses enfants, et les charges de la famille sont supportées par elle seule. Rali n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de ses enfants, Rali vend depuis une dizaine d’année, des colas (produits locaux), des mèches de réchaud, des bouteilles et de « Adindon », servant à faire de sauce locale au marché Ouando à Porto-Novo. Rali s’approvisionne à Adjarra, village situé non loin de Porto-Novo. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant déjà bénéficié de deux crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Rali sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé pour augmenter la taille de son activité et de sa clientèle afin de mieux satisfaire les besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
S. Rali was born on August 11, 1958 in Cameroun in Africa. Rali has been living since childhood in the Agbokou district in Porto-Novo, administrative capital of Bénin. Rali is a widow and the mother of two children, one of whom is still under her care. Rali lives alone with her children and she is the only breadwinner for the little family.

Rali never went to school. To support her children, Rali has been selling kolas (local products), stove wicks, bottles and 'adindon', used locally to make stews, for some 10 years in the market of Ouando in Porto-Novo. Rali does her buying in Adjarra, a village situated not far from Porto-Novo.

She has been a client of ALIDé for a long time and has already received two loans that she has repaid correctly. Rali is requesting a third loan from ALIDé to grow her little business and her clientele so that she can better cater for the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of kola nuts, stove wicks, and local condiments

loans.name: El Cedro Group

texts.es:
Este unidad de desarrollo (UDE) se llama El Cedro porque todos son de la misma colonia, que tiene este nombre.  La colonia de El Cedro está en el estado de Veracruz.   Las UDEs son grupos de más de 10 personas que tiene una cuenta de banco y tienen que reunir semanalmente o quincenalmente para realizar sus pagos.  Tiene un representante y un comité que lo gobierna.    El grupo está conformado por diez integrantes.  

El representante del grupo se llama Adolfo G. Gómez.  Adolfo es casado, tiene 48 años, y tiene en total dos hijos.  Él va a instalar una papelería en su casa y necesita el préstamo para comprar papel blanco, cartulina, y otros materiales de primaria.  Sus clientes son los niños que asistan a la escuela ubicada a media cuadra de su casa.  Él es profesor es esa misma escuela hace veintiséis años.  Nos cuenta que estos tiempos difíciles, decidió encontrar otro tipo de trabajo para ganar un poco más. Adolfo desea este préstamo para sacarse una ganancia para comprar alimentación básica para sus hijos.  Espera que algún día sus hijos terminen con sus estudios y pueden comprar sus propias casas.  Él está feliz de ser presidente de este grupo porque sin el apoyo de los demás integrantes, no recibirían este préstamo y él quiere apoyarles a los demás.

Agustina Miñón M. es parte del comité de este grupo, El Cedro, como tesorera.  Ella tiene treinta y tres años, estudió hasta el bachillerato terminado, y tiene en total dos hijos (una niña y un varón).  Ella se dedica a la venta de oro y costura y bordado pintura y necesita el préstamo para comprar joyería de oro y cristal cortado.  Sus clientes son sus vecinas, incluyendo otra integrante del grupo El Cedro, quien compró joyería y juegos de baño.  Ella se dedica a coser hace veinticuatro años y aprendió cuando asistió a una escuela, pero solo hace poco tiempo pintando.  Agustina desea este préstamo para aumentar su negocio, para sacarse una ganancia para estudios y alimentación para sus hijos.

Los otros nueve integrantes son:

Hilda L. R. – venta de ropa y perfume
José Ignacio Hernández Hernández – Mecánico
Gloria G. S. – Venta de ropa
Guadalupe Bustos C. – Venta de Calzado Por Catalogo
Teresa de Jesús Díaz V. –  cocina y venta de Churros
Juan Ángel R. R. – Venta de Abarrotes
Julio Gómez Miñón – Fabricación de Bolsas y Pulseras
Juan Fernando E. Pérez – Albañil
Daniel Lara Maza – Venta de Abarrotes.
texts.en:
This development cooperative is called El Cedro, since that is the name of the district where all of the members live. El Cedro is in the state of Veracruz. Development cooperatives are groups of 10 or more individuals who have a bank account and who have to meet weekly or every two weeks in order to make their payments. This group has a representative and a governing committee, and is comprised of ten members. The group’s representative is named Adolfo G. Gómez. Adolfo is 48 years old, married, and has two children. He is going to set up a stationery store in his home and needs a loan so that he can purchase blank paper, cards, and other supplies. His customers are the children who attend the school that is situated a half block from his house. Adolfo has been a teacher at that school for twenty-seven years. He tells us that times are difficult, and so he decided to find other work in order to earn a little more. Adolfo wants this loan so that he can increase his earnings and thus be able to purchase basic foodstuffs for his children. He hopes that his children will finish their studies someday and be able to purchase their own homes. He is happy to be the group’s president, since he wants to help the rest of the group, and without help from the other members they would not receive this loan. Agustina Miñón M. serves as treasurer on El Cedro group’s governing committee. She is thirty-three years old, completed high school, and has two children (a girl and a boy). She makes a living selling gold, hand-sewn goods, embroideries, and paintings, and needs a loan so that she can purchase gold jewelry and cut glass. Her customers are her neighbors and include other members of El Cedro group, who purchased jewelry and bathroom sets from her. She has made a living from sewing for twenty-four years and learned this craft when she was in school, but she has only been painting for a little while. Agustina wants this loan so that she can increase her business and thus increase her profits in order to pay for her children’s studies and food. The other members are: Hilda L. Romera – who sells clothing and perfume José Ignacio Hernández Hernández – a mechanic Gloria G. S. – who sells clothing Guadalupe Bustos C. – who sells shoes from a catalog Teresa de Jesús Díaz V. – who prepares and sells churros Juan Ángel R. R. – who sells groceries Julio Gómez Miñón – who makes bags and bracelets Juan Fernando E. Pérez – a bricklayer Daniel Lara Maza – who sells groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing stationery supplies, embroidery materials, etc.

loans.name: Kurbanboy

texts.en:
D. Kurbanboy is 44 years old. He is married with five children. Kurbanboy is an optimistic and hardworking father. He works his land with love and dedication every day, so that it produces excellent vegetables. Kurbanboy has been is in the agro business for more than nine years. In fact, he draws strength and vitality to make his products the best in the city. Though growing vegetables is a very difficult and time taking job, he hopes to gather a rich harvest. He is planning to fix his house and save enough money to pay for his children’s school fees. With this purpose, he is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni. With the desire to realize his plan, Kurbanboy appeals to your generous hearts for a swift contribution. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Koem

texts.en: Mrs. Koem U. is a villager in Tuol Svay village in Takeo province. She is a grocer. Her husband, Mr. Thou Touch, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he sells water to help support their family. Now he needs a new water pump to strengthen his business. Mrs. Koem U. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She is 38 years old and the mother of two children who attend the local school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a water pump to support his business.

loans.name: Mafoe

texts.en:
Mafoe S. is 29 and married with 3 children.  She owns a business venture, selling ice cakes.  Mafoe has 3 years of experience in this business.  Mafoe needs a loan of WST $1500 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 tala or US $146 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

Mafoe joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Mafoe's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Mafoe S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.8 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en: Ruzanna A. was born in 1967 in Yerevan. She graduated from the Electro-Technical Department of the State Engineering University of Armenia. She is married and lives with her husband and two school-aged daughters in their own house in Yerevan. Ruzanna has had her own business for about 7 years, trading women’s clothes in Hayastan trade centre. Her husband engages in his own business, which consists of construction materials trading. With the income of their businesses they support their family and their businesses. Ruzanna needs a $3,000 loan to buy a collection of new clothes for her trade.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes for her trade

loans.name: Confiance En Dieu Group

texts.en:
The Confiance en Dieu is a made up of fifteen male and female entrepreneurs. After successfully repaying their first and second loans, they are looking forward to continued success and growth for their businesses with their third loan. Francisque S. is the general president of the group. He is 41 years old, married, and has nine children ranging from four to 18 years old.

The hardworking dad is a long-time business person who splits his time between two business activities. He makes cement blocks for the construction of houses, and he also makes charcoal. He will often purchase either wood to make the charcoal or already prepared charcoal to resell in the big city. He is thankful for the presence of Esperanza in the area because they have allowed many people to get back on their feet. He prays for not only the organization, but his fellow associates to grow. On behalf of Francisque, Confiance en Dieu, and Esperanza, we thank you for your support.

loans.use: cement, rocks, sand, wood

loans.name: Emeterio

texts.en:
Emeterio W. is a 58-year-old widower with 2 adult-age children from the village of Poblacion 4 Clarin Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, Emeterio owns and operates a service business. Specifically, he runs a motor-transport business. Emeterio has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2006, Emeterio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. As a result, he was able to improve his standard of living and his ability to engage in business activities. Emeterio has already successfully repaid a previous loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. Emeterio is requesting a new loan, this time in the amount of 16,100 PHP ($375), which will be used to repair his existing vehicle. Notably, this loan would be the seventh loan taken out by Emeterio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices, which cover the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is comprised of mostly farmers, fishermen/women and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To improve his business by making repairs to his vehicle

loans.name: Hakima

texts.en:
This is Hakima, daughter of K. M.. She is 23 years old, married and lives with her whole family of six members. She is one of the staff of the Interior Ministry of Afghanistan. She has been working for more than two years. Now she wants to host a wedding party for her youngest brother, but she can’t.

When Hakima was informed that the loan process is supporting the people, she came to AFS. She wants to receive an individual loan of 50,000 afghanis for her brother's wedding party. She would like to thank both AFS and Kiva lenders that support people around the world through this effective process.

loans.use: Expenses of brother's wedding

loans.name: Hoshim

texts.en:
Hoshim K. is 47 years old and was born in Penjikent, Tajikistan. He is the father of four children, and his main work consists of breeding cattle. This very remunerative activity enables him to provide for the needs of his family. A very ambitious man, Hoshim would like to buy a greater number of cattle and to build a farmhouse to house them in order to ensure their safety. Due to a lack of finances, Hoshim is asking for a loan of $1400 US Dollars for the realization of this project. When his dream is carried out, he will be able to have a greater source of revenue for his growing family. With your help this will be possible.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase small cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is 26 years old and married with three children who go to school. He has been running a retail shop where he sells general merchandise such as sugar, maize flour, cooking fat and cereals. He started this business last year and has one employee.  He was previously employed in a private company. 

He appreciates Faulu Kenya for the training they offered him because he has acquired business management skills. He hopes to grow his business and improve his standard of living in the future. He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Faulu Kenya to add to his stock of baking flour, cooking fat and cereals.

loans.use: To buy cereals, baking flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es: EL SR. AUGUSTO ESTA CASADO Y TIENE 5 HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN ESTUDIANDO EN LA UNIVERSIDAD, ES CLIENTE  NUEVO EN LA  INSTITUCION, EL CREDITO LO UTILIZARA PARA CONSTRUCCION DE MAS AMBIENTES EN SU CASA,  PUESTO QUE AL MOMENTO VIVE ESTRECHAMENTE CON TODA SU FAMILIA, CUENTA CON UN SOLO DORMITORIO Y COMO TIENE CINCO HIJOS LE ES DIFICIL LA SITUACION. TRABAJA COMO TRANSPORTISTA DE LA LINEA Nº 113, TAMBIEN MANTIENE A SU MADRE QUE ES DE LA TERCERA EDAD  Y DESEA DARLES COMODIDAD A SUS  HIJOS Y A SU MADRE. SU ESPOSA TRABAJA VENDIENDO COMIDA AMBOS QUIEREN MEJORAR  SU CALIDAD DE VIDA Y TRABAJAN DURO PARA REALIZAR UNO DE SUS DESEOS EL DE VER SU CASA TERMINADA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDAD EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Augusto is married and has 5 children who are university students. He is a new client of the institution and will use the requested funds to build more rooms onto his house because he currently lives with his family in pretty crowded conditions: he only has one bedroom and, with five children, the situation is difficult. He works as a public transport provider on Route #113; he also supports his mother, who is a senior citizen. He wants to provide comfort for his children and his mother. His wife works selling food; both want to improve their quality of life and they work hard to make their dream of finishing building their house come true. He is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home construction costs.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet owns a restaurant where she sells cooked food and drinks to customers. She has been managing the business for more than 1 year. Her husband sells phones and its accessories and they reside in Lagos. She is 30 years of age and she has 2 children. 
She is determine and want her business to grow from this level now to a better level that will improve their living standard. She hopes for the loan of NGN50, 000 to purchase more drinks and food stuffs to cook and sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and food stuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 49 years old and is married with three children: 14, 20 and 24 years old. Her youngest child is still attending school.

Monicah is a farmer in Nkubu town in Eastern Kenya. She has been farming for ten years and her main product is milk which she sells to Meru Central Sacco in Meru town. She is also a businesswoman and sells fruit in an open air market in the same area. Her main challenges in farming are pests and diseases which attack her dairy cows.

Monicah has requested this KES 45,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to expand her poultry project. The income from this loan will enable her to educate her son and build a better zero-grazing shed (to raise improved breeds of livestock under confined conditions in order to make better use of limited land area, feed and organic resources).

In future, Monicah intends to purchase one more dairy cow and plant more fruit, especially passion fruit and tomatoes. She says, "Juhudi Kilimo loans are helping farmers to boost their production".

loans.use: To expand her poultry farming

loans.name: Ramatoulaye

texts.fr: Ramatoulaye BÂ est une femme de 33 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTHIANG COUNDARA depuis 2008 et a trois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle fait la transformation et vente de pâte d’arachide. Elle achète le produit à l’état brut, c’est-à-dire des gousses d’arachide et le transforme elle-même en pâte d’arachide avant d’aller le vendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires environnant son village. Son nouveau prêt lui sera d’une grande utilité pour le renforcement de son activité et l’augmentation de sa production. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Ramatoulaye BÂ is 33 years old, married and the mother of four children. She has been a member of the SINTHIANG COUNDARA «Banc Villageois» loan group since 2008, and has been granted three successive loans. She manufactures and sells peanut paste. She buys the raw product, that is unshelled peanuts. She then manufactures herself the peanut paste, before selling it in weekly markets in the vicinity of her village. This new loan will be very useful to strengthen her activity and increase her production level. Her objective is to assist her husband in managing family needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her working capital and develop her business activity

loans.name: Renee

texts.es: Renee, de 45 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Nicolás de 45 años y sus 3 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Los largos días de trabajo que tiene Renee en sus tierras, la han convertido en una experta y gran conocedora de la agricultura. El tener sus cultivos bien cuidados y saludables, le han dado ventaja en la comercialización, por lo que siempre consigue un buen precio por la venta de café y plátanos que produce. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar la tierra, ya que es la actividad que realiza desde que era niña, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta la ciudad de “La Merced”. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras y así incrementar su producción. Este es el sexto préstamo de Renee con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para que sus cultivos sean más productivos.
texts.en:
Renee is a 45 year old woman who is hardworking and cheerful. She lives in her own home with her husband Nicolás, age 45, and their three young children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. The long days of working on her land have made Renee an expert in agriculture. She takes good care of her crops so that they grow in healthy conditions, which gives her an advantage when it comes time to sell them. Renee always gets a good price for the coffee and bananas that she produces. What she enjoys most about her work is cultivating the land since it is something she has done since she was a little girl. She has been doing this for 30 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products to the city of La Merced. In time she hopes to buy more land so that she can increase her production.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. Renee sets aside enough money so that she can make her payments on time because she does not want to create problems for the members of her Communal Bank. She feels happy to be part of this group. The loan of 2000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more compost for her crops so that she can be more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She rents a house with no electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are hospital bills and school fees.

Getrude operates a business buying and supplying maize and tobacco to the entire market. She has been supplying her products wholesale for the last seven years. She normally supplies all her products to local customers and to retailers in the market.

Getrude decided to work with Yehu so as to access loans to improve her business. With the Kshs 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase five sacks of tobacco, green vegetables, fruits, one sack of dried maize and green maize. She hopes to build her own business shop and become a big supplier in future.

loans.use: To purchase tobacco, green vegetables, fruits, dried maize and green maize

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie C. is from Barangay Bone South in Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is a 33-year-old married mother of 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marie buys and sells fruits and vegetables in the community. Marie has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI which she used to purchase more products to sell. Marie is now requesting her second ASKI loan, for 8000 PHP, so she can expand her product offering.

About ASKI:  ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her product offering.

location.town: Brgy. Bone South, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Jemalyn

texts.en:
Jemalyn C. is from the village of Barangay 18, Gingoog City. She is 24 years old. Jemalyn is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Jemalyn owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing pedicure and manicure services to local community members. Jemalyn has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jemalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jemalyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the first loan taken out by Jemalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Gulumkan's Group

texts.en:
Gulumkan T. is the leader of this group. She is 46 and married.  She has a son who is 21 and studies at university. Ten years ago with the initial investment of 10,000 soms Gulumkan and her husband started to breed livestock. They have twenty sheep and four cows. Every month they sell one sheep to cover family expenses.  Gulumkan applied for the loan because she needs money to increase the number of livestock she has.  In the future she wants to purchase a vehicle.

Symbatkan K. is the treasurer of the group. She is 45 and a widow.  She has a son and a daughter. The son studies at university and the daughter is at school. Two years ago,with the initial investment of 4000 soms, Symbatkan started to breed livestock. With that money she purchased two sheep and now she increased their number to seven. With money received from the loan she wants to improve her living conditions and purchase household appliances. 

Asanbek I., 50, is married. He has four daughters and a son.  Asanbek works as a taxi driver and his wife is a nurse.  Five years ago, with the initial investment of 5000 soms, he purchased sheep and started to breed livestock.  Selling some sheep after fattening he makes 5000 soms per month. He hopes to obtain the loan because he needs money to purchase some farm animals to increase the number of livestock. 

Erkinbu T. is 59 and married. She has two daughters and a son.  Her first daughter studies at university, the second is at school, and the son is working. Five years ago with the initial investment of 5000 soms Erkinbu started to sell convenience goods. In this way she makes 5000 soms per month. Her husband works as a mechanic on the power station.  With money received from the loan, Erkinbu wants to increase the turnover of her business activity. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Marife's Group

texts.en:
Marife C. is from the town of Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old and is the group leader of this four-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Marife is married and has two adult children. She owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Marife joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marife is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vilma Olga

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Aleli.
Vilma es soltera y vive con sus padres, Vilma vende animales menores como cuy que compra de las ferias para luego venderlos en los recreos del barrio de Conchopata, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su mama. Además Vilma estudia Comunicaciones en la Universidad. Vilma tiene proyectado iniciar con la venta de vinos por temporada.
Vilma solicita un préstamo de 900 soles para la compra de vinos.
Vilma sueña con tener una tienda estable y viajar a la ciudad de Lima a estudiar una maestría.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the Alelí (Frangipani) communal bank. She is single and lives with her parents. She sells small farm animals like guinea pigs that she buys at the livestock fairs and then sells in campground areas of Conchopata. Her mother helps her with this activity. In addition, Vilma is studying Communications at the university. She plans to start selling wines by the season. She is asking for a 900 sol loan to buy wine. Vilma dreams with having a stable store and with traveling to Loma to get a Master’s Degree.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wine.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia T. is currently in the business of selling food at a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more food in the restaurant. Cicilia is 30 years old and is married with a husband that is a soldier. She has four children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more foodstuffs in the restaurant

loans.name: Kollitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. KOLLITAS inicia su segundo ciclo, es parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, ocho mujeres y un varón. La mesa directiva está compuesta por la  presidenta: la señora Olga,  la tesorera: la señora Fidela y la secretaria de actas: la señora Lidia.

La señora  presidenta Olga es una mujer de 47 años de edad, casada, con  tres hijos,  las señoras consideraron que era la persona adecuada para el cargo.

Con respecto a su negocio, ella tiene un puesto de dulces en su mismo domicilio, además cuenta con canchitas (futbolines) que son la atracción para niños y grandes. Ella comenta que cuenta con este negocio desde hace 16 años y lo inicio por cuenta propia.  Su primer crédito fue invertido en mercadería, lo mismo que el que se le otorgará en este ciclo.
Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación, ellos tienen negocios como comerciantes y de servicio.
texts.en:
The A.C. KOLLITAS group is beginning its second season.  It is part of the Focal Point of Panamericana. It is composed of nine members, eight females and one male. The board consists of the president, Mrs. Olga; the treasurer, Mrs. Fidela; and recording secretary, Mrs. Lydia.

The president, Olga, is a 47-year-old woman who is married with three children.  The other members decided she was the right person for the position.  

With respect to her business, Olga has a candy stand in her own home.  She also sells popcorn balls, which is a big draw for both adults and children.  She notes that she has been in this business, which she started on her own, for 16 years.  Her first loan was invested in merchandise, and she plans to do the same with the proceeds of the currently requested loan.

The other members of the association have businesses as merchants and service industry personnel.

loans.use: To buy sweets.

loans.name: Melva Rosa

texts.es: Melva Rosa tiene 54 años. Su actividad económica es el destace de res. Hace más de 18 años que se dedica a este trabajo, por lo que siempre le ha gustado.  Esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos, pues la experiencia ha sido gratificante. Por lo que anteriormente se dedica al destace de cerdo, pero al no contar con el dinero suficiente, no continuo con este negocio por lo que en la familia se dedicaban a este tipo de negocio y fue así que mas tarde Melva decide establecer su propio negocio en su vivienda. Este crédito es para la compra de ganado.
texts.en: Melva Rosa is 54 years. Her business is butchering cattle. She's been dedicated to this work for more than 18 years, she's always liked it. This is not the first time that she's applied for credit, as the experience has been rewarding.  She was previously working as a pig butcher, but not having enough money, did not continue with this business.  As her family were dedicated to this kind of business, Melva later decided to establish her own business in her home. This credit is for the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yaa Bruwah Cecilia

texts.en:
Yaa Bruwah Cecilia A. sells Fante kenkey at Abura. She is married and has seven dependants. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare Fante kenkey for sale. She wishes to reinvest her  capital back into her business. 

Yaa is standing by a barrel full of Fante kenkey. She has a sample of it in her hand alsot.

loans.use: To buy more maize to prepare Fante kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 33 years old.  He is married with six children between the ages 3 and 13 years old, and has two adopted orphans.

Emmanuel has been a motorbike taxi driver for three years. He gets up at 6 am and works until 11 pm everyday to transport people to their work places. He needs to pay $6 per day to the owner of the motorbike in order to use it.

Emmanuel has requested a loan worth 500,000 Rwf to buy his own motorbike taxi.  His goal is to send all his children to school, build a house for the family, and save for his future.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Merlis Estrella

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres De Riobamba.

Merlis es socia  fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que la institución brinda tanto a ella como a sus compañeras del grupo. Tiene 30 años de edad, está soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres. Estudio en la Universidad y obtuvo el título de Ing. Comercial.

Trabaja de profesora en un jardín de infantes y en un colegio, pero también se dedica al comercio, vende productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas) y ropa de todo tipo. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7h30 hasta las 12h00, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, cobra semanalmente. La ropa la compra en Guayaquil.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y productos de Avon. Sus sueños son estudiar Ciencias de la Educación, para tener el titulo de maestra también.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres De Riobamba” (Women from Riobamba) Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo.  Since colonial times this city has been known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

Merlis is a founding member of the Communal Bank.  She likes it for the help that the institution offers to her as well as to her colleagues in the group.  She is 30 years old and single.  She lives in her parents’ house.  She attended the University, and she got her degree in Commercial Engineering.

She works as a teacher in a pre-school and in an elementary school.  But, she also sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories) and all types of clothes.  She works every day from 7:30 a.m. until 12:00 p.m.  She sells door to door and by order.  She collects weekly.  She buys the clothes in Guayaquil.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts, and Avon products.

She dreams of studying Educational Sciences in order to have her teaching degree as well.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and Avon products

loans.name: Mercedes Fidelina

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo encontramos la ciudadela San Gregorio lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal San Gregorio.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Mercedes. Tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta  relación tiene dos  hijas de 7 y un año, la mayor esta en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en petrocomercial. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque  los créditos son rápidos sin tantos requisitos, es la actual presidenta del Banco.
 
Es una muy buena ama de casa que además se dedica a la venta de ropa interior de damas  por catalogo de la marca Leonisa, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 17h00 ya que la mayoría de las ventas las realiza en su casa, hasta donde llegan sus clientes a comprar sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente. Su mercadería la recibe en una distribuidora en Portoviejo.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar ropa interior de damas ya que tiene varios encargos. Sus sueños son terminar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
In the outskirts of Portoviejo there is a village named San Gregorio where every two weeks the members of the community bank of San Gregorio meet.

Here we meet Mercedes. She is 28 years old, she is married and she has 2 daughters from this relationship, aged 7 and 1. The eldest attends school. Her husband works in a gas station. She is a founding member of the community bank. She enjoys being a member for the ease and timeliness of the loans granted. She is currently the leader of the bank.

She is a good house wife but in addition she also sells ladies' undergarments through a catalogue of the Leonisa brand name. She works every day from 8:30am to 5pm and she carries out most of her sales from her home.  Clients come to her to purchase products. She completes her sales on credit and she collects weekly payments.  She receives her merchandise from a distributor in Portoviejo. 

This loan will be used to purchase ladies' undergarments in order to fill some outstanding orders. Her dream is to finish her university training.

loans.use: To purchase ladies' undergarments for resale.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin M. is from the town of Banga. He is 44 years old, married and has 3 children aged 18, 13 and 6. Edwin owns & operates an agricultural  business, planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. He has been engaged in his business for 10 years now.

Edwin joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Edwin has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Edwin is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay his children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely B. is from the town of Labinay Ozamiz City. She is 18 years old and married with an infant child. To make a living, Mely owns and operates a transportation business. Her main source of income comes from providing motor transport services. Mely has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

Mely joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to repair her existing vehicle to provide better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mely from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair vehicle

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma B. is from the village of Villa Fermin Echague. She is 41 years old. Vilma is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Vilma owns & operates a store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling vegetables. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Vilma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Vilma from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson E. is from the village of Inaban Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 51 years old. Nelson is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Nelson owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Nelson has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP when he sells one of his raised pigs.

In 2009, Nelson joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelson has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Nelson is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Nelson from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

location.town: Inaban Dupax del Norte. Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace S. is from the village of Alanib, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 54 years old. Grace is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Grace owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & beverages in the local community. Grace has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & junk foods. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Grace from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Delia; la socia tiene 23 años de edad casada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia se dedica a la agricultura siembra lo que son papa, maiz, cebada y habas la socia lleva años en esta actividad conjuntamente con su esposo, la socia a la vez es ama de casa está al cuidado de sus hijos, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de abono y semillas para su chacra.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata". It is located in the community of Yuncaypata, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Delia. She is 23 years old, married, and she has 2 children. She is an agriculturist and she harvests potatoes, wheat, and fava beans. She has many years in the business, working together with her husband. She is a very happy person and she is very eager to keep working for the sake of her family.

She requests a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds for her fields.

She is happy for her loan and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds for her fields

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette F. is from the village of Poblacion one, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 31 years old. Suzette is married. Suzette owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling canned goods, junk food, beverages, shampoo, soap, & biscuits in the local community. Suzette has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2009, Suzette joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 17,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional inventory & for working capital. 

This loan will be her sixth from HSPFI. Suzette is requesting 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, detergents & biscuits. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI: 

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, detergents & biscuits

loans.name: Jane Njagi

texts.en: James Njagi is 44 years old and married to Margaret Njoki. He has four children, who are 27, 24, 19 and 13 years old. He is a mechanic and makes a living running a spare-parts business. He has been in this line of work for 10 years and earns about 10,500 Kenyan shillings a month. He was introduced to KADET by another member of our program and is applying for his first loan, which he plans to use to buy more spare parts for his shop. In the future, he hopes to own a big garage and give each of his children a high-quality education.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for a garage.

loans.name: Nueva Estrella Group

texts.es: En esta fotografia se muestra al grupo llamado “NUEVA ESTRELLA” el cual esta ubicado en el estado D. Puebla, México. El grupo esta conformado por 7 integrantes. La señora Epifania es una integrante del grupo, tiene una papeleria ubicada frente al kinder D. la localidad, comenta que ya tener varios años en este comercio y que le ha ido bien, dentro D. su negocio tambien venD. ropa, bolsas y un poco D. merceria, y aunque tiene una competencia cercana, ella dice que sa ha ganado la preferencia D. sus clientes para la compra D. sus articulos escolares, comentan algunas D. sus clientas q ella tiene carisma al atenderlas es muy sociable, da buen precio y les gusta la variedad D. productos que tiene. Este prestamo lo destinara a la compra D. más mercancia D. papeleria además que trabaja los domingos, las ganancias que obtenga lo utilizará para para invertir y hacer más granD. su negocio. Tiene el firme proposito D. construir un pasillo y llenarlo D. flores pues dice que le facinan. Ella tiene 67 años y estudio hasta la primaria, tiene 5 hijos, 3 hombre y 2 mujeres y busca lo mejor para ellos que tengan una mejor calidad D. vida y una carrera universitaria lo cual seria su más granD. orgullo.
texts.en:
In this photograph is the group called “Nueva Estrella” [New Star], which is located in the state of Puebla, in Mexico. The group is maD. up of 7 members. Epifania has a stationary store located in front of a kindergarten. She says she has been in this business for several years and that it has gone well for her. She also sells clothing, bags, and some sewing supplies. Even though she has competition nearby, she has that she has earned her customer’s preference as the place to buy their school supplies. Some of her clients tell us that she has charisma, is very friendly when she tends to them, she has good prices, and they like the variety of products that she has. 

She says that this loan will be used to buy more stationary merchandise. In addition to working on Sundays, she says that the earnings will be used to invest in expanding her store. She also plans to build a covered porch and fill it with flowers, because she’d love to see this on her property. She is sure that with the help of the institution, and with the support of the loans, [she will be successful]. 

She is 67 years old and studied through primary school. She has 5 children—3 boys and 2 girls. She wants the best for them and wants them to have a better quality of life and a university degree, which would be her greatest priD..

loans.use: to buy stationary products.

loans.name: Groupe 2 De Benkadi Ii

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe 2 de l’association ASS BENKADI  II  sont des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 31  ans et  en moyenne  3 enfants. EIles vivent avec leurs maries et leurs enfants à MEMISSALA, un village situé à environ 30 km de la ville de NIENA région de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur cinquième cycle de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés avec satisfaction. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du maïs, du riz, d’arachide, de gombo etc et dont les ventes font l’objet d’une réelle rentabilité dans la zone.
MAMOU compte acheter, 1 sac d’urée, 1/2 sac de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 10 000 à 15 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of group 2 of the association BENKADI  II  are married women with an average age of 31 and on average, three children. They live with their husbands and their children in MEMISSALA, a village situated about 30 km from the town of NIENA, Sikasso region, third administrative region of Mali. 

These clients are on their fifth seasonal loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy their average farming expenses and agricultural entrants. Their former loans have been reimbursed satisfactorily. 

This group of women grow maize, rice, peanuts and okra, etc., crops which can be sold quite profitably in their area. 

MAMOU wishes to buy one sack of urea (fertilizer), one half sack of cereal complex, and use the rest of the loan to pay for plowing and weeding. She expects to make an average profit of 10,000 to 15,000 F CFA which will be used for day-to-day expenses of her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural entrants and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Bidala

texts.en:
Bidalla is a married woman with one child who is an adult. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a green grocery business, selling household consumption items like tomatoes, vegetables and fruit. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Bidalla dreams of establishing a cereals shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, potatoes and bundles of maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of green vegetables, potatoes and bundles of maize flour.

loans.name: Angel Adolfo

texts.en:
Angel lives in the Choluteca region of Honduras where he operates a small eatery. He has enjoyed success due to his business’ convenient location in the village center, as well as the quality of his food. 

Angel wakes each day at five in the morning to begin preparing local dishes for his customers. He is requesting a loan of Lps. 20,000 to purchase ingredients that will be used in food preparation.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, sausages, chicken, cornmeal, corn, tomatoes, lettuce, beans, rice, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Nixon

texts.en:
Nixon is 45 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.  He is happily married with three school-aged children.

Nixon is a farmer.  He plants rice and harvests palay to earn a living which is the only means of his subsistence for the family.  He has been engaged in this type of business for over 15 years.  Every quarter, he earn PHP 30,000.00 from this work.  He has requested a loan of PHP 10,000.00 from GDMPC to purchase organic fertilizers (chicken dung).

Nixon has been member of GDMPC for one year.  In the future, Nixon hopes to produce more palay and gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizers (chicken dung)

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad from Madaba, Jordan is 25 years and has a grocery store.

Ahmad is just starting his project and is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to purchase more products for the store.

An aspiration of Ahmad is to improve his project and expand it to include frozen food. He is looking to increase his income and sales volume so that he can get married.

loans.use: to purchase more products for sale in his store

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Agé de 41 ans, Monsieur Moussa est marié et père de 5 enfants, et vit dans une famille polygame. Il  habite dans le quartier Médina coura de la ville  de la préfecture de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Du à des raisons sociales  il abandonne les études depuis l’école fondamentale pour s’adonner aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de son frère. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réelle réussite, il décide de s’intéresser à l’achat vente de poissons fumés  il y’a 18 ans. Sa notoriété est bonne, car il reçoit beaucoup de clients par semaine.  
Pour pouvoir augmenter son fonds de commerce et renforcer sa capacité de vente, il décida de  rejoindre  l‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 1 an. Il est à son deuxième  prêt individuel  et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé. Monsieur Moussa  compte acheter, 7 paniers de poissons fumés  à Korientzé  (Région de Mopti) auprès des  pêcheurs et effectue sa vente au marché de poisson de Koutiala  à une clientèle  mixte, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. Avec ce prêt  il compte  réaliser un bénéfice de 100.000FCFA par mois qu’il utilisera  pour  le remboursement du prêt de Soro Yiriwaso, satisfaire ses besoins  et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Moussa is 41 years old, married and a father of five living in a plural family.  He lives in the Médina Coura district of the city, in the Koutiala prefecture (Sikasso region).  

Due to social circumstances, he dropped out of elementary school to pursue income-generating activities with his brother.  After running several businesses without any real success, he decided to get into smoked fish sales 18 years ago.  He has a good reputation, because he gets a lot of customers each week.

A year ago, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso MFI in order to increase his business capital and sales capacity.  He is currently on his second individual loan; his previous loan was paid back normally.  Moussa plans on purchasing 7 baskets of smoked fish from fishermen at Kourientzé (Mopti region), and selling them retail to a varied clientele, for cash or credit, at the Koutiala fish market.  With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 100,000 CFA francs per month, which he will use to pay back Soro Yiriwaso for the loan and to meet his own needs, with any remaining funds being invested in his business.

loans.use: to purchase smoked fish

loans.name: La Chorrera Group

texts.es:
el grupo La Chorrera esta ubicado en el caserio la Chorrera de El Triunfo, Choluteca, esta integrado por dos mujeres y un hombre, todos tienen varios años de conocerse y trabajan juntos para salir adelante con sus familias.
doña Tereza que es la cordinadora del grupo se dedica a la venta de utencilios fabricados de plastico, Teresa cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de su esposo para ayudarle a vender sus productos.
su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el caserio la Chorrera en su casa de habitacion y sus clientes son personas del mismo lugar en donde vive.
el credito lo invertira para la compra de utencilios de plastico y asi surtir mas su negocio y tener mas variedad de productos.
el sueño de Teresa es poder tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
La Chorrera Group is located in the small town of La Chorrera de El Triunfo, Choluteca, and is made up of two women and one man. They have known each other for several years and work together so their families can get ahead.
Teresa, who is the group coordinator, sells plastic utensils. Her children and her husband help her sell her products.
Her business is located in the small town of La Chorrera in her home, and her customers are people who live in her town.
She will invest the loan to buy plastic utensils so that she can better supply her business and have a greater variety of products.
Teresa’s dream is to be able to have a larger business.

loans.use: to buy plastic plates, cups, serving bowls, buckets, and water jugs.

loans.name: Dominga Francisca

texts.es:
La Señorea Dominga Francisca se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajador debido a que ha sabido llevar el bien estar de su casa y a logrado mantener a su familia que tanto ama y Estima en mejores condiciones. Ella se caracteriza por ser una excelente trabajadora y con buenos valores morales ha hecho que se gane el aprecio de muchas personas de su municipio. 
 Actual mente a acudido a Ceprodel El Sauce, con el fin de solicitar un crédito para ampliar las condiciones de su vivienda, para ello está solicitando el crédito, para la compra de materiales de construcción, tales como: Arena, Sementó, ladrillo y sin  con esto empezara a la construcción de un anexo a su vivienda (Cocina), para las mejores condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dominga Francisca G. is notable in the town for being a very hardworking person who has known how to provide wellbeing for her home and managed to keep her family that she so loves and is fond of in the best possible living conditions.  She is noted for being an excellent worker with high moral standards that have led to her being held in high regard by many people in her town.

She came by Ceprodel-El Sauce to request a loan to enlarge her home.  This is the reason she’s asking for the loan: to buy building materials and supplies like: sand, cement, bricks and metal sheeting to start adding on to her home (kitchen) to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, bricks and metal sheeting.

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en:
Ngan is 35 years old, married and has two children. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City.

Ngan and her husband earn money by cooking and selling sweet soup.  She intends to use her loan to buy ingredients and different types of beans, such as soya beans and green beans, to cook a variety of sweet soups.  Doing so will help Ngan attract more clients and increase her earnings. 

She hopes that this will help her improve her family's living conditions and enable her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and beans to make sweet soup for selling.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old and lives in a community by the airport.  She is married and her husband works at Firestone.  They have five children between the ages of 15 to 20 years old.  For the past five years she has been selling red (palm) oil, a business she learned from her mother.  

Mary is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil for her business.  The main problem she faces is the payment of her children school fees.  Mary plans to build her house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 54 years old, married, and a mother of three children who are between 18 and 30 years old. Margret sells clothes in Mariakani, a business that has been in operation for the last four years and it has been a success. 

Margret was recently introduced to KADET LTD and this marks her first borrowing to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase a bale of clothes. 

The anticipated profits will be plowed back into her business and the repayment of the loan. Her dream is to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of clothes

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy tiene 41 años, es una mujer responsable y muy trabajadora, ella esta casada y es madre de una hija de 14 años. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, además de la compañía de su mamá. Lucy es dueña junto a su esposo de una botica ubicada en una zona muy concurrida de un asentamiento humano, ahí ella tiene todo tipo de medicamentos legales y permitidos según el estado, además tiene la asesoría de un químico farmacéutico. Esta botica esta en su casa y en ocasiones atiende su hija. Lleva ya cuatro años en este actividad, y le esta yendo muy bien. Por otro lado tiene un trabajo adicional en el consultorio de su cuñado, como asistente; y ya por las tardes se dedica a su botica. Su plan es tener otra sucursal en el distrito de Yarinacocha. Este será el primer crédito con MFP, puesto que amigas le propusieron ingresar al grupo, puesto que así logrará mejorar su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, comprará medicamentos legales para su botica.
texts.en: Lucy is 41 years old. She is a responsible and very hard-working woman. She is married and the mother of a 14-year-old daughter. Together they live in their own house, along with her mother. Together with her husband, Lucy is the owner of a pharmacy located in a busy area of a settlement. There she has all kinds of legal, state-permitted medicines, and she also has a pharmaceutical chemist consultant.  This pharmacy is in her house, and her daughter watches it on occasion. She has been doing this for four years, and it is going well for her. She also has another job in her brother-in-law's practice, as an assistant; in the afternoons, she runs her pharmacy. Her plan is to have another branch in the Yarinacocha district. This will be her first loan with MFP. Her friends invited her to join the group, since through it she will be able to improve her business. With the amount requested, she will buy legal medicines for her pharmacy.

loans.use: to purchase medicines permitted by the health ministry.

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Umoja Group in Western Kenya! Rose is the facilitator of the Umoja group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rose takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Rose had an excellent maize yield harvesting 17 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Rose was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land.
