With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rose and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Rose will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock.

In 2012, the members of Umoja group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and pay for labour.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a widow. She lost her husband a few years ago to a sudden death, which was a great tragedy for her family. But she never lost hope. She started a decorative embroidery and sewing business to afford her children's living expenses. She is the mother of four sons and two daughters. Only her youngest daughter is studying, because her other children couldn’t complete their educations due to financial constraints.

Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her business. With the loan investment, she will buy unstitched clothes in bulk quantities. Then she will sew them and add beautiful embroidery in order to sell them for a higher profit. She has been operating her business for many years, and she is confident that her business will be successful after receiving her loan.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Shahnaz.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her sewing and embroidery business.

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es: Julio Antonio tiene 39 años de edad, su actividad económica es la venta de ropa usada que es un negocio bastante reconocido dentro del comercio. Julio tiene 3 hijos a su cargo que todavía esta estudiante, que con mucho esfuerzo a sacado adelante a su familia, es un emprendedor con metas y sueños que desea salir adelante con su negocio que actualmente maneja, su esposa lo apoyo en todo para que ambos salgan adelante. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para invertir  en la compra de  pacas de ropa usada y también en ropa nueva en esta temporada del mes de diciembre que es cuando las ventas están buenas y que su clientela fija y eventuales los visite y brindarles un mejor servicio.
texts.en: Julio Antonio is 39 years old. His economic activity is selling used clothing, which is a rather well-known business in commerce. Julio has three children in his care who still are in school and, with a lot of effort, he has gotten his family ahead. He is an entreprenuer with goals and dreams who wishes to get ahead with his business that he currently manages. His wife supports him in everything so that they both can get ahead. Currently he is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of bales of used clothing and also in new clothing in this season of the month of December which is when sales are good and his regular customers, to whom he provides good service, visit.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing as well as new clothing.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en: Jenifer, 25 years old, is single and has one child, who is in school. She has operated a food stall business in Yambio, South Sudan, for six years. Jenifer is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and cassava flour. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and cassava flour

loans.name: Maylinda

texts.en:
Maylinda, 32, is a married woman with three children aged 9, 7 and 5. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Maylinda has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for three years. She sells items like canned goods, coffee, shampoo and soap. She also sells banana cue (deep-fried bananas covered with caramelized brown sugar) to her community. She earns 5,000 PHP per month with her business.

Maylinda has requested this loan to buy sugar and bananas and more items to sell, such as canned goods. Maylinda hopes her business will grow.

loans.use: to buy sugar and bananas and more items to sell, such as canned goods.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 37 years old, married and has four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Marlyn has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase additional stocks of fish to sell.
Marlyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of fish to sell.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 41 years old, married and has five children. She sells food such as tea, rice and loaves of bread to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years and employs one person. She earns extra income from farming activities. 
Since she joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, Damaris has been able to grow her business and hopes to become financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy cooking oil, tea leaves and sugar.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, tea leaves and sugar.

loans.name: Zzzzzz

texts.en: Zzzzz is 32 years old. She is married with six children aged between 3 and 14 years; all of them go to school. She sells foodstuffs and has been in a business for 15 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine aged 20 years. She is not yet get married. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 2 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en: Jumwa is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a food stall where she cooks food for sell. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy stock of ingredients for preparing food. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to expand business.

loans.use: to buy stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the stock of clothes.

loans.name: Ab.satar

texts.en:
Ab.Satar is 64 years old and lives with his 4 children in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Ab.Satar has a bakery shop near the market. His main business is baking but he prefers the cashier's job in the bakery shop.
 
Ab.Satar took a 4th cycle loan through AFSG to buy flour and wood for his bakery shop so he can produce more bread to the people.

Ab.Satar now has 3 assistants. He wants to improve his business and financial income.

loans.use: To buy wood, flour

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn and her husband, David, have four children, all in primary school. David works with the divisional extension office in Animal Production at Angurai division.

He started the kerosene business in 2002 for Evelyn, who was then a housewife. This arose from the high demand for kerosene in his area. The business is doing well and this is his second loan with PEMCI, the first loan having been paid successfully. The first loan enabled them to open a store from which they run their business. With the proposed loan of $375 through Kiva, the couple intends to open a mini-market to complement their kerosene business, since there is none in the area.

loans.use: Buy kerosene for sale

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu K. is a mother of four children.  With a jobless husband, she manages multiple businesses to support the family. She runs a small shop in her home and, assisted by her young sister, Kadiatu, sells pans and second-hand clothes from door to door in addition to her small store.  Kadiatu uses the income to pay her children’s school expenses and daily needs for the the family. She joined SMT two years ago and invested her last loan to diversify her businesses and would like to take another loan to expand the business so that her husband can participate in hawking/door-to-door selling.

loans.use: Purchase stock of second-hand clothes and pans for addtional salesperson

loans.name: Ganu Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Ganu Chan T., 41 years old, lives in Bhaishipati, Lalitpur.  She has two sons and a daughter.  Both her sons are studying BBS (Bachelor of Business Studies) and her daughter is studying in grade 10.

Her Husband, Mr. Ragu Nath T., opened his electronic repair shop 8 years ago.  Now he needs a loan of $375 to buy electronic repair goods like screws, chips, and various parts for TVs, radios and other electronic goods, so Mrs. T. is asking for her fourth loan to invest in her husband's shop.

All members of her family depend on the shop for income because no other member in her family has a job.

loans.use: To buy electronic repair goods

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: The family has 4 members. The father works as a day laborer. The mother is a farmer who plants cashew trees. Their two children (14, 17 years old) are in the 8th and 11th class, and their average income is $12 per month/ person. They want to borrow $75 to invest in their cashew garden to provide their children’s school. One of their children is getting our project scholarship. They will pay back this loan in 5 months.

loans.use: Plant cashews

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga belongs to the Las Almendras ("The Almonds") community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ucayali. She is 62 years old and the mother of 4 children. Due to an illness, her husband can no longer work, though he can help her with household chores. To earn a living, Olga decided to open a small general store with an initial loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$100). She now counts on the store which she tends along with her children. They get up very early and tend the store after breakfast. The older children were already independent but they never forget the great efforts and sacrifices that their mother makes for them.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,000 (about US$336), to be repaid in 5 months, Olga will expand the store and buy bulk supplies of milk, rice, sugar, soft drinks and cooking oil.

Olga is very happy to have 4 healthy children who have completed school and to be with her husband despite the difficulties his poor health bring.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Olga pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Almendras, D. Jr. CahuiD. 403 D. Distrito D. Calleria D. Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 62 años y es madre D. 4 hijos, debido a una enfernedad su esposo no pueD. salir a trabajar, sin embargo si le ayuda en las tareas D. la casa. Por esta razón, Olga, con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/ 300 soles deciD. poner un pequeña bodega. En la actualidad cuenta con dicha bodega, la misma que atienD. junto con sus hijos, se levantanmuy temprano y después D. hacer el desayuno atienD. la bodega, sus hijos mayores ya se independizaron económicamente pero nunca olvidan el gran esfuerzo y sacrificio que hace su madre.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 1,000 (US$ 336.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, ampliará el local D. negocio y comprará 2 caja D. leche, 2 saco D. arroz, 2 saco D. azúcar, 5 cajas D. gaseosa y 3 bidones D. aceite.

Olga está muy contenta D. tener a sus 4 hijos sanos y haber logrado que terminen sus estudios, además D. estar junto a su esposo pese a las dificultades D. salud que tiene.

loans.use: Buy general merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is a hard-working entrepreneur from Melitopol, Ukraine. She has a profitable little business selling a variety of personal care products at an outdoor market near the train station in Melitopol. Lubov has been in business for the past twelve years. She sells a range of product brands and is also a licensed distributor of the Oriflame line of products. Lubov and her husband, Victor, have two daughters. One of her daughters is getting married soon and Lubov is planning to use profits from her business to help with wedding expenses.

Lubov has requested a loan of $1000 to help purchase new inventory for her business. She has benefited in the past with financial assistance from Nadiya Ukraine and has paid back all previous loans on time. We are happy to have another opportunity to help this dedicated entrepreneur as she works to earn a good living.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Maryam, 18, is the mother of 9-year-old son. She sells snacks, crispy chips, etc., and earn $7 a day, while her husband, M., does not have any job. She is asking for a loan of $75 to buy more goods. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Santa Catalina Poty Group

texts.en:
Celsa V. was the founder of this committee of women. She realized that there was a need for her women friends and neighbors to work together to augment their businesses and profits.

She went to the Fundación Paraguaya with her idea and a list of names and today eighteen women work together to gain loans and increase their businesses. Today the women are asking for a loan to buy different goods for their individual businesses. These businesses incluD. handicraft work, selling food goods and refreshments, and cleaning businesses.

loans.use: To buy clothes, different items to make handicrafts, material, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Rahma

texts.en:
Rahma is a 23 year old married woman with a 2 year old child. She and her husband also take care of 3 other children, ages18,14 and 12 years old. Rahma is started her charcoal and cloth selling business in 2007. Everyday, she works from 6am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $200 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Issah

texts.en:
Issah S. is a corn mill operator. He is married and has 2 children. Business is doing very well, and he wants to do some maintenance work on the machine. But his problem is lack of funds.

He is asking for $525 as additional funds to enable him to service his machine.

loans.use: As additional funds to enable him to service his machine

loans.name: Dinh Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Đinh Thị Tự, 40 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 2003. She has 3 children, two are still in school age. She farms and tends livestock. From a single pig at the beginning, she now frequently has 7-8 pigs. She releases pigs 3 or 4 times a year. Each earns her 500-600USD. With better income, she’s been filling her house with furniture and appliances. She is applying for a loan of 1000USD to buy more breeding pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Đinh Thị Tự, 40 T.ổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2003. 2 trong số 3 con của chị đang trong độ T.ổi đến trường. Công việc chính của chị hiện nay là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Từ một con lợn ban đầu số lợn hiện nay của chị đã lên 7-8 con. Mỗi năm chị xuất chuồng 3, 4 lứa lợn, mỗi lứa cho thu nhập 500-600USD. Thu nhập tăng, kinh tế phát triển, chị Tự đã sắm sửa thêm được nhiều vật dụng có giá trị trong gia đình. Vòng vốn này chị làm đơn xin vay 1000USD để mua thêm lợn giống.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru:
Mavjuda K. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 26 years old and has a high school education. Mavjuda owns a small food store where she sells food at below market prices. She is the only member of her large family who is currently working. Mavjuda would like to take out a loan for 12 months. She will use the loan to replenish the product assortment at her store.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Каюмова Мавжуда Убайдуллаевна жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст 26 лет, образование среднее.Мавжуда имеет небольшой продуктовый магазин.Где торгует продуктами питания,по ценам ниже рыночных. В ее большой семье в данное время работает только она. В данноей время клиентка хочет взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.На кредит она хочет пополнить ассортимент своего магазина.

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Nigorahon

texts.ru:
Nigorahon K. lives in the Vahdat town. She is 32 years old. She had secondary education and works as a secretary. In addition, she is in the business of cattle farming. At her house, she has one milk cow, which provides her with milk. Nagorahon uses this milk to produce dairy products. The demand had risen, and she decided to purchase an additional milk cow. To finance the purchase, she would like to obtain a loan for 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Каримова Нигорахон жительница города Вахдат . Возраст 32 года.Образование средне-техническое.Нигорахон работает секретаршей.Клиентка так же занимается животноводством. У ней в доме естьодна дойная корова,которая дает молоко.Из которого клиентка производит кисло-молочную продукцию и реализует соседям. Но спрос на ее продукцию возрос и поэтому Нигорахон решила купить еще одну дойную корову.Поэтому клиннтка хочет взять кредит сроком на 15 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Mrs. Carmela belongs to the "Los Chankas" Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin region, in the province and district of Lamas. Her business is located in a place she rents in the central market of Lamas. She sells meals, especially breakfast. She started in the food business in the market thanks to her aunt's idea, who motivated her. The profits from her new business are growing. She is doing very well, she has good clients whom she attends in a pleasant manner. Her excellent flavorings and the variety of her dishes complement her warm manner.

With this loan of US$275, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy the foodstuffs she needs for the daily preparation of her dishes, such as sugar, bags of rice, gallons of oil, packages of noodles, as well as the daily purchase of chicken, beef, pork and fish, greens, bananas, eggs, coffee, oatmeal, and boxes of different types of tea.

Mrs. Carmela is 47 years old. She lives with her husband and 3 children who help her during their free time. She works every day in order to help her children, who are in the upper grades, to get ahead. She is a very active woman whose goal is to see her children enter into careers, when she may think about a different type of business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

La señora Carmela pertenece al Banco Comunal Los Chankas, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Lamas y distrito de Lamas, su negocio está ubicado en un puesto que ella alquila en el mercado central de Lamas, se dedica a la venta de comida sobre todo desayunos. Se inicia en el negocio de la venta de comida en el mercado gracias a la idea de su tía, quien le motivo, con las ganas que le pone a su nuevo negocio, esta creciendo, pues le va muy bien, tiene buenos clientes a quienes atiende con un trato amable y carisma que le caracteriza, a ello se suma la buena sazón y la variedad en los platos que ofrece. Con este crédito de S/.800.00, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará insumos que necesita para la preparación diaria de sus platos, como azúcar, arroz en sacos, aceite en galón, fideos en paquetes, y demás insumos que compra a diario como carnes de pollo, res, cerdo y pescado, verduras, plátanos, huevos, café, avena, cajas de diferentes tipos de té. La señora Carmela tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijas quienes le apoyan en sus momentos libres, ella trabaja diariamente para sacar adelante a sus hijos quienes están en estudios superiores, es una mujer muy activa tiene como meta ver a sus hijos realizados con una carrera para luego pensar en otro tipo de negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale foodstuffs

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.en: Abdurasul S. is 33 years old. He is married with 4 children. His wife is a homemaker and takes care of their children. Abdurasul has a minivan and provides transportation services within the city of Khujand. By maintaining this business for 12 years, he has gained much experience. Initially he rented a car, but in time he saved money and bought his own minivan. The business is stable and generates the main income for Abdurasul’s family, allowing them to improve their living conditions. However, the business needs some funding, as Abdurasul is planning to fix his car in order to provide higher-quality services in the future. Today Abdurasul needs to purchase spare parts and pay for the repair of the minivan. For this purpose, he requests 3400 Somoni ($1,000) for the term of 10 months. As a client of IMON for several years already, Abdurasul had demonstrated himself to be a reliable client. He thanks all the lenders for their support and promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: To buy spare parts in order to repair his minivan

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en: Sokhoeun C. is 33 years old and lives with her husband and their two children, who are both students, across the Mekong River from Phnom Penh.  Having learned the trade of silk weaving from her mother eleven years ago, Sokhoeun is very productive and sells her products to a merchant who eventually distributed them in Phnom Penh.  Her husband, on the other hand, has worked as a taxi driver for about eight years.  In order to purchase more silk material and increase her productivity, Sokhoeun is requesting a loan of $500.

loans.use: To purchase more silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Hodoallo

texts.fr:
Madame B. Hodoallo est née le 31 décembre 1963 à Anié, localité située à 175km au nord de Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Depuis plus de 30 années, elle exerce le commerce de céréales (haricot, maïs, etc.) au marché d’Agoè.
Avec le revenu de cette activité, elle aide son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
Actuellement son stock est épuisé et elle désire s’approvisionner. A cet effet elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 15 sacs du haricot et 3 sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hodoallo B. was born the 31st of December, 1963 in Anié, a town situated 175 km north of Lomé. She is married and the mother of five children. For over 30 years, she has been selling grains (beans, corn, etc.) at the market in Agoe. With the revenue from this activity, she helps her husband with the family’s expenses. Right now, her stock has been depleted and she would like to replenish it. For this purpose, she is seeking her first loan, to buy 15 sacks of beans and 3 sacks of corn.

Translated from French by Abby Gray, Kiva Fellow

loans.use: to buy grains

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanny B., 27, and her husband, Mr. Run Kong, 24, live in a small village across Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2005 and have one little son.

Mrs. Vanny has been selling silk mangoes and food for two years. She cooks by herself for resale from her home. Her husband has been a horse cart driver and wooden house builder for three years. He learned his skills from his neighbors.

Vanny is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase mangoes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes for resale.

loans.name: Thai

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Thái  năm nay 58 tuổi, chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Chị đang sống cùng một người con đã trưởng thành tại thị xã Phúc Yên tỉnh Vĩnh phúc Hiện tại  công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị Thái là từ chăn nuôi lợn gà và trồng trọt với thu nhập  4.000.000đ/ tháng. Bên cạnh đó hàng tháng gia đình chị  còn có thêm  nguồn thu từ việc đi trông trang trại thuê cho người dân địa phương nên cuộc sống của chị và các con rất ổn định. Vòng vốn tới chị Thái mong muốn được vay thêm 15.000.000 đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn, gà về nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Thai is 58 years old, and she joined TYM fund since 2003. She lives with 1 grown child in the town of Phuc Yen province of Vinh Phuc. Currently the main source of income for her family is from raising pigs and growing vegetables with income of 230 USD per month. She also makes additional money by working for other farms in the area so the economic situation for her and her children is very stable. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 875 USD to purchase additional pigs and chickens to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising animals

loans.name: Solijon

texts.en:
E. Solijon is 36 years old and is married. Together with his wife they have four children, all of whom are still young and attending school. They are farmers who own a plot of land in their village and grow different kinds of crops like, wheat, potato, onion and other vegetables. They have been in this business since 2003. These crops are the main source of income for their family. To reduce the hard physical labour and to expand the business, Solijon would like to apply for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Las Tequileras Group

texts.es: En el grupo "Las Tequileras" podemos encontrar dos parentescos familiares entre la señora Luz Gabriela y la señora Moyra que son hermanas y entre la señora Virginia y su hija la señora Iris todas ellas tienen sus propios ingresos demostrando independencia económica. Este grupo se encuentra representado por la señora Luisa María y conformado por 19 miembros los cuales se dedican a la venta D. electrodomésticos, abarrotes, ropa, libros, cosméticos y a actividades como la panadería, la elaboración D. prendas D. vestir tejidas, artesanías y la atención en veterinaria. La competencia en cualquier rubro es granD. y dependerá el salir adelante D. la calidad D. vida y D. la experiencia en el mercado competitivo para hacer frente a cualquier adversidad. El financiamiento es para la adquisición D. herramientas, insumos y materiales para incrementar sus negocios y mejorar sus ingresos y poder brindad a sus hijos una mejor educación y una mejor calidad D. vida. Una mayoría D. los socios (as) cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios y saben como administrar sus fondos con responsabilidad y honestidad es por eso que la fundación Agrocapital les brinda la oportunidad D. una vida mejor.
texts.en:
The "Las Tequileras" group, represented by Mrs. Luisa Maria, has 19 members, some of whom are related. Luz Gabriela and Moyra are sisters, and Virginia and Iris are mother and daughter. Irrespective, these women live in different houses and their incomes are entirely separate from each other's. The group's members dedicate themselves to a variety of small businesses. Some sell things like electrical appliances, groceries, clothing, books, cosmetics and snacks; some make garments and crafts; and one runs a small veterinary clinic. Their collective knowledge and experience in their respective markets gives them confidence that they will be able to confront adversity and come out ahead. The loan will be used to buy tools, ingredients and primary materials, so that the group members can expand their businesses and increase their incomes in order to be able to offer their children better educations and a better quality of life. The majority of the group's members have experience with communal banking and know how to manage loan repayments responsibly and honestly, and how to take full advantage of this opportunity offered by the Agrocapital Foundation for a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lim

texts.en: Lim S., 29, is married with two young children and resides with her husband in Siem Reap, Cambodia. She stays at home looking after her children and cooking for her family members. To earn a living, her husband, pictured here, is a mechanic, making US$9 per day. This couple would like to take out a loan to repair their leaking roof.

loans.use: To repair their leaking roof.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Rosa G. M. tiene 34 años, vive en el caserío de Cruz de Pargo, distrito de Salpo, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio primaria completa, dejo de estudiar debido a que sus padres no tenían los medios económicos para seguir apoyándola y se dedico a ayudar a su madre en los quehaceres del hogar. Tiene 02 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella. 
Carmen tiene una bodega, cuando inició su negocio se dedicaba a la venta de quesillo y a la compra-venta de animales; tuvo una bodega en mache donde vivió con su esposo 4 años y al regresar a cruz de pargo vendió sus animales y puso su tienda con unos cuantos abarrotes que poco a poco ha ido surtiendo, su negocio se desarrolla en su propio domicilio
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Luchando por el Progreso”, lo invirtió en la compra de quesillo.
Con el crédito de 800 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de quesillo y animales para la venta.
Carmen sueña con tener una bodega muy surtida y ver a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa G. M. is 34 years old and lives in Cruz de Pargo, Salpo district, in La Libertad, Perú. She completed her primary school studies, but couldn’t finish her education because her parents didn’t have the financial means to continue to support her. She decided to help her mother with the household chores. She has 2 children who depend on her economically. Carmen has a general store where, when she started, she sold quesillo (a local cheese) and bought/sold animals. She had a grocery store in Mache where she lived with her husband for 4 years and, upon returning to Cruz de Pargo, she sold her animals and started her store with some items that she has slowly supplied. She runs her business out of her own home. With the first loan of 300.00 soles that she received from the “Luchando por el Progreso” (“Fighting for Progress”) cooperative bank, she invested in the purchase of quesillo. With the loan of 800.00 soles, to be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in quesillo and animals to sell. Carmen dreams of having a well-stocked store and of seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase quesillo (a local cheese) and animals to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad Yousof

texts.en:
Mohammad Yousof is the son of A.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 40 and has 6 children. He is a farmer and is interested in farming so much. Every morning he wakes up early and goes to his land to start work and because of the irrigation of his land he has lots of clients coming to his land to buy fresh vegetables.

He would like to expand his business and purchase more and different kinds of seeds, so he has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months. He would like to say that he admires the effectiveness of the loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: purchasing different kinds of seeds

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia Z., 38, is married and has three children, one son and two daughters.  According to her, all her children are in the junior high and primary schools.  She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.  Amalia works to support her husband financially to provide for the family.  Her husband is a commercial driver.  She trades textiles materials – linen, lace, printed textiles etc.  Amalia procures goods from Accra.  She hawks to sell in her community and also treks to sell in other towns as well.  Amalia has been in business for twelve years and wants a loan to procure textiles in bulk.  She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: Procure textiles.

loans.name: Cristencia

texts.pt:
Cristencia C. é natural de Xai-xai distrito capital da província de Gaza, tem 37 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 6 filhos, o primeiro tem 18 anos e os últimos que são gémeos tem 9 meses de idade respectivamente. Alem dos filhos sustenta a sua mãe enviando periodicamente dinheiro ou géneros alimentícios.

Cristencia estudou 5ªclasse e parou por falta de condições. Cristencia mudou da província de Gaza para Maputo quando se casou a 12 anos atrás, neste momento vive no distrito de Boane,  gestora de um negocio e dona do mesmo tendo um estabelecimento comercial qual abra as 7h e fecha as 18h deste negocio tem um rendimento mensla de 6000,00mt.

Cristencia solicita empréstimo pela segunda vez na Hluvuku e primeira no Kiva, com qual pretende auementar o seu estoque, futuramente pretende solicitar outro empréstimo para ter mais estabelecimentos.
texts.en:
Cristencia C. is a native of the Xai-xai capital district in Gaza Province. She is 37 years old, married and mother of 6 children. The first is 18 years old and the youngest are 9-month-old twins. In addition to her children, she supports her mother by sending her money or food items periodically.

Cristencia attended school through the 5th grade and stopped due to financial circumstances. She moved from Gaza Province to Maputo when she got married 12 years ago. At this time, she lives in the Boane district, managing a business that she owns. It is a commercial establishment which opens at 7 am and closes at 6 pm. She has monthly revenue from this business of 6000 meticais.

Cristencia is requesting a loan for the second time from Hluvuku and the first from Kiva, and she plans to use it to increase her stock. In the future, she plans to request another loan to have more stores.

Translated from Portuguese by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell various products

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn S. is from the city of Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old,  is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Lyn owns & operates a vegetable business; her main source of income comes from planting & harvesting vegetables for sale. Lyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and run her business.  Lyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Lyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 35-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon. Ali has been working in furniture painting and repair for twenty years. Ali has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.

Ali is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he had difficulty networking. Ali decided on this business because he wanted to have independent work and improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase furniture repair tools

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny tiene 33 años, vive con su hijo pequeño de 4 años en la casa de sus padres. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a los bordados, su tarea es combinar hilos de colores y diseñar un bello dibujo que armonice con el modelo de la falda, esta es una prenda típica utilizada para las festividades de su zona. Los bordados que realiza son mediante pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, quienes conocen de su buen trabajo. Durante las fiestas, llamadas generalmente “fiestas patronales” y “el santiago” (danza típica de su localidad) ha visto el incremento de los trabajos que le solicitan y eso hace más rentable su negocio. Por eso, Marleny ve el futuro con grandes expectativas de crecimiento, piensa contratar a personas que borden en su futuro taller de faldas típicas. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella está muy entusiasmada por el trabajo que piensa realizar en su grupo, razón por la que se compromete a ser muy colaboradora. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de hilos y telas para responder a los nuevos pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marleny, 33, lives with her small four year old son in her parents’ house. For ten years she has been embroidering. Her job is to combine the colored thread and design a pretty picture that harmonizes with the style of the skirt. This is the typical outfit used for festivals in her area. Her customers, who know her good work, place orders and she embroiders to fill those orders. During the festivals, which are called “fiestas patronales” (patron saint celebrations), and the “el Santiago” (typical regional dance), she has seen an increase in her orders. This makes her business more profitable. Marleny has big growth expectations for the future. She is thinking of hiring people to embroider in her future typical skirts shop. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very enthusiastic about the work she will do with her group. She promises to work very collaboratively. She will use the money she is asking for to buy thread and fabric to use for the new orders her customers have made.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials

loans.name: Hilaria Vicenta

texts.es:
La señora HILARIA VICENTA Z. R., tiene 52 años, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Mar y Cielo II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 2º de primaria porque vivía en la sierra en el pueblo de Calipuy a donde no llegaban los profesores. Tiene 5 hijos de 23, 21, 18, 15 y 11, solo los dos últimos dependen económicamente de ella porque se encuentran estudiando. 
HILARIA  se dedica a la venta de menús y cerveza en su domicilio.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compro productos alimenticios y utensilios para preparar sus menús.
Este crédito de 1200 lo invertirá en la compra de productos alimenticios como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, papas, menestras, fideos, harinas, etc para la preparación de sus menús; también comprará mesas y sillas.  Parte del dinero lo utilizará para remodelar de su local. 
HILARIA suena con ampliar su local y ambientarlo; para alquilarlo a eventos como: matrimonio, bautizos, etc.
texts.en:
Hilaria Vicenta Z. R. is 52 years old and lives in the district of La Esperanza, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad in Peru. She is the mother of five children aged 23, 21, 18, 15 and 11. Only the two youngest are in her care as they are still going to school. Hilaria, for her part, studied only until second grade because she lived in the village of Calipuy up in the mountains, where no teachers came.

Hilaria sells meals and beer at her home.

She is a member of the Communal Bank "Mar y Cielo II" (Sea and Sky II). She used her first loan of 300 nuevos soles to buy ingredients and utensils to prepare her dishes. This loan of 1200 nuevos soles will be invested in the purchase of ingredients to her meals, such as rice, sugar, oil, potatoes, vegetables, noodles and flour. Furthermore, she will buy tables and chairs. Part of her loan will be used to remodel her premises. Hilaria dreams of expanding her restaurant and making it more attractive, so that she can have wedding, baptism and similar parties.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare her meals; to buy tables and chairs; to remodel her restaurant.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is a 49-year-old single woman who aspires of becoming an entrepreneur. She lives with her mother, brother, niece and nephew. Her family has been into rice production (rice farming) business since 25 years ago. Josefina's 81-year-old mother and her brother's children are dependent to her and her brother financially. Income of her brother from fishing is so insufficient to sustain the family and also the business. Josefina wants to finance their family business managed by her brother therefore she joined ASHI just this month be able to get a loan. She is hoping that through loans she will be getting from ASHI after paying the other, her family's rice production business would grow and that she can help her brother send her children to school until college.She also wants to give her mother a quality kind of life while she still lives.

loans.use: To finance a rice production (rice farming ) business.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a businessman from Novomoskovsk where he sells women’s clothing, yarn and sewing supplies in the central marketplace. He has been in this business for 2 years. Presently, Alexander has about 6,000 Grivnyas in gross income. 

Alexander is seeking a loan of 10,200 Grivnyas to increase his working capital and to increase his trade as a result. His type of merchandise is unique at the market and always stays in demand among his loyal customers. Alexander is very energetic and he is determined to develop his small venture in the future. He believes lending assistance will be instrumental in achievement of this goal.

loans.use: To increase his turnover capital.

loans.name: Labor For Profit Group

texts.en:
James F. is a Liberian businessman living in Foyah Town in Lofa County. He is married and has two children in elementary school. As he is illiterate himself, his children's education is very important to him.

James has been selling dry goods (particularly housewares) for about two years now. He faces challenges with financial shortages, but he is successful in attracting his customers through good treatment and speech.

He dreams of building a provision shop which will enable him to cater to his children's education as well as to ensure good medical treatment for all of them.

loans.use: To buy additional housewares for sale

loans.name: G.s. Voluntad De Dios Group

texts.es:
Grupo Solidario Voluntad de Dios is made of up three dedicated members, María de la Concepción A., Juan Doroteo M. T., and Fania Yudel V. E..  The three are from the same  community and have a strong credit history together. Each has received loans previously and as a result has seen their respective businesses grow.

María will use this loan to purchase used clothing for her resale shop, the loan allows her to buy in bulk and therefore receive a better price. She will also buy chickens and pigs in order to supplement the income of her store. For fifteen years her store has supported she and her two children, ages 10 and 13, they are both in school. Maria dreams of being able to afford home improvements such as building brick walls.

Juan is married and has five children, the eldest two are more than 20 years old, the rest are still in school.  Of late his family faces the difficulty of Sugar Disease which Juan’s wife has fallen ill with. Juan used other loans to purchase a cart and a horse to pull it. This loan will go towards improvements to the cart and the purchase of wood for resale. Juan has sold wood and driven his carriage for thirteen years since he fell ill and could not work in the fields. He dreams that his business will continue to provide for his children’s education. 

Fania Yudel is single with a 2 year old son. Past loans have gone to the purchase of children’s clothing for resale, this loan will be for cosmetics and ingredients materials to make enchiladas. The biggest problem Fania Yudel faces is low sales. To address this she has a diversity of enterprises to best take advantage of her customers needs. This strategy seems to be working and Fania Yudel dreams of building her own house.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Sawuda

texts.en: Sawuda is 35-years old. She cares for her own two children and two of her late uncle’s children living. Three of the children are currently in school. To support her household, she sells cereals like beans, maize, millet, rice and groundnuts in the community market to her loyal customers. She has a lot of experience in this business which she has been engaged in since her childhood. She takes delivery of stock from the farming communities in the northern part of Ghana. She is requesting a loan to expand the amount of stock she has to offer. An improved income will help her support her household, especially in helping with the children's eduction.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals like groundnut, rice, maize, millet and beans.

loans.name: Diarra

texts.fr: Diarra D. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle vend des fruits de saison : mandarine, orange, pomme. En même temps elle fait un petit commerce de beignets qu’elle fait elle même. Son objectif est d’augmenter les revenus familiaux.
texts.en:
Diarra D., age 39, is married and the mother of 6 children. She sells seasonal fruits : mandarines, oranges, apples. At the same time, she runs a small business selling homemade doughnuts. Her goal is to increase the income of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell seasonal fruits (mandarines, oranges, apples)

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a young Palestinian man, 29 years old. He is married with three young children.

Ali is a police officer in the Palestinian National Authority and his monthly salary hardly covers his family’s daily expenses Unfortunately, one of his children, aged five years, is suffering from a disease of the blood which requires special health treatment in addition to lots of medicine.

Ali requested 500 USD from FATEN to buy medicine and pay some of the medical fees for his child, Ali knows that this kind of problem will be eternal with his child and he will always depend on medicine to survive. He decided to take small amount of money to meet his current need and at the same time the monthly payment is affordable. 

Ali appears in the photo at FATEN office.

loans.use: To buy his child's medicine

location.town: Idna Village, Hebron City, West Bank

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana R. is from the town of Turod Norte, Cordon. She is 50 years old. Susana is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Susana owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling snacks to local community members.

In 2009, Susana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susana is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Susana from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly comprised of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi T. is 44 and married with 6 children (ages 4 - 25).  She owns a business venture raising cattle.  Naomi has 5 years of experience in this business.  Naomi needs a loan of WST $1500. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 tala or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Naomi joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Naomi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Naomi T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Abdel Latif

texts.en: Abdel Latif is a 20-year-old single man. In 2007, this young man decided to open a coffee shop as his own business after seeing a need for such services in the region. Today, Abdel Latif is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy a new coffee machine.

loans.use: To buy a new coffee machine

loans.name: Pastor

texts.es:
Pastor González de 60 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento solo cuenta con luz como servicios básicos, su esposa es ama de casa con ella tiene 2 hijos uno de 17 años y de 13 años estudiantes de escuelas particulares. 

Pastor empezó hace 15 años atrás con la elaboración de helados poco a poco implemento hielo en funda y siguió creciendo en esta actividad ya que le generaba muy buenas ganancias.

Ahora el trabaja todos los días desde las 10h00 hasta las 17h00 vendiendo helados de coco, frutilla, leche, chicle, hielo en funda, esencias de frutas, coco rallado etc. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene es la delincuencia en el sector donde vive. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar azúcar, coco, esencias, leche para tener más productos que vender. De aquí a unos 5 años el quiere tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Pastor González is 60 years old and lives in the Fortin district in the outskirts of Guayaquil. His house is made of cement and only has one basic service, which is electricity. His wife is a homemaker and with her he has 2 children, one who is 17 and another who is 13. They study in a private school. Pastor started out 15 years ago making ice cream. Gradually, he established a business selling ice in bags, and continued to grow this business, since it generated very good earnings. Now he works each day from 10am until 5pm selling ice creams flavored with coconut, strawberry, and milk, as well as chewing gum, bagged ice, fruit extracts, grated coconut and other items. One of the drawbacks is that there is a lot of crime in the area where he lives. With the loan he will buy sugar, coconut, extracts, and milk so that he can have more products to sell. Five years from now he would like to have a store.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sugar, coconut, milk and fruit

loans.name: Marlid

texts.es:
La Sra. C. Saldaña Marlid de 22 años de edad, vive en el Asentamiento Oscar Sánchez Dulanto  - Cercado de Ica ella vive con su esposo quien es mototaxista y tienen un hijo de 3 años de edad ellos viven en casa de su madre de ella quien es obrera de campo.
Los sres han construido una parte de la casa que le han dado ya que con el terremoto se quedaron sin casa y nuevamente se están superando.
Ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y aguas minerales en el cruce de Puente Blanco y Divino Maestro- Ica (Panamericana Sur) en la temporada de verano desde hace 4 años y en invierno trabaja en el campo como obrera es una persona bien responsable.
Los conyuges desean que le apoyemos para que la sra pueda invertir mas en el negocio y al mismo tiempo mejorar su vivienda ya que su anhelo es darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
C. Saldaña Marlid is 22, and she lives in Asentamiento Oscar Sánchez Dulanto near Ica. She lives with her husband, a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) driver. They have a three year old son, and they live in her mother’s house. She is a field worker. They have built part of the house they were given. They were given the house because they were left without a house due to the earthquake. They are getting ahead once again. She sells soft drinks and mineral water at the Puente Blanco and Divino Maestro-Ica (South Pan-American) crossing. She has been selling in the summertime for four years. In the winter she works in the field. She is a very responsible person. The couple wants us to help them so that she is able to invest more in the business and improve their house at the same time. Her goal is to give her son a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Jose Romulo

texts.es:
El señor José P. es el único socio varón del banco Comunal Siempre Amigas, vive a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca en la comunidad San Pedro parroquia El Valle, esta parroquia se caracteriza por alta producción de maíz, papas, etc., teniendo como atractivos turísticos,  la colina de Tasqui la cual nos regala una hermosa vista de la parroquia y de la ciudad de Cuenca.

José es sastre de profesión  para el cual estudio un año en el Gremio de  Artesanos para obtener su titulo profesional, pero desde sus 14 años trabajaba junto a sus hermanos que le enseñaron éste arte,  posee un pequeño taller en su casa y no tiene horario fijo para trabajar ya que es su propio jefe.

Este es su segundo crédito en la fundación y fue su hermana quien lo incentivó para formar parte de este grupo, tiene 26 años de edad,  casado y es padre de dos hijos, una niña  de 5 años  y un  bebe de 7 meses, su esposa es  costurera y trabaja en un almacén, no tiene casa propia y viven en casa desu suegra.

Con el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le otorgue  va a comprar techo Ardex para seguir en la construcción de  su casa propia que es uno de sus sueños y espera pronto verlo cristalizado.
texts.en:
Señor José P. is the only male member of the communal bank Friends Forever. He lives on the outskirts of Cuenca in the community of San Pedro, El Valle parish. This area is known for its high production of corn, potatoes, etc., with tourist attractions such as Tasqui hill that gives a beautiful view of the parish and the city of Cuenca. José is a tailor by profession. He studied one year in the Artisans Guild to get his professional credential, but he has worked with his brothers since the age of 14 learning this art. He has a small shop in his house and does not have a fixed work schedule since he is his own boss. This is his second loan through the foundation, it was his sister who encouraged him to join this group. He is 26, married, and the father of two children, a 5-year-old daughter and a baby of 7 months. His wife is a seamstress working in a shop, they do not have their own home, but are living in the home of his in-laws. With this new loan through FUNDACION ESPOIR, he will buy Ardex roofing to proceed with the construction of his own home, which is one of his dreams and which he hopes to see realized very soon.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of roofing material

loans.name: Aishat

texts.en:
Aishat is 50 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a building contractor and he also supports their home. She is a hardworking woman. She makes a living selling shoes at retail prices to her customers. 

She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more shoes to sell. She loves this business because it is highly profitable and she has the opportunity to interact with her customers. She hopes to grow her business. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders in anticipation of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud M. is a 21 years old, single man from Gaza. He is living with his parents and 5 siblings. Since 2007, he has been working in a meat store. Now, he is hoping that through this loan he will be able to buy meat and frozen fish for his store, which will bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: buy meat and frozen fish to sell

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha tiene 45 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Héctor (48), que es agricultor, y de sus 7 hijos menores.

La vida en el campo es muy sacrificada, ya que los agricultores deben esforzarse a diario para que sus cosechas no se pierdan. Esto lo sabe muy bien Bertha, quien se despierta cada día desde muy temprano para vigilar sus cultivos de papa y olluco para que las plagas y las condiciones climáticas no malogren su trabajo. A ella le gusta mucho sembrar para que después de varios meses de mucha dedicación logre cosechar y posteriormente vender.
En esta labor trabaja junto a su esposo, ambos se esfuerzan para que la cosecha sea fructífera, aunque dice que cuando la cosecha aumenta mucho contratan operarios para que les ayuden a recoger la producción y limpiar los campos. Para más adelante tiene pensado empezar a sembrar alverja y habas, ya que los precios de estos productos se mantienen estables en el mercado.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Aunque su grupo comunal se ha disminuido, los pocos integrantes que quedan trabajan de manera puntual y responsable en el pago de sus cuotas.

Bertha tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono y fertilizantes, pues quiere asegurar sus tierras para las próximas siembras.
texts.en:
Bertha is 45 years old, lives in her own house along with her farmer husband, Héctor (who is 48), and their 7 young children. Life in the countryside requires many sacrifices and farmers must strive daily to ensure that their crops are not lost. Bertha knows this very well, and she gets up very early every day to guard her crops of potatoes and other root vegetable and make sure that pests and bad weather don't ruin her work. She loves to grow crops because, after some months and much dedication, she can harvest and later sell them. She works alongside her husband in these tasks, and they both strive for a fruitful harvest. However, she says that when the harvest is very large, they hire workers to help them gather the produce and clear the fields. For the future, she is thinking of starting to grow peas and beans as the prices of these products in the market are steady. This is the fourth loan that she has had with MFP and she is very grateful to all the people who make this credit available and enable her to keep working. Although her loan group has shrunk, the few remaining members continue to work in a timely way and are responsible about their loan repayments. Bertha plans to use the requested money to buy fertilizer because she wants to prepare her land for the next sowing. .

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Daud

texts.en: Daud M. is a married businessman with two school-aged children. This entrepreneur runs a butcher shop in Vingunguti ward, Dar es Salaam. He purchases meat wholesale from meat suppliers and sells to customers in retail for domestic use. Meat demand in Dar es Salaam is very high therefore the meat business is good. Daud is requesting a loan of 800,000 TZS to expand his business by buying more business goods.

loans.use: To purchase more business goods

loans.name: Abiba

texts.fr: Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente de charbons de bois ; elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans une zone où les charbons de bois sont de bonne qualité. Elle vend aussi bien en gros qu’en détail. Elle exerce ce commerce dans le quartier de Kégué à Lomé où beaucoup de personnes viennent s’approvisionner chez elle. Elle a débuté cette activité depuis 2001 ; pour éviter une éventuelle rupture de stocks, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour commander 25 sacs de charbons de bois. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman runs a business selling charcoal. She gets her supplies from the interior of the country in an area where charcoal is of good quality. She sells at both wholesale and retail. She runs this business in the Kégué district of Lomé where many people come to buy supplies from her. She started the business in 2001. To avoid shortages in stock, she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 25 bags of charcoal. She is married and has two children.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Marbellí Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Marbellí del Socorro S., es casada de 34 años, su esposo es mecánico y con sus 3 hijos menores de edad, habitan en el barrio Waspan Norte, ella se dedica a la venta de  cosméticos desde hace 8 años y fue gracias al apoyo de su marido que comenzaron sus días en esta actividad.

A futuro espera tener los recursos necesarios para abrir una tienda de cosméticos en algún centro comercial de la capital, y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos personales que favorezcan la economía de su hogar, por ahora solicita un apoyo para la construcción del porche de su hogar e instalar verjas para tener una mejor seguridad, debido a que el lugar donde habitan presenta sudun la policía nacional un alto índice de delincuencia que amenaza a sus pobladores quienes optan por reforzar la segurida de sus hogares en pro de su familia.
texts.en:
Marbellí del Socorro S., 34, is married; her husband is a mechanic and, together with their three minor children, they live in the Waspan Norte neighborhood. She has sold cosmetics for the past 8 years thanks to help from her husband who started her out in this business. She hopes in the future to have sufficient resources to open a cosmetics store in one of the capital’s shopping centers so that her personal income may improve thereby improving family economy. For now, she is asking for funds to build a porch on her house and to install iron grilles for heightened security because the area where she lives, according to the national police, is an area where the high crime rate is a threat to its residents and she wants to increase home security for her family’s wellbeing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a porch and install iron grilles.

loans.name: Flor Mburucuya Group

texts.es:
El comité “Flor de Mburucuya” esta  recibiendo las capacitaciones del 4to. Ciclo del Programa Comité de Mujeres en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas de productos de uso domésticos, preparación de comidas rápidas y otros. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.

Una de las integrantes es la señorita Besatbe quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Esta actividad lo realiza visitando a mucha gente como a emplados de varias empresas, docentes de colegios y les ofrece sus productos a créditos ya que es la manera mas facil de vender, entre los productos mas vendidos estan los perfumes y maquillajes de buena marca. 

Ella es soltera y vive con sus padres, a quienes ayuda de cualquier forma ya que son una familia humilde ella integró el comité y solicito el crédito para la compra de cosméticos como perfumes, maquillajes, cremas que ella posteriormente vende a sus clientas de vaR. lugares.
texts.en:
The committee 'Flor de Mburucuya' is receiving training from the 4th cycle of the Programa Comité de Mujeres (Women's Committee Program) in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. All the committee members are engaged in independent activities, such as sales, preparing fast food, and others. The members form a very united group and are very capable of realizing the activities that strengthen their comradeship. One of the members is señorita Besatbe, who works selling cosmetics. She visits many people, such as employees of various companies and schoolteachers, to offer them her products on credit (since that is the easiest way to sell. Her most popular items are brand name perfumes and makeup. She is single and lives with her parents, who she helps in whatever way she can. They are a very humble family. Besatbe joined the committee and requested a loan to purchase cosmetics such as perfumes, make-up, and lotions that she will later sell to her clients in various locations.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase make-up, perfumes and creams

loans.name: Jovencia

texts.en: Jovencia A.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She is a 55-year-old married woman from the town of Sta. Josefa. Jovencia has been in her business for over 23 years. In 2007, Jovencia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Jovencia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jovencia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This will be her eighth loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. In addition to credit for its clients, CEVI also provides savings, insurance and training through regular cluster group meetings. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Gemarose

texts.en:
Gemarose V. is from the village of Simmimbaan in Roxas, Isabela. She is 28 years old and is married with four young children.

Gemarose owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. She is just starting this business.

In 2010, Gemarose joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia A. is a 60-year-old, married woman from Sibalom, Antique. She is blessed with three children, aged 16 to 34. She is a member of Antique South East Branch. She is a very strong-minded woman and says that she works hard to better her life with the support of her husband. Despite hardships brought about by poverty, Sonia remains strong and dedicated in her pursuit to improve her family’s standard of living. Her aspiration to give her family a brighter future is what motivates her all day. To make a good living, she operates a farming business and plants vegetables. She has been engaged in this business for five years. 

She joined ASHI, a micro-finance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 2006. During the course of her membership, she has been a good performer with a good credit rating (the basis of loans). She is now applying for her fourth loan of 20,000 PHP. This will be used to buy raw materials including rice seeds and fertilizers, and to cover maintenance costs of her vegetable growing. She is positive that, with access to additional working capital through ASHI and Kiva lenders, her dreams of funding her family's education will be achieved.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizers and other supplies, and to maintain her vegetable growing

loans.name: Nanar

texts.en:
Nanar G. resides in the village of Vahramaberd in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is a proud resident of Vahramaberd and has a reputation as a disciplined hard worker.  Nanar has diversified her wheat growing business by also renting a small shop for retail trade.  She had a particular need to fund the tuition costs of college for her son and daughter.  Nanar also has a second daughter in the sixth grade.  

With a loan Nanar will increase the inventory of her small retail store and also use some of the funds to harvest the wheat crop.  She is planning to increase the family income by 15% with the loan.  The expected profit has been earmarked for the children’s education.  She considers herself lucky to be surrounded by her extended family in Vahramaberd.

loans.use: to increase store inventory

loans.name: Phelesia

texts.en:
Phelesia A. O. is twenty-six years old. She is single and does not have any children yet. Her business is located at Nyamasaria in a very business market in Kisumu along a busy highway. She sells charcoal to the local people. Besides the charcoal business which she really likes, she sells second-hand clothes.  She says that she has been doing business for four years. She says that her businesses are profitable and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her businesses doing well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more second-hand clothes to expand the clothes business as people are already buying clothes in anticipation for the christmas festivities. She sees herself growing her two businesses in the next five years and even diversifying to a restaurant business. She describes herself as patient and quiet.

loans.use: Clothes

loans.name: Asunciona

texts.es:
La  Sra. Asunciona   tiene 36 años y es madre soltera de  3 hijos menores . 
Ella trabajo siempre en el mercado de San Lorenzo con su madre vendiendo frutas y verduras; luego de mucho sacrificio logro independizarse y montar su propio negocio de ventas de ropas usadas y calzados usados.
Tiene un  modesto puesto ubicado en una  vereda en el mercado San Lorenzo . 
El crédito será de ayuda para la compra de mercaderías en cantidad como camisas, remeras, pantalones, calzados , entre otros.
Asunciona   desea  comprar un vehículo y transportar en el su mercadería hacia el interior del pais ya que considera que la venta de sus mercaderías por esas zonas aumentarian mucho. .
texts.en:
Asunciona, 36, is a single mother of three minor children. She always used to work with her mother in San Lorenzo's market selling fruits and vegetables. After much sacrifice she managed to become independent and set up her own business selling used clothes and used shoes. She has a modest stand in San Lorenzo's market. The loan will be of help in buying merchandise like shirts, t-shirts, pants and shoes among others in quantity. Asunciona wants to buy a vehicle to take her merchandise into the interior of the country because she feels that sales of her merchandise in those areas would increase a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shirts, t-shirts, pants, shoes.

loans.name: Pelba

texts.en:
Pelba T. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 57 years old, married and has four children. She is involved in farming and hog-raising. She plants and harvests rice crops. The pigs she raises are also sold to the market. Pelba is a hardworking mother. She wants the best for her family.

Pelba joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Pelba has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos which will be used to purchase feed and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and their house.

loans.use: To purchase feed and fertilizers

loans.name: Herculana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA UNION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Herculana; ella tiene 51 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes que atiende desde las 7:00 a.m hasta 7:00 p.m, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia quiere ampliar la tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Herculana is a member of the community bank "La Union". The bank is located in the district, province, and region of Cusco.

Herculana is 51 years old, she lives with her partner and they have 4 children together. She manages a general store every day from 7am to 7pm. She sells basic needs products such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She wishes to expand her store. She requests a loan to purchase products for her store.

She is thankful to all those who have made her dream possible and she is compromised to the terms of this loan.

loans.use: To purchase products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Fanny Yaneth

texts.es:
Fanny es una joven de 20 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de pupusas y refrescos, vive con su esposo, su hija de 2 años de edad y sus suegros, este negocio nació gracias al apoyo incondicional de su suegra, y realiza sus ventas por las tardes.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería que utiliza en la preparación de las pupusas, como quesillo, chicharrón, pollo y condimentos; esta inversión le ayudara a crecer en sus ventas ya que tendrá por hacer más pupusas fortaleciendo así el negocio.
Ella sueña con tener un comedor grande que le genere ingresos mayores para cubrir los gastos del hogar y mejore sus condiciones actuales.
texts.en: Fanny is a 20 year-old young woman who sells pupusas [thick corn tortillas filled with a variety of ingredients] and soft drinks. She lives with her husband, her two year-old daughter, and her in-laws. Her business was born thanks to the unconditional support of her mother-in-law, and she makes her sales during the afternoons.
