She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients that she will use in the preparation of her pupusas, such as soft cheese, ground pork meat, chicken, and seasonings. This investment will help her to increase her sales since she will make more pupsas, therefore strengthening the business. She dreams of having a large eatery that will bring in greater profits, in order to cover household expenses and improve her current situation.

loans.use: to buy chicken, ground pork, and seasonings

loans.name: Alberta Abena Aku

texts.en: Alberta Abena Aku Q. is married to a farmer and lives with her two children. Alberta sells shoes and slippers in Abura, a job that she has been doing for the past three months. She assists her husband in providing for the basic needs of the family. She is asking for a loan to purchase more shoes and slippers to sell. Alberta is hoping to use her additional income to build a shop.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and slippers to sell

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es: Maria de 43 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos menores a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Ella se dedica a una pulpería, Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre los diferentes productos que ofrece. Este es el segundo crédito ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes y granos básicos.
texts.en: Maria is 43 years old and is a cheerful, hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband and their 2 young children to whom they wish to give the best quality of life.  She runs a small grocery store and what she likes most about her job is advising her customers on the different products that she offers.  This is her second loan.  She was very punctual with her payments and hopes to do the same this time.  She will use the loan to purchase candy, soft drinks, bread, detergents and basic grains.

loans.use: To purchase candy, soft drinks, bread, detergents and basic grains

loans.name: Santos Marcelino

texts.es:
Santos es un padre de familia de 53 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector San Martín del distrito de Lambayeque, una zona comercial que se encuentra ubicada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de diez años a la venta ambulante de productos de uso personal como por ejemplo cortaúñas. Tijeras, pinzas, hisopos, lentes, medias, limas de uñas, entre otros. El ofrece su mercadería en los principales terminales terrestres de la ciudad de Chiclayo y adicionalmente viaja a los pueblos aledaños durante las diversas festividades que se realizan. Su esposa cuenta con una pequeña bodega y con lo que ambos ganan se encarga de sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Santos desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles.
texts.en: Santos is a 53 year-old father who lives with his wife and their children in the San Martín area of Lambayeque district, a commercial zone located just over 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For over ten years, he has been an itinerant vendor of personal use products like nail clippers, scissors, tweezers, cotton swabs, sunglasses, tights, nail files, and other items. He sells his merchandise on the main pedestrian streets of Chiclayo and also travels to outlying villages during their various festivals. His wife has a small bodega [grocery store] and with both of their earnings they are able to improve their family's economic situation. Santos would like to expand his business by buying more popular items so that he can increase his sales and bring in more profits. This is why he decided to request a loan of 600 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy more products to increase his sales and earn more profit

loans.name: Zulaykho

texts.ru: Шарифхучаева Зулайхо проживает в районе Восеъ. Ей 46 лет. Замужем, имеет 8 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Берет заказы на дому. Этим видом деятельности занимается 7 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения новой швейной машинки, чтобы продолжить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Zulaykho S., 46, lives in Vose. She has high school education and is married with 8 children. Zulaykho makes a living by making national dresses. She works from home. Having been in this business for seven years, she is applying for a loan in order to purchase a new sewing machine to keep her business running.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Lak

texts.en: Lak S. is 30 years old and lives with her husband and one young child in the Prey Veng province. She sells desserts and is able to make about US$12 in revenue per day, while her husband is a security guard. On average, he makes US$3 a day. Lak S. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To sell more desserts.

loans.name: Muth

texts.en: Muth B. is a 52-year-old married woman and a local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Tom province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. Presently, Muth B. could plant potato crops, but she doesn’t have enough capital to do it yet. So she would like to request some money from Kiva to add to her personal savings to buy many sacks of fertilizer, insecticides, and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To buy many sacks of fertilizer, insecticide, and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Ruperto

texts.en:
Ruperto R. is from the village of Turod, Quezon, Isabela. He is 56 years old. Ruperto is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ruperto owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ruperto has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2011, Ruperto joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruperto is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Ruperto from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, age 40, has a kiosk business. The kiosk is located at the roadside, so it is easy for his customers to access the premises to buy goods to meet their needs. Prior to running the business, Samuel used to do odd jobs to support his family, but the income generated was unstable and sometimes insufficient for meeting the needs of the family. He and his wife Susana, age 36, are blessed with two children: Sami, age 9, who attends third grade in the elementary school, and Arjen, age 5. Samuel and his family live in Naikoten Village in Kupang City.

Samuel began his business using his own small capital. He is happy with his current business, not only because he does not have to look for odd jobs every day but also because he dreams of improving it so as to better provide for his family. Samuel joined TLM Group Lending Program and has received loans in the amount of IDR 500,000 in the first loan cycle and IDR 750,000 in the second. Samuel's business has improved since he received these loans. He used the money to stock more basic materials to be sold in his kioask, such as noodles, coffee, sugar, teabags, soap, detergent, and rice. 

Samuel plans to expand his business by adding more products and to renovate his business place. He is requesting a loan of IDR 4,000,000. Samuel is hoping that TLM will assist him with a loan to help make his dream come true.

loans.use: to buy more products to offer for sale and to renovate his business place

loans.name: Gerito

texts.en:
Gerito S. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City, Bukidnon. He is 34 years old. Gerito is married. To make a living, Gerito owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from dealing and selling ready-to-wear clothing and shoe products from NATASHA and AVON in the local community. Gerito has been engaged in his business for more than two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Gerito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gerito is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like T-shirts and blouses. This loan will be the first taken out by Gerito from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like T-shirts and blouses

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina S. is from the village of Malipayon, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 58 years old.  Paulina is married. To earn a living, Paulinamakes chicken & pork barbecue and sells them in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Paulina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients & fund working capital for her business. 

Paulina is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed, such as chicken, pork and spices. This will be her 6th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this investment to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase the raw ingredients she needs to make food to sell

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona B. lives in the village of Tokhliauri, Kakheti Region. Nona is 44 years old. She lives with her husband, two adult sons, her parents-in-law and daughter-in-law. 

Nona is a veterinarian and owns a vet pharmacy. She offers medicines and vet service to a couple of nearby villages, including the treatment of domestic animals, vaccination of domestic animals and vet consultations. Villagers can purchase different types of vet medicines in her pharmacy. 

Nona’s family also owns two milk cows. Nona’s husband, Levan, handles the agricultural activities of the family. He makes cheese from the milk and sells it locally. 

With the requested loan, Nona plans to increase stock-in-trade in the pharmacy, as the season for vaccination starts in a month and demand on vaccines will increase in the villages. Nona plans to reinvest her profit in further expansion of the pharmacy and development of the dairy farm. In the long term, this reinvestment will positively impact the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase stock-in-trade (vaccines) for her vet pharmacy.

loans.name: Melania

texts.es:
Melania es socia del Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas, tiene 47 años, es casada con 3 hijos. Melania se dedica al transporte terrestre, el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de llantas y mantenimiento de sus unidades de transporte. Melania tiene unidades de transporte terrestre, es socia de la Ruta No 16 y comisionista de la Ruta No 6. Está en FINCA Perú hace 13 años es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas, le gusta por el apoyo que recibe de FINCA Perú con los prestamos que le otorgan,  puede ahorrar y por los momentos gratos que pasa con sus compañeras del banco.
Melania antes se dedicaba a la siembra de papas, tiene sus terrenos en Sachabamba, con los  créditos y ahorros y se compro sus unidades de transporte  y educa a sus hijos y le va bien. Su sueño ahora es comprarse más unidades de transporte, ser accionista de la Ruta No 6 y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Melania is a member of the Las Entusiastas community bank.  She is 47 years old and married with 3 children.  She operates a taxi business and will use this loan to buy tires and pay for routine maintenance on her vehicles.  She is a member of the taxi cooperative that works the Ruta Number 16 route and, separately, she works the Ruta Number 6 route, as well.  
Melania has been a FINCA Peru client for 13 years and she is one of the founding members of the Las Entusiastas community bank.  She likes the community bank because it provides a source of credit that has allowed her to save.  She also enjoys the time she spends with the other members of the community bank.
Melania used to have a farm in Sachabamba where she grew potatoes.  She used bank loans and her own savings to buy her vehicles and educate her children, two successful investments, she thinks.
Melania's goal is buy additional vehicles and join the taxi cooperative that operates Ruta Number 6.  Her goal for her children is that they find professional work.

loans.use: to service vehicles for taxi business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 35 years old and married with three school-aged children. She is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. Her main source of income comes from buying and selling vegetables such as eggplants, squash, string beans, spices, and camote tops in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. 

Evelyn joined HSPFI in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional vegetables such as squash and radish. This will be the first loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve and expand her business.


About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables such as squash radish to sell

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI  5 est un regroupement de 10 femmes toutes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30  ans,  3 enfants et vivant dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à MEMISSALA, un village  situé à environ 30 km de la ville de NIENA région de Sikasso, 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur cinquième cycle de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés avec satisfaction. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du maïs, du riz, d’arachide, de gombo etc.
FATOUMATA compte acheter, 3 sacs d’urée 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40.000 à 55 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
BENKADI  5 groups ten married women whose average age is 30 with on average 3 children, living in traditional extended families in MEMISSALA, a village situated about 30 km from the town of NIENA, Sikasso region, third administrative region of Mali. 

These clients are on their fifth seasonal loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to satisfy their needs relative to farming supplies and entrants. Their prior loans have been reimbursed satisfactorily. 

This group of women grow maize, rice, peanuts, okra and so on. 

FATOUMATA intends to buy three sacks of urea (fertilizer), two sacks of cereal-complex, and use the remainder of the loan to cover expenses for plowing and weeding. She expects to make an average profit of 40,000 to 55,000 F CFA which will be used for the everyday expenses of her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural entrants and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora Guadalupe se dedica a la venta de chocolates que los vende en colegios y su esposo es mecánico. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción  para la construcción de un muro divisorio en la casa donde vive. Vive en casa de parientes ubicada en la zona de de la ciudad Tembladerani de La Paz, es casado y tiene dos  hijos, es la primera vez que Guadalupe tiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en: Guadalupe's business is selling chocolates in schools.  Her husband is a mechanic.  She needs this loan to buy construction supplies to build a dividing wall in her home.  Guadalupe lives in a house which belongs to her relatives, in Tembladerani district, in the city of La Paz.  She is married and has two children.  This is her first loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy bricks and sand to build a dividing wall in her home

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
La señora Shirley es una mujer de 44 años de edad, vive con sus tres hijos menores de edad y su esposo, sus estudios llegaron hasta la primaria por motivos económicos, es persona muy trabajadora, emprendedora, luchadora.
Este es el segundo crédito que tiene en la Fundación, el cual su primero tuvo una excelente moral de pago, ella se dio cuenta por un programa en la televisión llamado ¨Buen Día¨   .
Doña Shirley con este préstamo invertirá el dinero en surtir su bazar, ya que vienen épocas muy buenas y necesita capital 
La señora desde hace 7 años tiene su bazar empezó con un monto de 300,000.00 colones y a la fecha  su negocio ha mejorado muchísimo. Un obstáculo que tuvo fue  no tener capital de trabajo ya que necesitaba para mantenerse.
La señora diariamente se levanta temprano alista a su hija y  los desayunos de su esposo e hijos, después ellos  van para el colegio,  y ella termina las labores domesticas, en el transcurso del día atiende el bazar.
Este préstamo le permitirá a la señora tener un buen capital de trabajo para surtir su negocio en las épocas que requieren más demanda de mercadería.
texts.en:
Shirley is a 44-year-old woman living with her three minor children and her husband.  Because of economic reasons she only went to elementary school.  She is a very hard working, enterprising, tenacious person.

This is the second loan she’s had with the Fundación.  She had excellent payment behavior with the first one.  She found out about the program through a television show called “Buen Día.”

Shirley will use this loan to stock her store because very good times are approaching and she needs capital.

She’s had her store for seven years; she started out with the amount of 300,000 colones and to date her business has improved very much.  One obstacle she had to overcome was not having working capital that she needed to stay in business.

She rises early every day to get her daughter ready and make breakfast for her husband and children.  They then go off to school and she finished up her domestic chores and tends to the store during the course of the day.

This loan will allow her to have good working capital to stock her store during the seasons when demand for merchandise is higher.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, items for the home, creams.

loans.name: Euvinia

texts.en:
Euvinia is 45 years old and married with four children. With all four children in school, Euvinia works very hard to provide for them.

Euvinia runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, including shampoo and groceries, in her sari-sari store. Euvinia has been in this business for 18 years, and she sells a variety of items such as milk, soap, sugar, and canned goods.

In the future Euvinia would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 50-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with three children of whom one is in school. She has been making a living for the last two years by running a food stall. Previously she used to sell "githeri" (maize and bean stew). She  wants in the next five years to be a major potato supplier. Her dream is to own a 4-storey building and a vehicle.

She is requesting 5000 Kenya shillings to buy potatoes, cabbages and fruit. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she is able to keep her business afloat.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, cabbages and fruit.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 29-year-old young woman. She is married and has two sons and one daughter. Hanan lives in Jabalia refugee camp located in Palestine. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee.

Hanan wants to renew her home furniture. Since her husband earns a decent salary, she needs to take a loan of amount $1,000 from FATEN. Hanan needs to change the furniture because when she got married, her husband wasn't able to purchase bedroom furniture or a kitchen table and he borrowed them from parents and friends. Now that Hanan heard about FATEN loans and realized it would be easier to repay in smaller amounts, her problem was solved.

Hanan is a religious conservative woman. Her husband is photographed instead at FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To pay for new home furniture.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS DE BELLA MARIA ” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Ocongate, en la Provincia de Quispicanchis y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Nieves tiene 43 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 4 hijos, la socia se dedica  al engorde de ganados y venta de leche de vaca fresca.  La socia  produce leche de vaca,  ella tiene ganados vacunos y sus vacas son lecheras, la socia lleva a vender la leche en sus respectivos embases ella distribuye a algunos pobladores en diferentes puntos y otras veces lleva al poblado de Urcos y  también a la ciudad del Cusco. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de una vaca lechera.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Nieves is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Triunfadoras de Bella Maria” which is located in the District of Ocongate, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 43 years old, married, and has four children. Nieves earns her livelihood by fattening cattle and selling fresh cow’s milk. Her job is that of a milk producer, but she owns beef cattle in addition to dairy cows. Nieves sells the milk in containers and distributes it to a few residents in different villages. On other occasions, she takes the milk to the town of Urcos or to the city of Cusco. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of a dairy cow.

Nieves is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is married and has four children, three of whom attend school while her youngest child is not yet old enough to go. She owns a house that has piped-in water but not electricity and her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. For the past six months, she has made a living selling water to neighbors and passersby. Her biggest challenge is competition from other water vendors in the area, but she dreams of expanding her business in the future. She has applied for a loan for Kshs. 20,000 to buy bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat oil and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans that would help her boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, oil and sugar.

loans.name: Amisi

texts.en: Amisi is a 34-year-old single mother of three children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility to look after the children solely rests on her and her dream is to educate her children. She has been dealing in second hand clothes for five years. She started with 500,000 shillings and now has 2,000,000 shillings. Her hardship is bad debts and her vision is setting up another boutique in town. Amisi needs the loan facility to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Abdukakhor

texts.ru: Абдукахор предприниматель со стажем. Он 8 лет занимается  откормом скота. В приусадебном участке у него 4 скота. Сам Абдукахор мастер, но занимаясь откормом и продажей скота, он приносит дополнительную прибыль в семейный бюджет. Абдукахор женат и у них двое детей. Он хочет купить скота и  развить этот бизнес. Абдукахор просит займ на сумму 4000 сомони, надеется, что вы будете поддерживать его.
texts.en: Abdukakhor is an entrepreneur with experience. He has been involved eight years in raising livestock. In his plot he has four animals. Abdukakhor is a craftsman, but raising and selling livestock brings additional income into the family budget. Abdukakhor is married and has two children. He wants to buy livestock and develop his business. Abdukakhor is requesting a loan of 4,000 TJS and hopes that you will support him.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Kitsao

texts.en:
Kitsao is a 33-year-old married man. He runs a retail shop in Kilifi. He has been running this business for the last four years. 

Kitsao has been a KADET  LTD client and this marks his second borrowing from KADET. With this loan, he plans to add more stock of cooking oil, wheat flour, sugar, rice and maize meal into his business. 

The anticipated profits will be directed into the repayment of the loan and gradual expansion of his business. In the future, he would like to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to add more stock of cooking oil, wheat flour, sugar, rice and maize meal.

loans.name: Chreub

texts.en: Chreub is married with four children. She is a 41-year-old rice farmer and her husband is a construction worker. She has been a farmer for about 10 years. This is her first loan with VisionFund. She requested a loan to buy fertilizers for her rice field and for plowing. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield and sell for a good price, so that she can increase her income, save for her family and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her rice field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Divina

texts.es:
La señora divina cuenta con la edad de 41 años y está casada con el señor senon con quien tiene 3 hijos, Abel, Marisol y Pablo de los cuales los 3 están estudiando, cursan segundo, quinto y sexto año de primaria, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hacen mas de 12 años.
Dice que se animo a invertir en este negocio, ya que quería buscar la forma de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y a sus hijos con sus estudios, también para gozar de un mejor nivel de vida, al igual que una buena solvencia económica, el crédito que le otorgaron lo va a invertir en la compra de mas plátanos, manzanas, duraznos, melones, papayas, jitomates, tomates, chiles, cebollas, papas, etc.
Doña divina comenta que uno des retos que tiene en su negocio es el de hacerlo crecer un poco más, ya que quiere ponerse frutería, para así tener una amplia variedad de productos, e incrementar y mejorar sus ventas junto a sus ingresos, puesto que le ayudaran a seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios superiores.
“Estoy muy agradecida con fundación realidad por este gran apoyo que me han dado, ya que podré ampliar un poco más mi negocio y tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con mi familia”. Gracias
texts.en:
Divina is 41 years old and married to Senon.  The couple have three children: Abel, Marisol and Pablo.  All three of their children are in school.  They are in the second, fifth and sixth year of elementary school.  Divina has been selling fruit and vegetables for more than 12 years.

Divina says that she decided to invest in this business as she wanted a way to support her husband with their household expenses and their children's education expenses.  She also wanted to enjoy a better standard of living and good financial solvency.  She will invest the loan that she has been given in buying more bananas, apples, peaches, melons, papayas, tomatoes, chilis, onions, potatoes, etc.

Divina says that one of the challenges she has in her business is growing it a little more.  She would like to set up a greengrocer's shop so that she can offer a wide range of products and increase and improve her sales and income because she and her husband will continue supporting their children with their higher education.

"I am very grateful to Fundación Realidad for this great support that they have given me as I will be able to expand my business a little further and enjoy a better quality of life together with my family.  Thank you".

loans.use: to buy more bananas, apples, peaches, melons, papayas, tomatoes, chilis, onions, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El señor Francisco José trabaja en la alcaldía, desde hace unos 10 años, se desempeñaba como guarda de seguridad pero por su buena labor y cumplimiento de sus obligaciones lo promovieron a responsable de cementerio ahora devenga un salario mejor. El quiere realizar este crédito con el fin de comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, bloques, arena entre otros. Desde hace tiempo Francisco quería hacerle estas mejoras a su vivienda que son necesarias. Sueña con seguir con salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Francisco José has worked for city hall for about 10 years.  He used to work as a security guard but thanks to his good work and responsible attitude he was promoted to cemetery supervisor and now earns a better salary.

He wants to take out this loan to buy building materials and supplies like cement, concrete blocks and sand, among other.  For some time now, Francisco has wanted to do some needed home improvements.  He dreams with staying in good health to continue working.

loans.use: to buy cement, concrete blocks and sand, among others.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine, 27 years old, is married and has no children. She has been selling clothing for 7 years. Christine is faced with the challenge of thieves stealing her stock. Her business goal is to have an established textile shop and her personal goal is to have a sustainable family with educated children. Christine needs a loan to buy clothing to sell during the festive season.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell during the festive season

loans.name: Yeimi

texts.es: Yeimy de 26 años es una joven comerciante que vive en uno de los barrios del sur, más alegres y productivos de la ciudad. Allí tiene un negocio mediante el cual vende mercancía variada, especialmente ropa, cosmético, calzado etc. Su negocio inició cuando procedente del  departamento de Bolívar, hace 13 años, llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla y una prima le dio posada e inició ahí mismo su vida productiva, para ayudarle a responder con los gastos de la casa. A su prima le debe toda su experiencia,  pues ella  le enseñó a comercializar productos, debido a que se dedicaba a ello. Primero vendía cremas y pequeñas mercancías, pero cuando hizo su propio capital, se independizó y gradualmente adicionó ropa, telas, calzado,  y todo lo que sus clientes le piden, pues para fidelizarlos siempre está atenta a responder a sus gustos,  intereses y necesidades. En la actualidad su sueño de crecimiento es inagotable y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, para lograr aumentar su capital de trabajo y abrirse a una nueva clientela, porque  ante la creciente demanda, el dinero que recoge de los pagos que le hacen sus clientes, no es suficiente para responder a su mercado. Con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  comprará ropa, productos de tocador, que han sido encargados por sus clientes, a propósito de la temporada del año más activa comercialmente: el final del año. Tradicionalmente Yeimi sabe que es una buena época, para expandirse en el mercado,  porque hay mucho dinero circulante y el alta la probabilidad de vender muy rápidamente.
texts.en:
Yeimy, age 26, is a young businesswoman who lives in one of the southern neighborhoods.  It is one of the happiest and most productive neighborhoods in the city.  She has a business there, and she sells various merchandise.  She mostly sells clothes, cosmetics, and shoes, etc. 

Her business started when she left the Bolivár department and arrived in the city of Barranquilla.  A cousin gave her lodging, and her productive life started right there in order to help with the household expenses.  She owes all of her experience to her cousin, who taught her to sell products because her cousin did the same thing.

At first she sold creams and small merchandise.  When she had her own capital she became independent and gradually added clothes, fabric, shoes, and everything her customers request.  In order to cultivate their loyalty she always responds to their tastes, interests, and needs.  

Her current dream of growing is tireless.  That is the reason she is requesting a Kiva loan to augment her working capital and to get new customers.  In the face of the growing demand the money that she receives from her customers is insufficient to respond to her market. 

This is her first loan with Kiva and the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will buy clothes and toiletries, which her customers have ordered.  Her plan is for the most commercially active time of the year, New Year’s.  Yeimi knows that this is traditionally a good time to expand in the market.  There is a lot of money in circulation, and there is a high probability of selling very quickly.

loans.use: to buy clothes and toiletries, which her customers have ordered.

loans.name: Kipaloi

texts.en:
Kipaloi is 46 years old and married with four children. He has been a mixed farmer for the last 15 years.

He was introduced to KADET by another registered client in his abode. This is his third loan and he is planning to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seeds, and chemicals and also to buy animals for fattening. He intends to use the returns from the loan to plow back into farming and also to repay the loan.

His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his kids to a higher level of education. He is an industrious man who struggles to achieve.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seeds, and chemicals

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en: Hiep is 45-years-old with 3 children who are grown. She is  a dry rice noodle makers.  Her business started in 2008 and it  creates  main income for her family.  Joining in SEDA’credit program in 2010, she  finds that  it is very suitable for her family. This new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 8,736,000 Vietnam dong to buy rice and some other ingredients for her production.

loans.use: to buy rice and some other ingredients for her production.

loans.name: Union Y Progreso Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento Unión el progreso esta compuesto por nueve integrantes, La señora Lineth es la presidenta de este banco, ella vende comida tripitas en la  zona de la Ceja de el Alto, tiene tres hijos la menor tiene 3 mese y el esposo es chofer de taxi  viven en casa propia, la Sra. Lineth se levanta a tempranas horas de la mañana para elaborar su comida y para atender a sus hijos ya que después tiene que irse a la venta, es un apersona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado, su deseo de la Sra. Lineth es el de tener una tienda para ofrecer sus productos y brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes, con el dinero del crédito comprara insumos para la elaboración de sus comida como aceite y papa por mayor.
texts.en: The Unión y Progreso Communal Bank is made up of nine members.  Lineth is the bank's president; she sells tripe dishes for a living in the Ceja del Alto area.  She has three children, the youngest of whom is three months old, and her husband is a taxi driver.  They live in their own home.  Lineth gets up early in the morning to prepare her dishes and to take care of her children, since she has to leave right after to sell her food.  She is a very hardworking person and she is happy with and thankful to the institution for the help it has given her.  Lineth's wish is to have a store where she can sell her products and make her customers more comfortable.  She will use the loan money to buy ingredients to make her dishes, such as oil and potatoes, in bulk.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make her dishes, such as oil and potatoes, in bulk

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherineis 45years of age, married and blessed with three children. One of them already married and the rest wants to finishes their studies. She is engaged in selling of vegetables such as onions, garlic, tomatoes and ginger. She buys her products in their market and sells into higher price within their village.


She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy additional vegetables to sell such as leafy vegetables, potatoes, and bitter melon. She hopes that her purchased goods would help her to increase her income both for the needs of his family and to save enough funds for the studies of two children.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell such as leafy vegetables, potatoes, and bitter melon

loans.name: Sombat

texts.en:
Sombat is a 21-year-old, single factory worker living in the Takeo province in Cambodia. He has worked as a factory worker since 2015, making approximately $7 per day. His parents are rice farmers.

Sombat would like to buy a motorcycle to commute to work, but he doesn’t have enough money. He is now securing a loan. With this loan, he will have enough money to buy a motorcycle and reduce travel expenses. For his future plans, Sombat is going to save money to buy more farmland for his parents and renovate a proper house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to commute to work

loans.name: Rashidan

texts.en: Rashidan  is 55 years old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over the time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet the expenses of their 3 children. Currently, she requested a loan of 35000 PKR  to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater maximum customers for generating healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend the part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater maximum customers for generating healthier source of income

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is 27 years old, married with one child. Her husband runs a small butchery in Rongai. She joined WEEC Credit program in 2003. She has attended various business courses organized by WEEC and this has helped her do her job and duties of group secretary. She started a small business of selling second hand blouses in Rongai in 2002. She was given a loan by her group of USD 225 and set up a small semi permanent beauty shop and clothes. The small business is doing well so far and has managed to pay her loan without any problem as well as living decently

loans.use: Caroline would like to stock new clothes to be and 1st class second hand clothes.

loans.name: Ongere

texts.en: J. Ongere is a 44-year old community health worker (CHW).  She lives in one of the slums of Kisumu, Kenya, with her husband and seven children (3 sons and 4 daughters).  In 1988 J. started her butchery business. In 2002 she received training by KMET in providing home-based HIV/AIDS care, and was given a drug kit which she was to sell for no profit. Through hard work, perseverance, and the help of two previous KMET microfinance loans, Janet managed to expand her business and build a successful community pharmacy.  Being the only pharmacist and community doctor in the area, she provided drugs to people who lived long distances away. J.'s reputation and friendly approach to her customers has earned her respect in the community. J. has requested a loan of Kshs 50,000 (approximately US$ 714)  to further expand her pharmacy and butchery business.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Tho

texts.en: Mrs Tho is 22 years old. Her husband is 25. They have a child, 2 years old. They don’t have any land for cultivation. Her husband is a day-laborer but his work is unstable. The main income of the family is from a small business of selling groceries. She needs US $75 for this activity.

loans.use: To trade groceries

loans.name: Nhut

texts.en: N. V. Nhut is 34 and his wife Tôn nu thi Trinh is 29. They have two children, N. thi Thuy Vy (8 years old and in second grade) and N. Gia Quynh who is 2. They have 0.2ha that they have planted as a green dragon garden but they haven’t had enough capital to invest in fertilizer and insecticide. They work for somebody in their free time to supplement their income. They need to borrow US$75 and will pay back US$15 per month over 5 months.

loans.use: plant green dragon

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Señor Juan C. is 56 years old and married to Señora Lucia Portillo, who is 49 years old. She is dedicated to selling processed corn and in this way helps her husband and contributes to the household income. The couple has five children, four of which have taken residence in Argentina. Two of them have already fromed their own families and the other two help their parents economically by sending a little bit of money each month. The youngest of their children is 19 years old and completing his final year of secondary school. He still lives with his parents and has plans to pursue an education at a university next year.

Juan has had his own garage for 17 years, where he makes repairs on bicycles, fixes tires, sells used tires and replacement parts for bicycles. His youngest son helps him with these tasks. Since Juan has a large shed available to him, he has also incorporated furniture sales into his business and is able to increase his income.

The requested loan will be used to buy covers, tubes, and tires for vehicles and also replacement parts for bicycles. This will allow him to offer a greater variety of merchandise and a better service to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

El Sr. Juan C. de 56 años de edad, está casado con la señora Lucia Portillo de 49 años, ella se dedica a la venta de maíz molido, de esta forma ayuda a su esposo y aporta con los ingresos de la casa. La pareja tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 4 se encuentran radicados en la Argentina; 2 de ellos ya han formado su propia familia y los otros 2 ayudan económicamente a sus padres enviándoles un poco de dinero mensualmente. El menor de ellos, tiene 19 años es estudiante del último año de secundaria, vive aún con sus padres y tiene planificado seguir una carrera universitaria el próximo año. Juan tiene su propio taller hace 17 años donde realiza reparaciones de bicicletas, servicio de gomería, venta de cubiertas usadas y repuestos para bicicletas, ayudado por su hijo menor. Como Juan dispone de un gran tinglado incorporó también a su negocio la venta de muebles registrando así un mayor ingreso económico. El préstamo solicitado será destinado a la compra de cubiertas, cámaras y llantas para vehículos y además repuestos para bicicletas, así de esta forma poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de mercaderías y un mejor servicio.

loans.use: Purchase covers, tubes, and tires for vehicles and also replacement parts for bicycles

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en: Abbass lives in the region of Tyre with his family. He is a 51-year-old father of five children. He owns a tire shop and is taking the initiative to develop his business. He needs $700 to expand his business. The revenue generation will help him build an extra room in his small house.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Rachna

texts.en:
Mrs. T. Rachna was married in 1998 and has 2 daughters. She has been in the business of growing and selling flowers since 1993. She and her husband are living under the custody of her widowed mother who also plants flowers and food crops. Her husband is also in business of doing farming with her.   
>p>
She is asking for a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of $400. Some of the loan will be used to buy a motorbike for carrying the products to sell in the market in Phnom Penh, and some for purchasing flowers and reselling them.

loans.use: Buy motorbike purchase flowers to resell in the market.

loans.name: Nulu's Group

texts.en:
Nulu K. currently rents her retail space and wants a loan in order to build her own shop to reduce her expenses.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To build a shop

loans.name: Menih

texts.en: Menih, 26, the mother of 2 children, sells chicken eggs to earn extra income for the family, and she could get $4 a day. Her husband, A., sells waste (salvaged) materials and earns $21 a week. She is asking for a loan of $75 to add her business capital, and as a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add her business capital

loans.name: Karla

texts.es:
Karla is single, living in the municipality of Ticuantepe, a department of Mangua, which is a rural community in which the economic activity done by poor people is the production of citrus fruits, garden vegetables, and the commerce of basic grains. For the past 5 years, Karla has had a small grocery store, in which she sells basic consumer products for families. Supplying to the poor people the products they need daily, through her business Karla has been building her house a little bit at a time. She now needs a loan in order to buy construction materials to raise a front wall of her house, which would give her more security both in her house and in her small grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Katrina H, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials in order to raise a wall in her house

loans.name: Ughur

texts.en:
I. Ughur has sold fruits and vegetables for 9 years since he moved to Baku. Ughur is from Lerik, a town in south Azerbaijan that is famous for its citrus plants. Ughur purchases fruit from wholesale shops in Lerik where his brother works.

He needs this loan to purchase fruits and vegetables for the Novruz holiday season, which starts in the end of March. He says that sales volume is double during Novruz. This holiday is related to the beginning of the summer. It’s celebrated like New Year's Eve in Azerbaijani tradition. Ughur’s name means “luck." He believes that this season will bring him lots of luck in his business.

loans.use: To buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Sharifa's Mapatano Group

texts.en:
Sharifa is 27 years old and is married with three children, ages 2-9 years old. Sharifa owns a small food vendor store and she is also a soap seller, businesses she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 8am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $155 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items and soap for her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group members Rebeca and Veneranda, who have businesses dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items and soap for her business.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Mrs. Natividad A. is 42 years old and lives in the Rinconada neighborhood of Trujillo, Peru.

She was only able to study up to her third year of high school; she has three dependent children. Mrs. Natividad has a shoe-making workshop on the third floor of their home where she makes leather shoes for children. She opened the workshop five years ago and has been able to open and operate the shop with the help of loans from Manuela Ramos. She and her husband are always united in their business as they understand that the progress of their family depends on their efforts in their workshop. Their shop currently has two outliners/profilers, three shoe assembly machines, and one cutting machine.

Mrs. Natividad has become a member of the “Gaspers” community bank through the referral of a friend. She used her first loan of ~$115 to purchase shoe forms, leather, glue, and other materials necessary to make the shoes.

With this $275 loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase additional materials to make and sell shoes during the winter.

Mrs. Natividad dreams of having a shoe factory and become a bigger businesswoman and is working hard to achieve her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Natividad A. tiene 42 años de edad, vive en la Urbanización la Rinconada el Provincia de Trujillo La Libertad – Perú. Estudió sólo hasta tercero de secundaria; tiene 3 hijos los cuales aun dependen de ella. La señora Natividad tiene en el tercer piso de su casa, un taller de confección de calzado para niños en cuero; se inicio hace 05 años, y viene trabajando cuatro años conjuntamente con los préstamos otorgados por Manuela Ramos. Su esposo y ella están siempre unidos en este negocio porque saben que de su esfuerzo dependerá el progreso de su familia. Actualmente cuenta con dos perfiladoras, tres armadores de calzado y un cortador. La señora Natividad ingresa al Banco Comunal “ Las Jadeitas” por medio de una amiga. Obtuvo su primer crédito de S/300.00 con los cuales compró hormas, cuero, pegamento, y otros insumos para confeccionar. Con el préstamo de S/.700.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses comprará material para su campaña de invierno. La señora Natividad sueña con tener una fabrica de calzado, ser una empresaria grande para lo cual esta trabajando mucho para poder lograr sus sueños.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to make shoes

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Moussa D. est commerçant qui vend des piéces détachées pour véhicules en réparation. ses clients sont constitués essentiellement de mécaniciens de la gare routiere de Mbour. il avait  bénéficié d'un  premier pret   avec  l'IMCEC qui  lui a permis de renforcer ses activités en achettant des quantités assez importantes de  piéces détachées  pour accroitre ses revenus. 

Il sollicite un nouveau crédit pour  renforcer le niveau de son stock  et faire face ainsi aux sollicitation de ses clients.

loans.use: FONDS DE ROULEMENT

loans.name: Hamisa

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Hamisa C.. She is married and has two children aged 2 and 14. In 2006, Hamisa established her café business. Hamisa requires a loan in order to purchase additional rice, beans, and cooking oil. In the future, Hamisa plans to increase the quantity and range of her inventory. She thanks you for your support.

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t appear even in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all-local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

loans.use: To purchase additional beans, rice, and cooking oil

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
For eight years now, Yolanda has been selling cosmetics by catalogue. Her daughter is the one who encouraged her to get involved in this business activity because Yolanda used to sell and distribute calling cards to stores. Her friends and neighbors are her customers.

Likewise, Yolanda has a child advocacy office in which she provides consultancy for children’s rights and support with problems of this nature.

The loans that she has received have allowed her to both pay for cosmetics in advance and have a stockpile of products at home. Yolanda would also like to expand her capital and start new projects.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 8 años, Yolanda vende cosméticos por catálogo. Su hija fue quien le animó a dedicarse a esta actividad, ya que Yolanda vendía y repartía tarjetas telefónicas a tiendas. Sus vecinos y amigos son sus clientes.

Asimismo, Yolanda tiene una defensoría de los derechos del niño, donde brinda apoyo y asesoría en problemas de esta índole.

Los préstamos que ella ha recibido le han servido para pagar los cosméticos por adelantado y tener un stock de productos en su casa. A Yolanda le gustaría hacerse de un capital de dinero más grande y comenzar nuevos proyectos.

loans.use: Pay for cosmetics in advance and have a stockpile of products at home

loans.name: Grace S.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Grace N..  She is married and has three children aged 5, 9, and 12. In 2007, Grace established her hair salon business. She opens her business 7 days a week, 9-12 hours a day. Grace requires a loan to buy more salon equipment. She thanks you for your support.  

Hair, hair and more hair! This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or plaited, and made to look like your own.

loans.use: To buy more hair salon equipment.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en: Andrea was born in 1989 and she lives in Bijeljina, which is a rapidly-growing town in the northeast of Bosnia.  She is young, ambitious, and hopes to someday open her own nail salon.  She currently works as a manicurist, earning about 400KM/month. She is requesting a 1,200 KM loan from Women for Women International, which she will use to purchase a machine that helps paint complicated patterns on nails.  This type of manicure is growing increasingly popular in Bosnia and should help to bring her many new customers.

loans.use: To purchase a machine that helps with complicated manicures

loans.name: Balkhan

texts.en: Balkhan M. is 53 years old. Her main occupation is selling cotton carpet. Sometimes she sews them by herself but mostly she buys them at wholesale from her supplier and sells them at the market. Her customers usually come to her house to pick up their order. Balkhan’s husband works in construction. All her children are grown up and have their own families. Her income raises steadily. Today she would like to invest more into her business, buying more cotton carpet. For this reason she is asking for a loan of 600 Somoni for the term of 6 months. Let’s support this woman who has a lot of courage and strength to live.

loans.use: Purchasing cotton carpet to increase the range of goods to sell

loans.name: Srum

texts.en:
Mr. Srun M., 64, and his wife, Mrs. Yom Luch, 58, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1971 and have eight children: four sons and four daughters. Six of their children are married and live outside the family home and the other two are silk weavers.

Srun has been a wooden house builder for three years and has been farming since he was young, while his wife has been selling Cambodia cake for 30 years, buying them from a local market for resale in her village. Srun is now requesting a loan of $400 to purchase silk material for his children’s weaving and for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and seed for growing rice.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустамчон парень в возрасте 29 лет , женат имеет 3 детей.Сам торгует на рынке Чайруха,козьим пухом.У него сейчас имеется одна корова и 10 коз.По мимо торговли он откормив скот продаёт его на рынках.Для увеличения мелкорогатого скота он решил взять кредит.
texts.en:
Rustam is 29 years old, married and has three children. He currently owns a cow and 10 goats. He sells goat down (cashmere fiber) as well as goats at the Chairuh market. Rustam would like to take out this loan to increase the number of goats in his herd.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El Sr. Miguel Ángel E. vive en un barrio cercano a la capital, en la ciudad de Lambaré, el se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas. Cuenta con un carrito equipado con parrilla, plancha y congeladores, para la elaboración de sus comidas, lo cual le permite sustentar a su familia.

 El mismo se dedica a ese rubro hace cuatro años, trabaja principalmente de noche vendiendo comidas varias como asaditos (carnes asadas), panchos (perros calientes), además de bebidas como gaseosas y cervezas. Anteriormente trabajaba como chofer de colectivos pero por problemas de salud tuvo que abandonar y dedicarse a su actividad actual.

 Este rubro le resulta bastante rentable, a pesar de los riesgos que corre al trabajar hasta altas horas de la noche. El Sr. Miguel Ángel solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, ya que por el intenso calor de la temporada ha aumentado en gran medida la demanda de bebidas heladas.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel E. lives in the city of Lambaré, a suburb of the capital, Asunción. He earns his living selling street food. He has a cart equipped with a barbeque, grill, and freezers, which he uses to prepare meals, allowing him to support his family. He's been in business for four years, selling a variety of asaditos (grilled meats) and panchos (hot dogs), as well as drinks, including sodas and beer. Previously he had worked as a bus driver but health problems forced him to leave that job for his current work. His business is very profitable, despite the risks involved with working until late at night. Mr. Ángel is seeking a loan to purchase drinks, as the intense heat of the season has greatly increased the demand for ice-cold beverages.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise including: sodas, beer, flavored waters, and other drinks

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth D. 48 años, es una dedicada madre D. familia, vive en su casa propia, con sus 2 hijos, Miguel D. 22 y Patricia D. 21, a los cuales desea dar una buena profesión. Se dedica a vender productos D. belleza D. casa en casa, es muy buena vendedora y siempre convence a sus clientes D. que le compren sus productos. Elizabeth trabaja todos los días sin descanso, ya que espera muy pronto poner una tienda donD. pueda vender sus cosméticos sin necesidad D. salir a L. calle, ya que lo que menos le gusta D. su trabajo es caminar bajo el caluroso sol, tiene 10 años en este negocio y lo que más le gusta es conversar con sus clientes e informarles sobre los nuevos productos que le han llegado y sus beneficios. Elizabeth sabe muy bien, que si trabaja duro podrá darles a sus hijos buenas profesiones y sacarlos adelante. Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y no quiere fallar en los pagos D. sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es muy responsable, siempre está al tanto del bienestar D. las demás socias. Los setecientos nuevos soles que solicita los utilizará para comprar más productos D. belleza y así poder tener más variedad en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 48, is dedicated mother. She lives in her own house with her 2 children, Miguel, 22, and Patricia, 21, who she hopes to proviD. with good careers. She operates a business selling beauty products door to door. She's a very good saleswoman and always convinces her customers to buy her products. Elizabeth works tirelessly every day because she hopes to set up a store soon where she can sell her products without having to work house to house since walking outsiD. in the hot sun is the part of her job that she likes least. She's operated the business for 10 years and the part of her job that she likes best is meeting her customers and telling them about new products that have arrived and their benefits. Elizabeth knows that if she works hard, she'll be able to proviD. her children with good careers so they can get ahead in life. This is her first MFP loan and she doesn't want to miss paying her installments. She's very responsible within her community bank, always concerned about the well-being of the other members. She will use the 700 soles that she's applied to borrow to buy more beauty products so that she can have a wider range to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Alimatou

texts.fr:
Née en 1969 à DASSA,une commune du département des collines au Bénin, S. Alimatou réside à Tokpota dans le 5e arrondissement de la capitale administrative et politique-Porto Novo-du Bénin. Mère de quatre (04) enfants tous scolarisés, Alimatou est vendeuse de divers, une activité qu’elle mène passionnément pour aider son mari à faire face aux charges familiales. Pour diversifier ses sources de revenus Alimatou mène comme activité secondaire, la vente de tubercules d’ignames. Malgré la passion qu’elle a pour son activité Alimatou ne dispose pas d'assez de fonds pour mener à bien son activité et se faire plus de revenu à la hauteur de ses charges. Pour ce fait, Alimatou sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son activité afin de mieux développer ses activités d’une part et d'autre part de faire face à ses différentes charges. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1969 in DASSA, a community in Collines County, in Benin, Ms. S. Alimatou resides in Tokpota, in the 5th district of the administrative and political capital, Porto-Novo, of Benin. She is the mother of four children, all in school. And she is a retailer of various goods that is a business she operates with passion to assist her husband with family responsibilities.

To diversify her income sources, she runs a secondary business selling yam tubers. Despite the passion she has, Alimatou doesn't have the funds for carrying out her work and for earning more to meet her responsibilities. For this reason, she's requesting a loan to boost her work, so as to do better in developing her businesses on the one hand and, on the other hand, to cope with her various expenses.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, corn, beans, yams, and cassava flour (locally called "gari")

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: La señora Sara R. V. es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos y es empleada de una maquiladora. La casa en la que ella vive  es una de las que otorgo el gobierno del estado a un costo muy bajo ella le ha ido haciendo mejoras con prestamos otorgados de esta institución, primero  puso barda y barandal al frente de su hogar, construyo un cuarto y quiere instalarle el vitropiso. Cuando le entregaron su vivienda solo constaba con un recamara y un baño con las mejoras que le ha hecho ya tiene dos recamaras.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sara Rodríguez V. is a single mother with 3 children. She works at an assembly plant. The house she lives in was given to her by the state government at a low cost. She has been making improvements using the loans given to her from this institution. First, she put a fence and security bars in front of her home. She built a room, and she would like to install tile flooring. When she was given her home it only had one bedroom and a bathroom. With the improvements she has made it now has two bedrooms.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material to put down tile flooring

loans.name: Estrillita

texts.en:
Estrillita Q., a 57-year-old rice grower, has been a farmer since she was a child. She supplements her income by engaging in community service as a barangay health worker, monitoring the health of a specific number of people in their barrio.

Estrillita wants to grow her business to support her four children in school and is therefore requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI (the First Filpino MFI partner to participate in KIVA microfunds) to help improve the condition of her farm’s soil. In this way, she believes that she will be able to increase her yield and better support her family.

CEVI, a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines, helps provide credit, training and insurance coverage to small businesspeople. CEVI helps small businesses to grow.

loans.use: To purchase six bags of urea fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Dios es Amor del Distrito de Mazo-Cruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 49 años de edad, de estado civil casada con 4 hijos, vive en el barrio José Antonio y cuenta con estudios de primaria completa.  
La señora Margarita viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace ya varios años, ella es una de las fundadoras de su Banco Comunal.  Obtuvo un primer préstamo de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar el capital para su negocio de abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, fideos).   
Con este préstamo de 2000.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual será pagado en 5 cuotas, comprará artículos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, entre otros, y así poder surtir  mejor su tienda para poder captar mayor cantidad de clientes. Su mayor deseo es educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Señora Margarita is a member of the "Dios es Amor" (God is Love) communal bank in the district of Mazo-Cruz, in the province of Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 49, is married, lives in the José Antonio neighborhood, and studied through primary school. Margarita has worked with Manuela Ramos for several years and is one of the founders of her communal bank. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which let her increase her capital for her grocery business (rice, sugar, and noodles). With this loan of 2,000 PEN, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy basic goods like rice, sugar, noodles, etc. She will then be able to better supply her store to attract a larger number of customers. Her biggest wish is to educate her children so they will become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of milk, sugar, rice, noodles, and other basic goods

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en:
Zenabu Y. is a 42-year-old married mother of four children, one son and three daughters. Her children are in junior high and primary schools. Zenabu lives with her family in a house in the town of Kofiase, a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Zenabu's husband is a farmer, and Zenabu is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey, a food made from corn dough and served hot with ground pepper and fried fish. She prepares the food at home and hawks to sell in her community. Zenabu has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize, which she buys from nearby communities, in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes V. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 46 years old. Agnes is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Agnes owns & operates a business selling specialty food products in the local community. Agnes has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Agnes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Agnes is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP to be used to assist her sister financially. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: financial assistance for sister

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica A. is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, both of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Suhum in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Monica works to support her husband and to be able to provide for the family. She runs a provision store in her community. She sells provisions such as sugar, candies, bread, etc. Her store is by the roadside. Monica has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy provisions in bulk to increase her stock. She aspires to sponsor all her children in school to the higher levels.

loans.use: To buy provisions for her store

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria C. C. D. C. tiene 62 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Víctor Larco, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad. Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º D. primaria por motivos económicos dejo D. estudiar, tuvo que ponerse a trabajar y asi ayudar a sus hermanos menores, tiene 4 hijos y ninguno depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Maria se dedica a la crianza D. animales: cerdos, patos, pollos, pavos, chivos, etc.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles compro patos y pavos para criarlos y posteriormente venderlos en el mercado D. Buenos Aires.
El crédito D. 1500 lo invertirá para comprar huachos (loterías) y alimento concentrado para sus animales. 
Maria sueña con aumentar la crianza D. sus animales.
texts.en:
Maria C. C. D. C. is 62. She lives in the Víctor Larco district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. This entrepreneur has a fifth graD. education. She had to leave school for economic reasons. She had to work to help her younger siblings. She has four children; they are not economically dependent upon her. Maria raises animals; pigs, ducks, chickens, turkeys, and goats, etc. With her first credit for 300 PEN she bought ducks and turkeys to raise and later sell in the Buenos Aires market. She will use the loan for 1,500 PEN to buy “huachos” (a farm animal) and concentrated food for her animals. Maria’s dream is to increase the number of animals she raises.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy “huachos” (a farm animal) and concentrated food for her animals

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has owned and run a small avocado distribution business for the past three years. A 28-year-old mother of two, she was previously a housewife. Esther has requested her second loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to buy stocks of avocados. She hopes that this loan will help to raise her income and allow her to buy a small lorry for transporting avocados. One day, Esther wants to buy a plot of land and build rental houses in Nairobi. Esther describes herself as friendly, self confident and positive.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: add to her inventory

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Some people make an early choice of their career, become steadfast and pursue this path. They know what they are going to do to earn their livelihood. The group's leader, Damira, is among them. A 36-year-old hairdresser and mother of three children, Damira has dedicated many years to her occupation. She was just a 16-year-old girl when she finished hairdressing courses. She swiftly learned all aspects of her profession, providing all kinds of hair-related services: various haircuts, hair dyeing styles, hair setting, and hairdos (e.g., waved, curled, perm, marcel waves, etc.). She has become an A1 specialist. She has assigned a room and adjusted it to be a hairdressing salon. By saving her profits, she recently purchased a car. Damira feels that she can do better and that she is just not using all the opportunities. So, she has planned to make an improvement at her salon. She is firmly convinced that if she furnishes and decorates her salon, more customers will be attracted. Damira needs a loan to equip her salon with shelves and wallpaper. In the near future, she is going to expand her business by taking on a few apprentices. People do grow when they have a vision of how to do that.

Damira’s partners:
Gulzina, age 44 and mother of two children, works as a cleaner at a casino. She needs a loan to buy building materials for her kitchen and to buy a chandelier.
Jumabu is age 56. She and her husband are farmers. They have three children. They need a loan to buy fuels and lubricants, as well as to pay for transportation services and to pay workers for harvesting.
Edilbek, age 35, is married and has one child. He works as an assistant station-master in "Tuz" substation. He needs a loan to place a crusher at the same substation and to buy some cement for installing it.
Aida, age 38, is a housewife. She sells milk and also produces cheese and butter. She needs a loan to buy a milk cow.
Nazgul, age 38, is married. She has three children. To make a living she sells yogurt, sour cream and cottage cheese. She hopes to get a loan to buy a milk cow.

Where Did This Loan Come From?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of a 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable, to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To equip a hairdressing salon with shelves and wallpaper

loans.name: Florence
