texts.en: Florence is forty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to six sons who all attend school. Florence is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is a trader who deals in ladies’ underwear. She hawks her goods in the community market and also sells goods in other towns. Florence procures her goods from Kumasi, a nearby city. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy textiles in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ladies’ underwear

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel K. is 19 years old, single and he has a small shop selling various goods.He starts his business evey day from 6h00 AM to 7h00PM with experience of one year in this business. Emmanuel is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company s.a for expanding his shop through purchasing many products such as salt, rice sugar etc.
By receiving and using this new loan, Emmanuel with the profits he will get, he has a hope for his future through savings and buying a business house.

loans.use: purchasing more merchandises

loans.name: Los Narditos Group

texts.es: El grupo “Los Narditos” Esta representado por la señora Adela y conformado por 13 miembros dedicados a la venta D. diferentes artículos como cosméticos, venta D. refrescos, venta D. papa, comida al paso, servicio D. seguridad y ornamentación con el PLANE. En cuanto a la competencia  existen muchos negocios similares, por lo que las ventas son variadas D. acuerdo a la época en la que se encuentran. El crédito será utilizado para hacer crecer su negocio adquiriendo mercaderías e insumos para generar mayores ganancias que sustenten y brinden una mejor calidad D. vida para sus familias. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia en gran mayoría D. los miembros del grupo ya posee experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo que saben como administrar los fondos otorgados y tienen grandes deseos D. trabajar y crecer junto a nuestra institución.

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Igembe Group

texts.en:
Edith R., age 43, is a widow with four children whose ages are 23, 22, 17 and 12. She sells chickens and chicks in a business that she started two years ago. Edith works daily from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $150.

This will be Edith’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use the loan to buy chicken feed and chicks to raise and then sell. She hopes to use any extra profit to care for herself and her family, and improve their lives.
	
Edith will share this loan with her loan sub-group, which is a part of the larger group "Igembe," which means "hoe" in Kiswahili. Within this sub-group, Lulu has a shop, Lukresia is a food vendor, Justa raises and sells chickens and Veronika has a grocery. The members of the group hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.  

In the picture, Edith is in the center wearing glasses.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Brenda Mireille

texts.es:
La señora S. B. BRENDA MIREILLE , tiene  23 años, vive en el distrito de El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal ESFUERZO DE MUJERES II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 3º de segundaria. Se dedica a la venta de caldos (sopas), desayunos y jugos. 
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compro mesas, sillas, para poder vender sus comidas a los transeúntes cercanos a la avenida donde vende sus productos. Ahora con el prestamos de 500.00 nuevos soles, lo invertirá para comprar una fotocopiadora, ya que paralelamente se deica al servicio de fotocopias.
BRENDA, sueña con incrementar su negocio y poner un restaurante, y tambien una bodega en su casa.
texts.en:
BRENDA MIREILLE S. B., 23, lives in the el Porvenir district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the ESFUERZO DE MUJERES II (WOMEN'S EFFORT II) communal bank. She has finished 9th grade and works selling soups, prepared breakfasts and juices. With her first 300 sol loan she bought tables and chairs so that she could sell her meals to nearby passersby on the avenue where she sells her products. With this loan of 500 new soles she will buy a copying machine since her parallel business activity is photocopying. BRENDA dreams with enlarging her business and setting up a restaurant as well as a grocery store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a copying machine.

loans.name: Nasser

texts.en: Nasser is a 28-year-old married man living with his wife and two young children. He has been working as a farmer since 2004 with a previous twelve year experience in the field. Nasser is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy tools for his farm in order to complete his work and satisfy the needs of his customers.

loans.use: to buy tools

loans.name: Chomrong's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Chomrong C. is a group leader of four members who all live in Phlov Trei village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Sam Phally, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate vegetables.  They face an obstacle because they do not have enough money to buy farming supplies. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Chomrong C. decided to ask for a loan. She is 20 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy supplies for farming

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie P., age 37, grows rice for a living. She chose rice as her main crop because it is a commodity and because everyone buys rice to eat. She has four children, the eldest of whom is 16 years old. She dreams that her children will graduate from college. She works so hard to become the best mother she can be to her children and to provide for their daily needs. 

She would like to request a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. The loan will truly help her to increasing the size of her harvest and raise their family income.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Ali Aboubakrine

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ali Aboubakrine D.  sociétaire  d’U-IMCEC Thiès  sollicite  un crédit de 100 000 FCFA  payable sur 10 mois pour entamer une activité en bonne marche dans la ville. Il compte  se lancer dans l’aviculture, un domaine qu’il maitrise assez bien et qu’il a géré pendant longtemps  pour  les affaires d’un de ses frères. Pour ce montant, Monsieur D. va construire un local et démarrer l’activité avec 50 poussins.  
Cet homme, Monsieur Ali Aboubakrine D., célibataire et père d’un enfant de 07 mois, est un mécanicien de formation et il est âgé de 37 ans.
Depuis qu’il a quitté le service militaire, il y’a 9 ans, Monsieur D. a abandonné la mécanique pour se trouver du boulot dans les entreprises. C’est ainsi qu’il est devenu  aide-agent  commercial dans une société qui a une antenne à Thiès ville située à 70 Kms  de Dakar la capitale du Sénégal. Il est également agent de sécurité pour les  week-end et jours fériés dans un organisme international  sis à Thiès. 
Ainsi, avec ce premier financement, Monsieur Ali Aboubakrine D. verra ses revenus augmentés et s’auto employer afin d’être indépendant par rapport aux contraintes rencontrées très souvent dans ses lieux de travail.
texts.en:
Ali Aboubakrine D., a member of the U-IMCEC Thiès, requests a loan of 100 000 FCFA, to pay back in ten months, in order to start a new business. After working for years for one of his brothers, he has developed a considerable experience in poultry, so he wants to build a chickens coop and start the business with 50 poussins. Ali Aboubakrine D., single and father of a seven months child, is 37 and a trained mechanic. After leaving the army nine years ago, he stopped working as a mechanic to find a job in a company. So he has become commercial assistant agent for a company branch in Thiès, 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. Week-ends and holidays he also works as security agent for an international organization based in Thiès. Thank to this first loan Ali Aboubakrine D. will be able to increase his revenue and become self-employed and free from the constraints he has to face in his working place.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a chickens coop and purchase poussins.

loans.name: Los Angelitos Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Los Angelitos” esta representado por la señora Sandra Herry y conformada por 11 miembros que van cursando su tercer ciclo demostrando puntualidad en sus pagos y muchas ganas de trabajar, como loe demuestran en sus negocios de ventas de Venta de pescado crudo y cocido, venta de ropa, venta de empanadas, venta comida, venta de cosméticos y algunos socios tienen otra actividad como ser moto taxistas y servicios domésticos; la presidenta se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco que traen desde temprano desde las laderas del río y que si no se vende en la mañana lo cocinas para media tarde para no perder la ganancia del día ella mantiene a sus tres niñas junto con su esposo que es el que pesca junto con ella en las madrugadas que es donde los peces están en sus auge, ella tiene una casita modesta pero acogedora que es donde realizan las reuniones las socias. Como todo negocio tienen competencia, la mayoría de los socios de este grupo tienen su puesto de venta en el mercado del pescado ubicado en la zona 13 de abril por lo que siempre hay venta de l plato cosido o del pez fresco. El destino del crédito es para el crecimiento de sus negocios y a futuro esperan tener puestos de venta en otros mercados de la ciudad e invertirán en compra de insumos y materia prima para almacenar. En cuanto a su experiencia en Agrocapital están en su tercer ciclo sus antecedentes crediticios son regulares con la institución y la mayoría de los socios de este grupo han tenido experiencia en bancos comunales en otras instituciones.
texts.en:
The community bank "Los Angelitos" (The Little Angels") is represented by Sra. Sandra Herry and is made up of 11 members who are in their third loan cycle. They demonstrate punctuality with their payments and they have a lot of desire to work, as they demonstrate in their sales businesses of selling raw and cooked fish, clothes, empanadas, food, and cosmetics. Some of the members have other businesses such as motorcycle taxi drivers and domestic services. The president sells fresh fish that she brings early from the river slope, and if she doesn't sell it in the morning, she cooks it in the mid-afternoon so as not to lose the daily profits.

She has three daughters with her husband, who fishes with her very early in the morning, because that is when the fish are at their peak. She has a modest but cosy small house, which is where they have their meetings with the members. Like all businesses, they have competition, the majority of the members of this group have their sales stand in the fish market, located in the 13 of April region, so therefore there are always sales of cooked plates or fresh fish.

The use of the loan is for the growth of their businesses, and in the future they hope to have sales stands in other city markets. They will invest in the purchase of supplies and raw materials for storage. As for their experience in Agrocapital, they are in their third cycle and their credit antecedents are regular with the insitution and the majority of the members in this group have had experience in community banks in other institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza M., 31, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. She is married to Reymar M., a shoe maker and electronics repairman, and they are blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store for four years.

Annaliza has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her variety store.     

Now, with your help, Annaliza would like to obtain a PHP 12,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying more groceries to be incorporated into her current product inventory.

Annaliza dreams that her business will continue to grow so that her children will be able to have a good education and their whole family will be able to have good health. She also prays that the Lord will always guide her and her family in everything they do.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica L. is from the village of Brgy.Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 54 years old. Monica is married and has 3 adult children. Monica owns & operates a general store where she sells food products. Monica has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Monica joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Monica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Monica is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her inventory. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Monica from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her inventory

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
EL Señor Juan V. Fernández tiene 46 años y está casado con la Señora Primitiva Calle Mamani de V. por más de 23 años tiene 4 hijos que estudian, El señor se dedica a la producción agrícola de papa, haba, oca y papa liza y lleva a vender a la feria semanal de colomi, su esposa también se dedica a la producción agrícola y ama de casa.  
                                                                                                                                                                                      El señor Juan V. Fernández vive en la comunidad de Primer Toncoli a 2 km hacia el norte de Colomi,  es una zona que esta cerca del pueblo de colomi, el crédito está sacando de CIDRE; El señor Juan V. Fernández utilizara este crédito para compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza)  para agrandar más su producción agrícola.
 
El señor Juan V. Fernández nos comenta que su sueño es mejorar sus recursos económicos así para que sus hijos sigan estudiando hasta salir profesionales, también mejorar su calidad de vivienda para vivir mas cómodos con su familia.
texts.en:
Juan V. Fernández, 46, has been married to Primitiva Calle Mamani de V. for over 23 years; they have 4 children that are students. He farms several varieties of potato, tubers and broad beans that he sells in Colomi’s weekly market; his wife is also a farmer and housewife. Juan lives in Primer Toncoli, 2 kilometers north of Colomi in an area near Colomi. He is getting financing from CIDRE and will use the funds to buy organic (chicken) manure to increase his crop yields. He mentioned to us that his dream is to improve his financial resources so that his children can stay in school and become professionals; he also wants to improve the quality of his home so that the family can live with more comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy organic manure.

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en:
Batjargal is 33 years old and lives with his wife and son in Zavhan province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a 'ger', the Mongolian nomadic tent, in a rental yard. His wife, Nasanjargal, looks after their 1-year-old son at their home. 

During the day, Batjargal operates a transportation service in his town. He transports local residents to and from various points in the area. He has had success with his business and has built a reputation as a good driver. 

Batjargal has been operating his business since 2006, together with his younger brother, and has been planning to purchase another micro-bus to transport more customers in his province. Batjargal gained much experience over the past years and has many plans in the future. He has been planning to purchase own house with a yard for his family with his business profit in the future. 

Batjargal is a enthusiastic person and says, “I am working hard to build a successful life and improve my family's quality of life.” He is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase a micro-bus for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a micro-bus for his business

loans.name: Pastora Walquiria

texts.es: La Sra. Pastora Walquiria Sánchez Pérez, se desempeña como profesora de educación secundaria, es madre de un hijo en edad escolar, los créditos que ha solicitado han sido para la mejora de su vivienda, por que esta es la única manera  de hacer este tipo de actividad  ya que estas  instituciones dan financiamiento considerando los ingresos de la unidad familiar.
texts.en:
La Sra. Pastora Walquiria Sánchez Pérez, se desempeña como profesora de educación secundaria, es madre de un hijo en edad escolar, los créditos que ha solicitado han sido para la mejora de su vivienda, por que esta es la única manera de hacer este tipo de actividad ya que estas instituciones dan financiamiento considerando los ingresos de la unidad familiar.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de bloques, piedra cantera, hierro, cemento y mano de obra.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
Note: Based on the politicA. and sociA. challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blocking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not disclosing his/her location and name, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

This borrower from Lebanon is a 31-year-old married man with one child who is attending school. The borrower is the main income provider for his family.

He has ten years of experience working as a farmer. He uses plastic tents to improve the quality of his agriculturA. products. These tents also allow him to grow his products for more months during the year. He works independently in his business.

Today he is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase needed supplies for his agriculturA. work. He is a first-time Kiva borrower and also a first-time Ameen client. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%.

loans.use: To purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work

loans.name: C2880 Amizero Group

texts.en:
Florence is 40 years old and is married with two children who are 18 and 20 years old. She is the leader of a group called Amizero and this group is well-known in the business of selling clothes and some decorative items. This is their tenth successful year in this business and the hours of the business are from 6 a.m. until late in the evening hours.

Florence and her team are now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their business through purchasing more attractive styles of clothes and increasing the sale and rent of decorative items. If this plan is successful, Florence and her team will hopefully earn more profits which in turn will allow them to keep reinvesting in the business for better financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase different styles of clothes and more decorative items

loans.name: Regina Virginia

texts.es:
Regina se separó de su esposo hace 7 años; trabaja como contadora en una empresa procesadora de maderas; a la vez teje chompas las cuales son comercializadas en su puesto de la feria 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto. Tiene un hijo que está a su cargo. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona 16 de Julio de la ciudad del Alto. 

El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de  una maquina de tejer, así podrá terminar más rápido las chompas y por ende tendrá la posibilidad de vender más mercadería.

Es primer crédito con IMPRO y el análisis socio-económico le permite solicitar el préstamo.
texts.en:
Regina separated from her husband 7 years ago; she’s employed as an accountant for a lumber processing firm. In addition, she knits sweaters that she sells in her stall located in the 16 de Julio market in El Alto. She has a son under her care and her home is located in the 16 de Julio neighborhood of El Alto. She will use the funds to buy a knitting machine so that she can finish her sweaters more quickly thereby being able to sell more merchandise. This is her first loan with IMPRO and the socioeconomic analysis conducted qualifies her for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a knitting machine.

loans.name: Carmen Cecilia

texts.en:
Carmen lives in Barranquilla with her husband and three children, who range in age from 16 to 28. She owns a small business called Karina's Fashions, which she started some 20 years ago so that the family would have a second source of income to sustain the household, improve the house, and most important, to educate their children. 

Carmen works every day making clothing, focusing on women's wear, although she knows how to do a bit of everything. She has previously received two loans from  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and so comes into this Kiva loan with a good credit history and a reputation with our loan officers for running a well-organized business. 

She plans to use her Kiva loan to buy supplies, such as sheets of linen, Lycra, and t-shirt material. Her dream is to create her own line that could be easily identified in the market. She thanks God that she isn't currently facing any serious setbacks and instead can look forward knowing that she has a family she loves and a great capacity for hard work.

[EN ESPANOL]

Carmen Cecilia C., vive en Barranquilla con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 16, 20 y 28 años; ella es propietaria del negocio “Modistería y modas Karina” negocio que emprendió en el año de 1.990 como una fuente de ingresos para ayudar a su esposo, al sostenimiento del hogar y especialmente en la educación de sus hijos y también a la adecuación de su vivienda. Carmen se dedica diariamente a confeccionar especialmente ropa femenina, aunque sabe hacer de todo un poco en el arte de confeccionar. Ella ha recibido 2 créditos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que le han proporcionado la posibilidad de crear historia crediticia y ser muy organizada en su negocio a través de la asesoría que recibe. En la actualidad es´tá aplicando a un crédito por valor de $ 1.600.000 COP para comprar materias primas e insumos especialmente telas de hilos, licras y franelas . Su sueño es crear su propia marca y que esta sea muy identificada en el mercado, ella da gracias a Dios porque no enfrenta ninguna dificultad en el momento y porque tiene el amor de la familia que siempre la acompaña y goza de una gran capacidad de trabajo.

loans.use: To buy supplies, such as sheets of linen, Lycra and t-shirt material

loans.name: Ababana Group

texts.fr:
Mukankubana Edith est une femme de 30 ans, née à Kibungo, province du nord du Rwanda. Elle est mariée, elle a deux  enfants le plus âgée a 9 ans et le second a 6 ans, les deux  enfants vont  à l’école. Edith avec sa famille habite à Kigali, son niveau d’étude est 6 ème secondaire.

Elle fait le commerce de salon de coiffure pour dame, elle a une expérience de 4 ans dans ce domaine et les épargnes lui ont aidé de payer son loyer. Elle épargne dans ACB avec laquelle elle est client, il y a 3ans. Le prêt qu’elle vient de contracter c’est pour acheter des casques pour sécher les cheveux des femmes en salon de coiffure après le de frisage et en tirer les bénéfices et rembourser son prêt. 

Elle contracte son  premier prêt car son groupe est récemment formé, les intérêts  tirés de son business, elle les utilisera pour payer le loyer  et augmenter son chiffre d’affaires  et épargner.

Dans l’avenir, après avoir terminé de rembourser le prêt, elle pourra avoir un nouveau prêt, et elle pourra construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Edith Mukankubana is a 30-year old woman, born in Kibungo, a province in the Norht of Rwanda. She is married and has two children, the older of whom is nine years old and the younger six years old; both children go to school. Edith lives with her family in Kigali. Her level of formal education is junior high school. Her line of business is a hair salon for women. She has four years of experience in this business; her savings have allowed her to pay the rent. She has been saving with ACB [Amasezerano Community Banking] for three years. The loan she just took out is for purchasing salon hair dryers to be used after doing her clients’ hair; this will allow her to earn an income and repay her loan. She is on her first loan as her group has been recently formed; she will use the income derived from her income to pay for rent and to increase her business volume as well as savings. In the future, after repaying this loan, she could apply for a new loan and have her own house built.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing hair salon dryers

loans.name: Munhzul

texts.en: Munhzul H. is 44 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Hovd province in western Mongolia. He and his famliy live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. He currently operates a food retail business in his town, traveling to purchase the products and supplies for the business. His wife, Mendsaihan, helps him with selling food. Munhzul and his family started their bakery and food trading business in 2004 and make a variety of breads and baked goods which they sell directly to their customers. After building a stable operation, Munhzul and his wife used their earnings to start selling food in addition to the bakery. The continued growth of both businesses recently enabled them to expand the business. They attribute their success to their ability to deliver quality products to the consumer. Munhzul hopes to continue to expand his family business in the future and is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials in order to enlarge their food shop.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials in order to enlarge their food shop

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa P. is from the town of Talibon. She is 33 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Nerissa owns & operates a fishing business: she operates a fishing boat and sells the catch of assorted fish at the market. Nerissa says her business helps a lot in providing for her family. She hopes for her business to prosper.

Nerissa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nerissa is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Nerissa from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna S. is from the village of Bavra located in the Shirak region of Armenia.  Susanna is married with three children – two daughters (27 and 25 years old) and one son (20 years old).  She has a high school education with 7 years of experience farming and running small businesses.  She particularly sees growth potential in her small retail shop.  She is looking for a loan to increase her shop's merchandise.  With this investment she expects the family income to increase by 15%.  These proceeds will be used to support her daughters' families, save money for her son’s upcoming wedding, and reinvest in the business.  She enjoys living in Bavra with its agricultural lifestyle and beautiful environment.

loans.use: additional merchandise

loans.name: Agapito

texts.en:
Agapito P. is from the village of San Isidro. He is 55 years old. Agapito is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Agapito owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Agapito has been engaged in his business for over 31 years and earns approximately 40,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Agapito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agapito is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Agapito from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Sabina R.. She is single and has no children. In 2007, she established her general store. By working 6 days a week and 9 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to increase store inventory. In the future, Sabina plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk and staples such as rice, lentils and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, in-coming produce and shrewd businesswomen. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. 

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page     
Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: to increase inventory

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en: Zipporah is 30 years old, married and blessed with a three-year-old child. She joined unity Power group in Faulu Kenya as a business-lady who runs a grocery. Though her business is located in a very competitive environment, she still has a number of reliable customers. Her husband, who is employed, also supports her financially. She has requested for 40, 000 Kes to buy grains. She hopes to enlarge her business and become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy grains.

loans.name: The Entrepreneurs Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal EMPRENDEDORES, en secuencia  9, está conformado por 11 personas, 10 mujeres y 1 varón, la mayoría D. las socias pertenecen a la Zona D. Villa Copacabana y Villa San Antonio, que están ubicados por el cruce D. villas. Las socias se dedican a la venta D. diversos productos como ser, ropa interior, cosméticos, venta en tienda D. abarrotes. En la secuencia anterior todas cancelaron muy bien sin problemas. Es un banco que se caracteriza por que todas las integrantes traen sus cuotas sin necesidad D. prestarse D. otras.
La Sra. Esperanza Es la presidenta del banco, elegida democráticamente por sus compañeras por ser una D. las mas responsables y no falto a ninguna D. las reuniones, se dedica a la venta y distribución D. víveres y otros productos alimenticios en distintas instituciones y colegios, cuenta con esta actividad hace 8 años, el préstamo será destinado a los pedidos D. víveres por mayor.  
La Sra. Zenobia  Socia que continua en el cargo D. tesorera del banco, se dedica a la venta y distribución D. víveres en diferentes lugares ya sea en instituciones o pedidos a domicilios se dedica a esta actividad hace 5 años, el préstamo esta destinado a la incremento D. capital. La socia es soltera tiene 3 hijos, asume el cargo por su  responsabilidad que ha demostrado dentro del banco como garante y como compañera D. grupo. 
la Sra. Tania, es elegida como secretaria , es una integrante nueva y joven asume el cargo por su característica D. coadyuvar en los tramites del grupo y por su talento en la redacción se dedica a la venta D. tucumanas por la zona D. Miraflores.  El préstamo esta destinado para incrementar su capital. Casada con el señor Giovanni, vive en la casa D. sus Papas. Su meta es abrir un restaurante en el cruce D. villa Copacabana.en la foto no se encuentra el Sr. Rodrigo.
texts.en:
The community bank named "The Entrepreneurs" is on their ninth loan cycle and it is maD. up of 11 members; 10 women and 1 man. The majority of the members live in the Villa Copacabana region and San Antonio region. They are both located near Cruce D. Villas. The members sell various types of products, such as: undergarments, cosmetics, and groceries. In the previous loan cycle all of the members successfully repaid their loans without any problems. In this community bank the members are able to make their own payments without having to recur to others for help. 

Esperanza is the leader of the community bank. She was democratically elected by the other members. And she was chosen for being one of the most responsible people and she had not missed any of the meetings. She sells and distributes groceries and other food products to various institutions and schools. She has had this business for 8 years and the loan she requests will be used to purchase products in wholesale. 

Zenobia is a member who has always been the treasurer of the bank. She sells and distributes groceries to various places, either to institutions or to private homes where orders had been placed. She is a single mother of 3. She has assumed this responsibility having demonstrated her ability as a manager and as a member of the team. 

Tania was elected as the secretary. She is a new and young member of the group who helps with the group's business; she has a talent for writing.  She sells savory turnovers in the region of Miraflores. The loan will be used as working capital. She is married with Giovanni and they live in her parents' home. Her goal is to open a restaurant in the downtown area of Villa Copacabana. Rodrigo is not pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 60 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Lucio de 63 años y sus 3 hijos menores, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, Julia comienza con el cuidado de sus tierras, ya que sabe que de la calidad de sus productos dependerán las ganancias que obtenga por su venta. Sus cultivos de cacao, café y hojas coca, son los productos que mayor demanda tiene en la zona, por ello los lleva a vender a la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que es donde mejores precios obtiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucha alegría, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los sacos son muy pesados. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el décimo séptimo crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le será muy beneficioso y así poco a poco podrá mejorar su vida. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable y siempre esta pendiente de sus pagos. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de cacao y café, también invertirá en comprar abono y fertilizantes para mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Julia is 60 years old.  She is a very humble and hard-working woman who lives in her own home with her 63 year-old husband Lucio and her 3 children who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.  Every day, very early in the morning, Julia begins caring for her land since she knows that the profits she makes from her sales will depend on the quality of her products.  Her crops are cacao, coffee and coca leaf.  These are products which are in most demand in her area.  She takes them to sell in the city of San Francisco as this is where she gets the best prices.  What she most likes about her work is sowing her land and she does it very happily.  She has been doing this work for 30 years and she considers that the most difficult part of her work is transporting her products since the sacks are very heavy.  Over time, she would like to buy new land to increase her production.

This is her seventeenth loan from MFP.  She feels that this support will be very beneficial to her and that, little by little, she will be able to improve her life.  She is a very responsible member of her community bank and she always makes sure that she makes her repayments on time.  She will use the 3,000 nuevos soles she is requesting to buy cacao and coffee seeds.  She will also invest in buying fertilizers to improve her production.

loans.use: To buy cacao and coffee seeds, and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.  His greatest monthly expense is rent bills. 

He runs a computer college, offering lessons on computer packages to students.  Joseph faces a major challenge of delayed payments of school fees by students attending the lessons.  He hopes to expand the college and be a big institution in the future.

With the 20,000 KES he wants to construct another room and purchase chairs for the classroom.  He decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To construct another room  and purchase chairs for the classroom.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. David; el tiene 43 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de ganadería, el se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados, el cría las vacas en el distrito de Cotabambas,el tiene un pequeño terreno, el socio quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de ganados. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar ganados.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sr. David is a member of the Communal Bank “Ricchary Cusco” which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

He is 43 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. David divides his time between his daily activities and his ranching business. He buys and sells livestock. David raises cows in the district of Cotabambas where he has a small plot of land. He wants to improve his business of selling livestock and is requesting a loan to buy cattle.

David is grateful to those who have helped fulfill his dream and promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Naana

texts.en:
Naana N. is married and has two children. She has received a junior high education. Her husband is a mason.  She assists her husband in taking care of their home.

Naana sells and corn dough at Takoradi.  Corn and cassava dough are used to prepare a favorite Ghanaian dish called "Banku." She has been in this trade for fifteen years.  Naana plans to use this loan to expand her business by increasing the volume of corn and cassava dough she makes.  If she is able to generate additional income as a result, she wishes to use the extra money to buy land.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Nana stands with bagged corn and cassava dough she sells.

loans.use: to expand a corn and cassava dough making business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is from the village of Lupagan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Evelyn is married and has three children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a business running a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Evelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for sale

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem P., 52, is a village woman living in Kompong Cham Province. She is a local crop farmer, growing rice and vegetables on her own farmland. To help meet the family's daily expenses, her husband works as a builder in and around his community. They have seven children, two of whom are single and five are married and living in their own house. 

Sem P. has two children who are sewing workers at the garment factory. Dry weather is coming at the beginning of this year, and it may affect Sem P.’s business. She faces a difficult season if she is not able to irrigate her crop. Sem P. is taking out her loan to purchase some pipe and a water pump for her crops. With any remainder of the loan funds, she will  build a new toilet for the whole family.

loans.use: To purchase some pipe and a water pump  for her crops

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime I. is from the village of Gata Diot, Clarin, in the Philippine province of Misamis Occidental. He is 46 years old. Jaime is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jaime owns and operates a business venture providing transportation services. While not the only means of generating revenue, the income for the business comes primarily from operating a motor vehicle. Jaime has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Jaime joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jaime has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30000 PHP from GDMPC. He is now requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP, which he will use to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the fifth loan Jaime has taken out from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng C. has been in the fishing business for over ten years on the local river. She is 50 years old and a married mother, caring for two kids who are working in the garment industry and one who is married and lives away from home. She also depends on her husband who works as a construction foreman as well as a fisherman. Heng C. is taking out her loan to buy a motorcycle, which will be used by her daughter for riding to her work place.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her kids to ride to their work place.

loans.name: Munnawar's Group

texts.en:
Munnawar lives in Khanewal, a small city in the Punjab Province of Pakistan known for its agriculture.  She has been living there in the area of Jaswant Nagar in a two-room brick house with her family for past 20 years.  She is married to M. M. who works at a private company for a reasonable income every month, and has two daughters who are both enrolled in a local school.

Munnawar is a very supportive lady by nature. She carries out her responsibilities as a housewife, and besides her household work, she also supports her family financially by selling clothes to customers in her neighborhood. She visits Multan, a historic city famous for its embroidery art, once a month to buy clothes for resale.

Munnawar has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy clothes in bulk to offer more variety to her clients and, hopefully, to earn more profits.  Buying in bulk will reduce the time and cost of travel to Multan, as she won't need to make as many buying trips.  She has had her business for five years and is hopeful that further investment will put her business in a more profitable position.

Note: In the photo that accompanies this profile, Munnawar is the woman whose hand is raised.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk for resale

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 50 years old with a common-law husband and one child. For the past 16 years, she has been running a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from food vending. Luz works hard to provide for her family. She has repaid five previous loans from NWTF and is currently requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy more merchandise for her store. 

In the future, Luz aspires to send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Afgan

texts.en:
Afgan O. is 25 years old. He lives in the village of Seidigodjalo, Marneuli district, with his mother. The only source of income for the family is agriculture. Afgan and his mother have a plot of the land where potatoes are grown. Also, they own greenhouses where cucumbers and tomatoes are grown. The products are sold locally. Total income for the family amounts to 1200 laris per month. 

Afgan requested a loan from Credo, as he plans to purchase fertilizers for his greenhouse. After the land is fertilized, the family will get more and better quality vegetables and sell them for a more convenient price. With the increase in income, Afgan and his mother will renovate their house in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for vegetable growing.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su novia e hijo de 2 años de edad, en una casa que no cuenta con los servicios básicos de luz, agua y desagüe, en el caserío El Porvenir Hualtaco III, que se ubica a 6 Km del distrito de Tambogrande – Piura.

David y su novia son una pareja muy trabajadora. Ella se dedica a labores de crianza de ganado ovino y porcino y David se dedica a la agricultura, actualmente tiene plantaciones de mango y limón en un terreno que sus padres le heredaron. David cosecha el limón cada 15 días y esto le reporta buenos ingresos. Esta pareja de emprendedores se dedica a estas actividades desde hace dos años, debido al nacimiento de su niño.

David solicita un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. El destino del crédito será para la compra de fertilizantes y limpieza de terreno, para asegurar una buena producción tanto del mango como del limón. Incrementando sus inventarios y por ende las ventas, para seguir creciendo en su actividad.

Esta familia tiene muchos deseos de superación.
texts.en:
David is 31 years old and lives with his girlfriend and their 2 year old son.  They live in a house that doesn't have electricity, water or sewer in the settlement of El Porvenir Hualtaco III located 6 km from the district of Tambogrande - Piura.  

David and his girlfriend are a hard-working couple.  She raises sheep and pigs while David currently has a mango and lemon plantation on a plot of land that he inherited from his parents.  He harvests lemons twice a month which brings in a good income.  This pair of entrepreneurs have dedicated themselves to these activities for the past 2 years due to the birth of their son.  

David is requesting a loan for 1000 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] from Edpyme Alternativa.  He will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and to clear the land. This will help to ensure a good production of mango and lemon which will increase his inventory and thereby his sales in order to continue growing his business.  

This family is eager to excel.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and clear his land.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a candle crafting business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy wax, wicks and molds for her candle crafting business.

Jenalyn has been in this business for 5 years. Jenalyn earns more income from her sari-sari store.

Jenalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy wax, wicks and molds for her candle crafting business.

loans.name: Olim

texts.en:
Olim is a hard-working man who is in agriculture. He has worked at this business for a long time and has acquired his abilities in ranching and farming over a long period of time. He is a married father with responsibilities for maintaining his 3 children. 

Olim is known as being very responsible and hard-working. Every day, very early in the morning, he starts his job taking care of his fields while at the same time raising cattle in his own pen located at his house. IMON International has been the backbone of his business because of having granted loans which have allowed him to improve his standard of living. This has been achieved through the acquisition of cattle and vegetables for planting. Today, once again, Olim trusts that his loan will be approved and he will be able to improve his business with the purchase of cattle and farm supplies to plant.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Laureana

texts.es: La señora Laureana se dedica a la elaboración D. pan en su domicilio hace 11 años labor que realiza con la ayuda D. su familia y su esposo quien le ayuda a comercializar entregando tienda por tienda en su barrio y en distintas zonas D. la ciudad D. Cochabamba el crédito que se le dio a  la Sra. Es para incrementar el capital D. trabajo que cuenta por que por la época D. frio aumenta la demanda D. pan y comprara Harina y manteca por cantidad, ella vive en casa propia, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Laureana has run a bakery for the last 11 years with the help of her family and husband, who help deliver bread to stores throughout Cochabamba. She now seeks credit to build her working capital ahead of the winter season's corresponding increase in demand for fresh bread.  She plans to buy flour and butter wholesale to increase production and meet local demand.  Laureana is a hardworking woman who supports her household and is very grateful for the access to credit she has been given.

loans.use: to increase working capital for a community bakery

loans.name: Mireya

texts.es:
La señora Mireya tiene 62 años de edad, vive con un hijo y su nuera, ella tuvo tres hijos, ya están casados, la señora es viuda desde hace 8 años. Es una persona trabajadora, responsable, luchadora ha sido clienta de la fundación en el área de capacitación.
La clienta se entero de la fundación por medio de capacitación, este es su primer crédito el cual va hacer invertido en la compra de una máquina de coser para hacer sus trabajos más detallados y de mejor calidad
Desde hace 10 años empezó con el negocio para generar ingresos en su casa, cuando murió su esposo ella tuvo que asumir la responsabilidad de la casa al principio fue muy duro pero ella poco a poco pudo ir saliendo adelante.
Doña Mireya hace sus compras en la mañana para que no le agarre la lluvia y el la tarde se dedica a vender y coser en las noches recoge  y se levanta temprano hacer las labores domesticas ya que su hijo y nuera trabajan
La meta que tiene la señora es poder ofrecer trabajo a otras personas por eso nos solicita crédito para crecer su empresa en equipo
Con este crédito la señora podrá tener su máquina y hacer sus costuras más detalladas y poder comprar materia prima de más calidad.
texts.en:
Mireya, 62, lives with her son and daughter-in-law.  She had three children who are all now married.  She’s been widowed for 8 years.  She is a hard working, responsible, tenacious woman who has been a client of the Fundación in its training area.

She found out about the Fundación through the training.  This is her first loan that she will use to buy a sewing machine to do more detailed, higher quality work.

She started the business 10 years ago to earn household income.  When her husband died she had to assume the responsibility for the home.  At first, it was very difficult but gradually she’s been able to get ahead.

Mireya does her purchases in the morning to avoid the afternoon rains.  In the afternoon she sells and sews and at night she cleans and straightens things up.  She rises early to do domestic chores because her son and daughter-in-law work.

Her goal is to be able to offer employment to other people and this is why she’s asking us for a loan so that she can have more equipment for her firm. With this loan, she’ll be able to have her machine and make more detailed stitches and be able to buy raw materials of higher quality.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is 56 years old and married to Shiprah. Together they have two children aged 29 and 25. He has been running his photography business for the past 10 years. He earns a monthly income of about KES 26,570, which he saves and uses in both his business and his personal use.

He has been loaned KES 60,000 from KADET Ltd. This is his second loan from KADET after paying back his previous loans well and in good time. He intends to use the loan to purchase an Epson photo cleaning machine and an HP computer. 

He plans to use the anticipated profit to buy another camera. His hope and dream is to operate his own photo studio to reduce the cost of production.

loans.use: to purchase a photo cleaning machine and a computer.

loans.name: Baker's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Baker’s” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 1,000,000.00 for each borrower, in order to invest in their businesses. 

David is the leader of this group. David is 48 years old and married with five children – two in primary school and three in secondary schools. For 20 years, David has been a businessman/baker. With the help of this loan, David is going to buy bags of flour, yeast, sugar, etc., in order to bake a larger quantity of breads for sale.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, yeast, sugar, etc., in order to bake a larger quantity of breads for sale.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata a 31 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants.  Elle  vit  dans une famille nucléaire  avec son mari et ses enfants  au quartier Bagadadji de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Enseignante de profession, elle mène également des activités génératrices qu’elle apprit auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments alimentaires. Fatoumata évolue dans le commerce d’articles divers tels l’achat vente de chaussures et d’habits pour fille depuis maintenant 10 ans. Elle est appréciée et jouit d’une grande expérience et clientèle. 
Dans le souci de faire de face à la demande clientèle, elle a fait   recours à Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui  elle est en relation depuis 54 mois. Après 3 prêts solidaires et deux prêts individuels tous correctement remboursés, elle est  à son 3ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 7 douzaines de chaussures en plastique. Elle s’approvisionne  à Bamako auprès des grossistes. Madame Fatoumata vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. Elle envisage de  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 85 000 FCFA, qui lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et de participer à des événements sociaux.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatoumata is 31 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She lives in a nuclear family with her husband and children in the Bagadadji district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). A teacher by profession, she also has a revenue-generating business, which she learned from her mother who used to sell condiments. For ten years now, Fatoumata has been doing commerce in a variety of goods, such as shoes and clothing for girls. She is valued and benefits from much experience and a large customer base. 

Concerned about coping with customer demand, she turned toward the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She has been associated with this institution for 54 months. After three solidarity loans and two individual loans, all properly repaid, she is now on her third individual loan, which she intends to use for buying 7 dozen plastic shoes. She gets her supplies from Bamako from wholesalers. 

Ms. Fatoumata accepts cash or credit from a customer base composed of women and men. She envisions making a monthly profits of 85,000 francs CFA that will enable her to repay her loan and to help out with life's occasions.

loans.use: to buy footwear

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Mariana es socia del banco comunal Mujeres en Progreso, vive por la parroquia de Baños, esta parroquia es muy visitada por sus aguas termales, por su variedad de platos típicos y por su gente que es muy amable y cordial.
 
Doña Mariana tiene 46 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 23, 18 y 13 años de edad, sus dos primeras hijas trabajan y también estudian en la  universidad y su último hijo estudia en el colegio. Su esposo labora como mecánico automotriz y tiene un propio taller, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. Mariana labora en un bar hace dos años, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde.  También se dedica a la venta de carnes asadas hace un año.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su séptimo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de carne para continuar con su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un vehículo.
texts.en: Mariana is a member of Mujeres en Progreso (Women in Progress) community bank. She lives in the parish of Baños, which is highly visited thanks to its hot springs, its variety of cuisine and for its friendly and cordial people. Mariana is 46 years old, married and has three children, ages 23, 18 and 13. Her first two daughters work and also study at a university, and her youngest son is in school. Her husband works as an auto mechanic and has his own shop. They don't own a home so they rent. Mariana has worked at a bar for the past two years, working Monday to Saturday from 7 a.m. until 3 p.m. She also has made a living selling meat for the past year. This is her seventh loan with the community bank, and she plans to invest in the purchase of meat to continue her business. Her dream is to have a vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase meat.

loans.name: Lennie

texts.en:
Lennie is married with three children. She is 36 years old and lives in Dumanhog, Siquijor Province. She sells Ready-to-Wear clothes to earn a living and had this business for one year.  Each month, she earns P 1,000 net income doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of P 7,000 as working capital in the said business.

Lennie has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for 2 months.  In the future, Lennie hopes to generate more income out from her business and be more productive.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing supplies to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Alphonce

texts.en:
Alphonce is 51 years old, is married, and has eight children. He does bicycle repairs to earn a living. He has operated this business for three years and has employed two people. He also works as a security guard. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business and learned how to save his money.

Within five years, Alphonce wants to start selling vehicle spare parts. He is requesting a loan of 39,000 Kenya shillings to buy bicycle spare parts and bicycle pressure pump.

loans.use: To buy bicycle spare parts and bicycle pressure pump

loans.name: Birane

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un adulte d'age mur qui exerce depuis 1987 dans la mécanique auto et la vente de pièces détachées.Il est marié polygamme avec deux épouses et six enfants dont deux sont à l'école.Son activité lui permet d'entretenir sa famille ainsi que ses quatre neveux dont il a la charge.Il sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter cinq caisses d'huile moteur et deux caisses de cartouches gazoil.Son ambition est d'élargir son magasin et de se lancer dans la commrce de voitures d'occasion.
texts.en: This borrower is a grown man who has been repairing cars and selling spare parts since 1987. He is in a polygamous marriage with two wives and six children, of whom two are enrolled in school. His business allows him to support his family as well as four nephews for whom he is responsible. He is asking for a loan of 200,000 francs to buy five cases of motor oil and two cases of diesel cartridges. His ambition is to expand his shop and start selling used cars.

loans.use: to buy five cases of motor oil and two cases of diesel cartridges.

loans.name: Revaz

texts.en:
Revaz is 52 years old. He lives in the village of Gvara, Adjara Region, West Georgia. Revaz lives with his family: wife – Mzia, 24 year-old-son, daughter-in-law and 5 year-old-granddaughter. Mzia works as teacher in the village. The rest of the adult family members are involved in family farming activities.

Revaz is leading the agricultural business of the family. They grow tangerines, lemons, oranges and nuts on 0.25 hectares of land. They sell their produce at the local market. Revaz and his son work hard in their garden during the year to get a good harvest in the fall. The total average income of the family is 550 Laris (approximately 340 USD). 

Revaz requested credit for a new business venture. With 1500 Laris he will purchase hay in Kakheti at a lower price and sell it in his village at a higher price. The profit will be used to purchase needed household goods to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase hay for resale

loans.name: Houn

texts.en: Houn is 41 years old. She plants and sells vegetables with her husband who earns $5 per day. They have four children: one is studying, two have their own careers and one more is only 3 years old. Every month, she has to spend $54 on food, $4 on school fees and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a motorbike for her son for traveling to work. She wants to start planting vegetables to sell when her son’s career grows and she will help him.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son for traveling to work.

loans.name: Orlith

texts.es: Orlith tiene 35 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su pareja y de sus dos hijos en su casa propia, que lo logró comprar con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Orlith, es la venta de comida específicamente "Juane", platillo típico de la selva. Para ello se levanta muy de temprano para preparar éste platillo, contando con la ayuda de su pareja, quien luego llevará todo lo preparado a un mercado informal de su ciudad, donde se encuentra su puesto de venta. Tiene 8 años dedicándose a esta actividad, tiempo el cual le ha valido para hacerse conocida y tener una regular clientela. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder contar con un ingreso económico propio que le permite apoyar en los gastos de su hogar a su pareja, así como en la educación de sus hijos. Considera rentable su negocio, porque su platillo es de consumo habitual además el rico sabor le ha dado bastante acogida, por ello espera mas adelante ampliar su negocio. Este sería el primer crédito con MFP, y se siente contenta por la oportunidad de contar con la ayuda de ustedes. Con el préstamo solicitado, comprará los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de Juanes, como arroz, pollo, condimentos, huevos, aceitunas.
texts.en:
Orlith, 35 years old, is a happy woman and a hard worker. She lives together with her partner and their two sons in their own house, which they were able to purchase with great effort. Orlith's business involves selling food, and in particular "Juane", a dish local to the jungle. She gets up very early to prepare this dish, relying on help from her partner, who then takes all the prepared Juane to an informal city market, where she has her stall. She has been working at this for the last eight years, in which time she has become well-known and built up a regular clientele. 

What she likes about this work is having a dependable income that allows her it to help her partner with the household expenses, as well as their children's education. Her business is profitable, as Juane is an everyday dish and its delicious taste has made it very popular. She is therefore hoping to expand her business in the future.  

This will be her first loan from Kiva Field Partner, MFP, and she is glad to have the opportunity to count on your help. With the requested loan, she will buy the necessary ingredients for the preparation of Juanes, such as rice, chicken, spices, eggs and olives.

loans.use: to buy rice, chicken, spices, eggs and olives.

loans.name: Yunus

texts.en:
Yunus is a 59-year-old man who is married and has been blessed with seven children:
•	Gustaf, 28, is working as a motorbike taxi driver
•	Raju, 26, has graduated from Senior High School
•	Erick, 23, is working as a motorbike taxi driver
•	Yuna, 20, is married
•	Yudith, 17, is studying at Vocational school grade 2
•	Wilson, 15, is studying at Vocational school grade 1
•	Rivan, 6, is studying at Elementary School grade 1.

Yunus has been running a seamstress (tailoring) business for more than 20 years. He was taught by his father how to sew when he was young. With the skill he learned from his father, Yunus went to Jakarta to work for five years. With the experience from his previous employer in Jakarta, Yunus decided to return home and commence his own business.   

From the seamstress business, Yunus is able to cover his family's daily needs. He can sew coats, trousers, skirts, etc. Lately, Yunus cannot finish his customer’s order on time since some equipment is not working properly. 

Yunus is requesting a loan of IDR 4,500,000 to purchase a hemming machine, button maker machine, and other materials to support his business. Through the loan, Yunus wishes to improve his income.

loans.use: to purchase a hemming machine, button maker machine, and other materials

loans.name: Darilla

texts.en: Darilla is 26 years old and married. She has a one-year-old son. She describes herself as a focused woman. Darilla has been running a salon in Nairobi west for the last two years. Her business is faced with the problem of inadequate funds to buy cosmetic products. She will be using this loan of KES 20,000 to add to her stock of cosmetics. In the future, Darilla wants to runs a beauty college.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es: Fortunata sigue participando en el banco comunal “Chaska” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Fortunata sigue dedicándose a la elaboración  de manualidades ósea teja chompas para niños, bebes, damas y caballeros. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Fortunata requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como lana, hilos y otros materiales más.
texts.en:
Fortunata continues her participation in the Chaska communal bank with the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.  Fortunata continues making handicrafts.  She knits sweaters for children, babies, women, and men.  She has been in this business for several years.  It is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

Fortunata now needs the loan to buy materials like wool, thread, and other materials.

loans.use: to buy materials like wool and thread.

loans.name: Myriam

texts.es:
La Sra. Myriam tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo, el cual es la razón de ser de Myrian. Ella se dedica al comercio, tiene una despensa en su casa, y además de eso hace sandwish para la venta en un colegio aledaño del barrio.
El negocio lo tiene montado ya hace 10 años, cuenta que le va muy bien ya que viven en una zona muy poblada, ella sola administra su despensa y gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido salir adelante.
Agradece a la fundacion ya que mediante los créditos otorgados su micro empresa fue creciendo, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, panificados y demás para la despensa, ya que se acerca los días festivos que es cuando hay más venta hay y para lo cual necesita surtirlo bien.
Myriam desea que su hijo se vaya formando como persona y dedicarse al estudio, por lo cual se esmera cada día para que a él no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Señora Myriam is 39 years old, a single mother, and has a son, who she lives for.  She works in sales and has a tiny shop in her house.  She also makes sandwhiches to sell at a local school in her neighborhood.  She has had her business for over 10 years, which has been going very well since she lives in a very populated area.  She works solely in the management of her shop and has been able to move forward thanks to all of her efforts.  

She is deeply appreciative of the foundation because her micro-business has grown because of their credits.  She is applying for a loan so that she may purchase grocery items, drinks, dairy products, baked goods, and other products for her shop since the holidays are approaching, which is when she needs to have the best inventory because of increase in sales.  

Myriam hopes that her son keeps studying and as such works hard every day to ensure that he never lacks anything.

loans.use: purchase groceries, drinks, dairy products, baked goods, and other food items.

loans.name: Yoeurn's Group

texts.en:
A widow from a village of the Tbaung Khmum district, Yoeurn is a 56-year-old mother of six children, two of whom are dependents working in the rice field and the others work for a fee. She has been farming a rice paddy and planting cassava as a primary business to earn a living for twenty years. Sometimes, she works for others to raise extra income. She earns more than US$10 per day to feed her big family and saves five U.S. dollars daily. 

This is Yoeurn's first group loan with Vision Fund. She leads a group of six female members applying for a loan. She will use her portion of the loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
Faustino es una persona joven, de profesión electromecánico, está acompañado, tiene una hija de 4 años, vive en la ciudad de Pilar. Es una persona muy activa, responsable y trabajadora, con muchas amistades, muy querida en el barrio.
El nos comenta que empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas del día y que vuelve a la casa ya muy entrada la noche. Su deseo es poder darle a su familia todo lo mejor, todo lo que el no tuvo, para que no pasen por privaciones. Desea que su hija pueda ir a la escuela y se convierta, en el futuro, en una persona de bien.
Manifiesta que solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos y accesorios de vehículos para poder tener disponible los mismos cuando tenga que utilizarlos. Agradece por la oportunidad que Kiva y fundación paraguaya le están dando.
texts.en:
Faustino is a young person and a professional electromechanic.  He is in a relationship and has a 4 year old daughter.  He lives in the town of Pilar. Faustino is very active, responsible and hardworking.  He has many friends, and is loved in the neighborhood.

Faustino comments that he begins work at very early hours of the day and returns home very late at night. His desire is to give his family the best, all the things that he did not have, so that they do not go through hardships.  Faustino wants his daughter to go to school and to become a good person in the future.

Faustino is requesting a loan to purchase vehicle parts and accessories to have available when he needs them. He thanks Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity they are giving him.

loans.use: Buy spare parts to supply his shop.

loans.name: Agrimano

texts.en:
Agrimano is 41 years old and married. He lives with his wife and their children, in the province of Isabela. Agrimano is a farmer who grows agricultural crops. He buys and sells his products in San Antonio.

He applies for the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow rice and corn. The loan helps him to increase his income for the benefit of his family and to invest in his business. His dream is to increase his crop  in order to earn more money and thus have a better living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to grow for his farming business

loans.name: Edvar
