texts.es: Edvar está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo el podrá comprar enseres para su vivienda como ollas platos, cubiertos, cocina, entre otros, ya que debido a las lluvias ha perdido sus pertenencias y de esta manera podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, así el podrá seguir esforzándose en su empleo como locutor de radio y seguira luchando para poder hacer realidad sus gran sueño:2” construir su vivienda de material noble”.
texts.en: Edvar is very grateful to Kiva lenders; thanks to their support, he will be able to buy household goods such as pots, plates, cutlery, and a stove, among other items, since he has lost his belongings due to the rain. In this manner, he will be able to improve his family's quality of life. In this way, he will be able to continue to work hard as a radio announcer and strive to achieve his ambitious dream: to build his home out of quality materials.

loans.use: to buy household goods.

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en: Mirriam is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
O. Christopher is an active member of Life in Africa. He joined almost 6 months ago because of his passion for crafts and this has earned him a good job as a bracelet maker for the Invisible Children Bracelet project. To suppliment what he earns he also works part time in the stone quarry.

He is 30 years old and was born in Northern Uganda. His childhood was stolen from him by the rebels when they attacked, brutally killing most of his relatives including his mother. He managed to survive but was forced to flee and he ended up in the displaced persons camp in Kampala known as the Acholi Quarters. Now he is married with four children of his own. They are all safe from rebel attacks but they still live in horrible conditions in the camp. His dream is to give his children what he has never had. A safe and permanent home where they can live in peace.

He has acquired a plot of land and he plans to build a home for his children. He has been saving and already has part of the money he will need. To add to his savings he is seeking a loan in the amount ot 800,000. He will be able to repay this loan in 12 months.

Cement 15 bags @ 18,000/=...... 270,000/= Transport â€“. ..................70,000/= Sand 2 trips................... 150,000/= Labour -....................... 150,000/= Bricks 3000 @ 65/=..............195,000/= Communication.................... 8,000/=

Total...........................843,000/=

O. has saved 100,000/= to help him complete this project. He promises , with utmost good faith to service this loan in a period of 12 months in sums of 80,000/= monthly.

WE Team to benefit: Talent Discovery

loans.use: Buying materials for building family House

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Restocking

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina is 45 years old, she is married and has 3 children aged 24, 19 and 11. Her husband works laying flooring, however as there has not been stable income for the family, there have been hard times when unexpected expenses arise. Ernestina wants her children to attend university, and so, in order to pay for this expense and other family expenses, she started selling shoes, as recommended by a good friend. Sales have increased as she is a good sales person and is motivated by the income available to her family.

Ernestina's clients are increasing and she needs to cover the costs in order to have the needs of her clients met, in order to offer them a good service. For this reason, she needs a loan of $475 which she will use to buy merchandise, to have variety and to grow her business. You can help Ernestina and the life of her family by making a contribution.

loans.use: Merchandise purchases

texts.en: Mrs. T. is 47 years old, as is her husband. They have 5 children: 2 sons and 3 daughters, between 9 and 18 yrs. The children are all at school. They live in Nghe An province, a rural province in the upper middL. of Vietnam. They raise chickens, pigs, and water buffaloes. They also have land 4 kms away from their home, where they grow lemon, jackfruit and tea. They want to build a kitchen and bathroom attached to their house, as at the moment they don't have a bathroom at all.

loans.use: To build a kitchen and bathroom

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia works as for a cleaning service in the Viru Viru airport in the city of Santa Cruz. She has been married for 13 years to Mr. Valerio Apaica, who works as a bricklayer in Warnes. Together they take care of their four children, aged 12, 10 , 8 and 5. All of the children are in school, except the youngest, who stays with his mother, even when she has to go to work. The family lives in two small rooms right now, becuse Cecilia's parents live with them. They need to find financing with which to build 3 additional rooms, so that their children can live more comfortably.

Cecilia is a regular full time employee of the cleaning business. She has worked for the same company for more than 5 years, and her husband has always had work as a bricklayer for various construction companies. There is competition for cleaning jobs, since many people do that kind of work, but Cecilia stands out for her experience and the effort she puts into her work.

The loan will be used to build the 3 additional rooms the family needs. The cost of the construction will depend on the particular requirements of the job and the construction company. The family has an excellent credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer

Cecilia trabaja como operaria en la empresa D. limpieza Tote´s en el Aeropuerto D. Viru Viru en la ciudad D. Santa Cruz, esta casada hace 13 años apróximadamente con el señor Valerio Apaica quien se desempeña como albañil en Warnes. Ambos mantienen a sus cuatro hijos D. 12, 10, 8 y 5 años respectivamente, todos los niños asisten a una escuelita fiscal a excepción del último que queda a cargo D. la madre D. Cecilia cuando ella tiene que trabajar. La familia vivía en dos cuartitos, debido a que ahora los padres D. Cecilia viven con ellos se vieron en la necesidad D. buscar financiamiento para construir 3 cuartos mas, esto a fin D. dar comodidad también a sus hijos.

Cecilia es empleada fija D. la empresa D. limpieza, cuenta con más D. 5 años D. antigüedad en Tote´s, por otra parte su esposo también siempre se dedicó a trabajar como albañil en diferentes construcciones. Existe una competencia media en el sector debido a que hay personas que también se dedican al mismo rubro pero la experiencia y esfuerzo que pone Cecilia en su trabajo la distingue D. otras personas.

El financiamiento es para la construcción D. los 3 cuartos mas que necesitan, el costo D. los mismos es variado ya que depenD. al requerimiento D. la obra y D. los proovedores D. material D. construcción. Tiene antecedentes crediticios excelentes.

loans.use: Enlarge her home

loans.name: Kolo

texts.en: Touré Kolo is a dynamic and ambitious tradesman. Touré is single and 32 years old. He lives in Cocody in Abidjan and has his food store in Treichville, in the south of the Abidjan region. Touré wholesale sells potatoes and crops, He joined the AE&I microfinance program early in 2005. He has benefited various loans that he has reimbursed in a timely manner. He has rapidly diversified his product range. Touré wants to replenish his store with onions and dry peppers imported from neighboring country Niger. His products are sold in vast quantities at the end of year because of parties and feasts. Touré is a people person and a entrepreneurial business oriented man.

loans.use: Touré Kolo will purchase batches of onions and peppers from neighboring country Niger

loans.name: Asma

texts.en: My name is Asma I.. I am 22 and married. I live with my husband in Arifwala, a small city in Pakistan. My husband is a rickshaw driver and I embroider clothes on order  from various shopkeepers. At present, I make handmade embroidered dresses but now I want to buy a computerized embroidery machine for myself. This way I will be able to produce clothes with the latest designs and fashions in a large quantity. It will also save my time on every item that I create. Please give me a loan.

loans.use: Buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
For part of her life, Mrs. M. worked as a cleaner but, eight years ago, she decided to strike out on her own with the goal of helping her husband with household expenses and providing a better quality of life for their children.

She started as a street vendor in Leon's La Terminal market, selling costume jewelry, and looking, at the same time, for a permanent spot there to set up a business. A short time later, Mrs. M. was lucky enough to find a market stall and she's now meeting her targets for increased sales.

Mrs. M. owes her success to Ceprodel and the 41 loans that she has used to to gradually expand the products that she can sell in Leon's market.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Parte de su vida la Sra, M. se ha desempeñado como trabajadora domestica, desde hace ocho años decide trabajar por cuenta propia con el objetivo de apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar además de ofrecer un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos.

Inicia vendiendo de forma ambulante en todo el mercado La Terminal con la venta de bisutería y a la vez solicita un espacio a la intendencia del mismo mercado para establecer su negocio sin ningún problema. Al poco temo la señora M. fue beneficiada con la entrega de un espacio por lo cual decidió establecer sus canastos y hasta la fecha ha logrado los objetivos propuestos como es incrementar sus ganancias.

Estos logros de la señora M. se deben exclusivamente al apoyo que solicitó en Ceprodel la cual le han otorgado 41 créditos que los ha podido aprovechar grandemente ampliando sus artículos de venta en el mercado de la ciudad de León.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Kalungi C Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for seven months.  They sell fruits and vegetables, and with this loan they plan to build stalls to better sell their fruit.



This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to expand business.

loans.name: Ida's Group

texts.en:
This committee of 18 working women began with the efforts of the group leader Julia Benitez. She gathered some of her friends, presented them with the idea of taking out a loan together through the Fundación Paraguaya, and they in turn got some of their friends. Now their group is large and the women are working well together.

They hope to secure a loan together to help augment their businesses. Everything from gardening businesses, to baking, and selling clothes. These women, although separate, are very united. They trust one another and their dependence ensures that all the payments are made on time.

loans.use: To buy a large variety of things: clothing, fabric, buttons, hair products, Campos, and conditioners, plants, gardening tools and fertilizer

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is forty-one years old and the proud mother of five sons, the youngest of whom is seventeen. They all attend school. To supplement her family’s income, Jose sells an assortment of perfumes, pants, shoes, slippers, silver jewelry, beauty products, and the like. She started her business a few years ago with a loan she took from FSMA.

Currently, Josefina has a lot of customers that visit her each day to purchase her goods. She’s requesting a loan to buy more products in order to satisfy her customers’ needs. Josefina’s business supports her children’s education.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, perfumes, and beauty products for her small business

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Ven S. is 40 years old and living in Kampong Cham province managing her household and caring for her children who are all still living in the family home.  Her older two children are garment factory workers and the youngest is a student.  Ann Eng, her husband, provides for their family as a motortaxi driver.  His motorbike, however, is old and becoming inoperable.  She wants to provide for her family by purchasing her husband a new motorbike to be used to taxi around clients.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es:
Rosalio is requesting a loan to invest it on improving his house by pealing out the walls and re-painting it, he lives in Nueva Guinea, has been working in the hospital Jacinto Hernandez as an Rx technician for the last 21 years, he is a hard working man and responsible who has worked for the good of the community, currently he is studying to be a nurse, although this client has no kids, he is responsible for taking care of his parents. Rosalio is an example of a good son, his dream is to have an honorable house and work stability to help his family, because they have very few economic resources.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

El Cliente Rosalio está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es repellar y pintar su vivienda, habita en Nueva Guinea, trabaja para el hospital Jacinto Hernández como Tecnico de Radiologia desde hace 21 años, es un hombre trabajador y responsable que ha trabajado para el bien de la comunidad, actualmente está estudiando una Licenciatura en enfermeria, a pesar que este cliente no tiene hijos, el asume la responsabilidad del cuido de sus padres. Rosalio es un ejemplo de hijo, su sueño es tener una vivienda digna y estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia, ya que son de escasos recursos económicos.

loans.use: Peal out the walls and paint his one room house / Repellar paredes y pintar su casa de habitación

loans.name: Abla

texts.en: Abla is 24 years old. She is married, and has two little girls. She lives with her family in Tyre, located in Southern Lebanon. Abla operates a small perfume and make-up shop. Abla has requested a loan before, and last year she used her funds to remodel and improve her store. This time, Able would like a loan of $800 to purchase and restock her supplies of perfumes and cosmetics, allowing her to improve her business and client base.

loans.use: USD 800 to purchase enough merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana, due to her efforts and hard work was able to establish a store in her home. This is convenient for her since it allows her to watch her daughters. The income from Ana’s store provides for the daily provisions for her home and pays for the education of her daughters which makes this an indispensable business for the family. With a desire to increase her profits, Ana wishes to increase the products she sells and to stock her store with a variety of merchandise. In order to do this she needs the loan she is requesting. She promises to be responsible in making the payments on the loan as Ana knows that the money that you loan her also comes from great effort and hard work. This is why she will treat your contribution as hugely valuable help which will not be erased from her memory.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Ana, en base a esfuerzo y trabajo logró instalar una tienda en su domicilio, lo que es conveniente para que ella no descuide la atención de sus hijas.Las ganancias de la bodega de Ana es la provisión diaria de su casa y lo que solventa los gastos de educación de sus hijas, lo que lo hace un negocio indispensable para esta familia.Con el deseo de incrementar estas ganancias Ana pretende incrementar los productos que vende y surtir su tienda con variedad de mercadería.Para ello requiere de la cantidad de dinero que solicita en calidad de préstamo con la promesa de ser responsable en sus pagos, además Ana sabe que el dinero que ustedes le pueden brindar también proviene de esfuerzo y trabajo, por ello considera que su aporte sería una ayuda tan valiosa, que no se borrará de su memoria.

loans.use: Capital investment to increase the merchandise in her store.

loans.name: Emaam

texts.en:
Emaam J., a resident of Ningarhar Province, is 21 and the married father of two children, aged five and three years. Emaam and his family have been living in their own small village house for about three years, since the death of his father for whom he had worked in a retail capacity in Jalalabad.

Since arriving in the village at his uncle’s behest, Emaan has been farming successfully, growing wheat, corn, eggplant, tomatoes and okra, but he would now like to buy seeds and insecticides in order to expand his produce range and market.  For these reasons he is requesting a loan of $1075 for a period of 23 months.

Emaam J. hopes to achieve his target and make his dreams come true. He desires to bring about positive changes in his life and that of his family, as well as in the lives of other poor people. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Amina M. from Mwanza. She is married with two children, ages 12 and 14 years. Amina has been running a beauty salon (called a "saloon") since 2003. She works at the business for 8  hours per day, 7 days per week, and she is assisted by one employee. Amina currently earns about US$170 from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$450 in order to purchase more equipment for her salon such as  a hair drier, weavings, and hair tonic. In the future, she plans to increase her equipment and have a better quality office. Amina thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase beauty shop equipment

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam has been selling "vitenge" in Dodoma, Tanzania for five years. Vitenge is a local fabric that is brightly colored and decorated with robust patterns. People in Tanzania use vitenge for everything from clothing to head wraps to tablecloths to baby slings. Mariam is taking out her first loan so that she may expand her inventory of the material in her shop.

Mariam is 42 years old, married, and has 7 children. In addition, she helps to care for 8 other dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Jeska, Diana, Kilstina, and Masa.

loans.use: To buy more "vitenge" for her business

loans.name: Kisimba Women's Group

texts.en:
Mariam N. is a member of the Kisimba women’s group in Lugazi. She is a married businesswoman with a retail shop that she has owned for six years. Her husband helps her out with the shop at times, as well as providing the family with food and a decent shelter.

Before joining her lending group, Mariam says that her shop was so small that a time came when she was selling almost nothing. But with the coming of loans, her shop is now self-sustaining and will need a few pushes every time she gets a loan.

Thanks to the loans she has received, all the products in her shop are now in large quantities and, as a result, her family is better off. She is now able to pay school fees for her children. Mariam also plans to build commercial houses for rent in her trading centre and transform her shop into a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Gunduz

texts.en: Gunduz lives in Khachmaz town. He was born in 1957. He is a widow. He has cooked kabab for 3 years. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy meat  for cooking the tasty kabab.

loans.use: to buy meat for cooking the tasty kabab

loans.name: Doussouba

texts.fr:
Madame  Doussouba D. est âgée de 34 ans et vit dans une famille monogame avec son mari et ses 2 enfants au quartier pelengana Nord de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Malgré les études de secretariat, elle mènait parallèlement des activités génératrices de revenus. Son apprentissage s’est effectué auprès de sa mère  une grande commerçante très connue au niveau de la ville de Segou. Ainsi elle a su concilier ses activités scolaires et ses activités commerciales(des habits, des articles divers).
Depuis 4 ans que ses études viennent de prendre fin, elle ne mène que cette activité d’achat et de vente d’habits notamment les bazins. Elle est sollicitée lors des cérémonies de mariages, de baptêmes et les grandes fêtes de l’année.
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est son 1er prêt individuel pour un montant de 375 000 FCFA.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 2 pièces de bazins riches .Elle s’approvisionne auprès de commerçants à partir du Burkina Faso, de la république du  Sénégal et de  Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Madame Doussouba D. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui servira à prendre certaines charges familiales et faire face à certains évènements sociaux.
texts.en:
Mrs.Doussouba D. is 34 years old and lives in a monogamistic family with her husband and two children in the Pelengana district of North Segou (the fourth administrative region in the Republic of Mali). Although she studied to be a secretary, she was also active in businesses that earned income.She was taught by her mother, who was a well known business woman in the city of Segou. She was, therefore, well educated in both school and business activities (sales of suits and assorted articles). These studies ended four years ago and since then she has specialized only in buying and selling suits, notably made of bazins (damask cloth). She is solicited for weddings, baptisms and popular holidays during the year. In order to satisfy her ever increasing clientele, she has joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance bank. This is her first individual loan request for the amount of 375,000 FCFA. She plans to use the loan to buy 2 pieces of high quality bazins cloth.She will purchase the material from suppliers in Burkina Faso in the Republic of Senegal and in Bamako, capital of the Republic of Mali. Mrs.Doussouba D. sells for cash or credit and her clientele are both men and women. With this loan the hopes to earn an income of 100,000 FCFA, which would be used to meet family expenses and to prepare for certain social events.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase high quality bazin (damask cloth)

loans.name: Carmen  Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Bancomunal Los Viñedos. 
Carmen es casada, tiene 45 años, vive en casa de sus padres, estudio enfermería y para maestra de educación primaria, de joven lo ejerció, pero decidió cambiar de trabajo y entro a trabajar en un taller de costura por quince años, hasta que renuncio,  pero esta vez quiso tener algo propio ya no trabajar para otros, y hace un año  se matriculo en un curso de  zapatería, donde empezó hacer pantuflas y zapatos valerinas, empezó confeccionando una docena de pantuflas y en menos de una semana las vendió, todo lo que hace lo ofrece a sus amigas.
                              
Desde que esta en Finca  se siente segura por los prestamos que recibe, tiene para invertir y compra los materiales al por mayor, le gusta las reuniones del banquito por que comparte experiencias de negocio, nuevas ideas., Las charlas le han ayudado ha  saber como llevar su negocio
Necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para compra de materiales como terocal micro-poroso, telas, plantillas  para la confección de  zapatos, y lleva a bordar sus diseños a gamarra.  
El sueño que Carmen tiene es tener  local donde vender sus trabajos y sus manualidades.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the “Los Viñedos” Communal Bank. Carmen is married, 45 years old, and lives in her parent’s home. She studied nursing and to be an elementary school teacher, and when she was younger she worked in this field but she decided to change professions and she worked in a seamstress shop for 15 years until she retired. But now she would like to have her own business and not work for others, so a year ago she enrolled in a cobbler course, where she began to make slippers and dance shoes. She began making a dozen slippers and in less than a week she sold them. She sells everything she makes to her friends. Since she has been with Finca she feels assured of the loans she receives, she uses them to invest and buy materials at wholesale. She enjoys the bank’s meetings because at the meetings strategies to grow one’s business, new ideas, etc. are shared. The instructional talks have helped her know how to run her business. She needs a loan for 1000 soles to buy materials such as fabrics and insoles to make shoes, and embroider her designs. Carmen dreams of having her own locale to sell her products and handicrafts.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy materials such as fabrics and insoles to make shoes, and embroider her designs

loans.name: Ore

texts.es: Ore es una mujer trabajadora y muy querida en su barrio, a sus 51 años, vive con su pequeña hija, en una casa alquilada donde funciona su negocio. Ore es la administradora de uno de los restaurantes más concurridos, de la ciudad de Puno, el “Costa Verde”, tiene menús muy surtidos y la comida es muy deliciosa, sus clientes salen con la barriga llena y muy contentos. Ella espera tener un restaurante con ambientes adecuados, donde sus clientes se sientan cómodos. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es atender a sus comensales, ya que siempre los atiende muy rápido, en los 2 años que lleva en este negocio ha aprendido a trabajar bajo la presión de sus clientes y es justamente eso lo más difícil de su negocio, puesto que siempre trata de satisfacer a todos lo que comen en su restaurante. Su deseo más grande es brindarle un buen futuro a su pequeña niña, a la cual quiere mucho. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy alegre y siempre está al tanto de todos los acuerdos que tienen entre socias. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en comprar más mesas y sillas para su restaurante, también adquirirá más alimentos para cocinar, lo cual le costará aproximadamente 800 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Ore is a hard-working woman who is well-liked in her neighborhood. She is 51 years old and lives with her young daughter in a rented house, where she also operates her business. Ore is the administrator for one of the most popular restaurants in the city of Puno. The Costa Verde [Green Coast] offers a wide variety of dishes and the food is delicious; its clients leave with full stomachs and very satisfied with their meal. Ore hopes to have a restaurant with just the right atmosphere, where her clients can feel comfortable. The thing she likes most about her job is serving her dinner guests, seeing she always attends to them very quickly. During the two years Ore has worked in this business, she has learned to work under pressure, which is exactly the most difficult part of her business, seeing she always tries hard to satisfy all her clients. Her greatest wish is to provide a good future to her young daughter, whom she loves dearly. This is Ore's second loan with [kiva.org partner] Microfinanzas Prisma (MFP) and she understands that she must make her payments on time. At her community bank she is very happy and always on top of all the agreements among the members. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase more tables and chairs for her restaurant. She also will acquire additional ingredients for cooking, which will cost about 800 nuevos soles [about US$ 250].

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of furniture for her restaurant

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome M. has owned a small kiosk (minishop) and been a khanga seller in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma for 6 years.  ( The khanga is a piece of brightly coloured rectangular cloth that is wrapped round the body.) She belongs to the Migombani group loan (Group code 2026).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $250.  Every day she works for 12 hours at her business.  Salome is 46 years old, married, and has three children: ages 29, 25, and 4. She also cares for one additional dependent. 

Salome is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more khangas and other items for her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more store inventory.

loans.name: Ramshed

texts.ru: Рамшед и его отец арендуют торговое место в универмаге поселка Нефтеабад. Они торгуют здесь уже несколько лет и имеют своих постоянных клиентов. Рамшед женат, ему 24 года. За товаром ездит он сам в неделю 2 раза. За счет умеренной цены у него много покупателей. Рамшед собирается немного расширить свой оборотный капитал и поэтому подал заявку на КИВА.
texts.en:
Ramshed and his father rent a vendor space in a supermarket of the Nefteabad village. They have been selling there for several years and has regular customers. Ramshed is married, he is 24 years old. He travels to bring the merchandise twice a week. Because of low prices he has many buyers. Ramshed plans to increase his working capital a bit and this is why he applied for a loan at Kiva.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Muhamadali

texts.en:
V. Muhamadali, 31 years old, is married and has three children. Muhamadali has been engaged in the business of selling clothing and shoes for the last 10 years. He has a truck, which allows him to carry his goods from the neighboring city every month. Muhamadali also provides transportation services on his truck. 

Muhamadali dreams of his children becoming educated people, and he is working hard toward this end. As a result, the business generates significant income, allowing him supporting his family. 

Currently, Muhamadali needs to purchase more clothing and shoes for expanding his business. For this purpose, he is requesting $1,500. This is his first loan; however, Muhamadali is sure he will pay the loan on time.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes for expanding his business.

loans.name: San Cayetano-Potrerito Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formo a través de la Sra. Maria M., quien se entero del programa por medio de una comadre y como tenia vecinas muy trabajadoras decidio formar su grupo en el Barrio Potrerito. Todas se esmeran dia a dia en vender sus productos para tener beneficios y llevarlo al hogar. 

Ellas son muy unidas y se ayudan entre si. Todas son independientes en sus labores como vendedoras de ropas, venta de comidas, venta de frutas, Peluquera, etc. y reciben de crédito en un promedio de Gs. 704.700 cada una.

Las integrantes son: 

1	Maria M.	-  Venta de Pollo
2	Virginia M.	-  Venta de mandioca
3	Eumelia M.	-  Venta de comida 
4	Beatriz M.	-  Peluquera
5	Juana V.	-  Venta de Comida
6	Sonia Centurión	-  Venta de Cosmético
7	Ilda V.	-  Venta de mandioca
8	Juliana R.	-  Venta de mandioca
9	María L.	-  Venta de ropa
10	Lucía López	-  Venta de ropa
11	Rosalina M.	-  Venta de comida
12	Fatima R.	-  Venta de mandioca
13	Maria M.	-  Venta de ropa
14	Raquel V.	-  Venta de ropa usada
15	Dionisia V.	  -  Venta de mandioca
16	Florentina L.	-  Venta de leche
17	Nilda S.	-  Venta de frutas
18	Mirian J.	-  Venta de ropa
19	Flora F.	 -  Venta de ropa
20	Ester F.	-  Venta de perfumes
21	Nancy S.	-  Venta de comidas
texts.en:
This committee was started by Maria M., who found out about the program through a close friend and since she had some hard-working neighbors, decided to start a group in Barrio Potrerito. Each of them makes an effort every day to sell their products so they have earnings to take home. They are united and help each other out. All of them work independently selling clothing, food, fruit, as hairdressers etc. and they received an average loan of Gs. 704,700 each. The members are: 1 Maria M. - sells chicken 2 Virginia M. - sells cassava 3 Eumelia M. - sells food 4 Beatriz M. - hairdresser 5 Juana V. - sells food 6 Sonia Centurión - sells cosmetics 7 Ilda V. - sells cassava 8 Juliana R. - sells cassava 9 María L. - sells clothing 10 Lucía López - sells clothing 11 Rosalina M. - sells food 12 Fatima R. - sells cassava 13 Maria M. - sells clothing 14 Raquel V. - sells second-hand clothing 15 Dionisia V. - sells cassava 16 Florentina L. - sells milk 17 Nilda S. - sells fruit 18 Mirian J. - sells clothing 19 Flora F. - sells clothing 20 Ester F. - sells perfume 21 Nancy S. - sells food

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods.

loans.name: Fatto

texts.ru: Фатто 49 лет, женат и имеет 3 детей. Не имеет постоянной работы и поэтому занимается куплей продажей скота на местных рынках. Его жена тоже сидит дома и помогает мужу, когда он не может продать скот на рынке и приводит его домой. Тогда жена кормит скотину, смотрит за ней и на следующем рынке Фатто продает ее. Кроме скотины, которой Фатто занимается куплей продажей, дома он держит свою собственную скотину тоже. Для расширения своего бизнеса Фатто обратился в МикроИнвест и получив займ стал покупать больше скота и увеличил свою прибыль. Свой новый займ Фатто собирается также пустить на увеличения своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Fatto is 49 years old, married and has 3 children. Because he does not hold a permanent job, Fatto is involved in buying and selling livestock at local markets. His wife stays at home and helps her husband. She brings unsold livestock home from the markets. She also feeds the livestock and takes care of it until Fatto sells it at the next market. Fatto wants to expand his business and requested this loan from MicroInvest in order to purchase additional livestock and increase his profits.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Ermilita

texts.en:
Ermilita C. is from the barangay (village) of Napilan, Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years of age and has only one child. She has been in her business, which is a sari-sari store, for over six years. She makes 5,000 PHP every month from her sari-sari store.

Ermilita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Ermilita is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store. The profits she earns from her project have been a great help to her family. She can now meet their daily needs and send her child to school.

loans.use: To restock a sari-sari store

loans.name: Maravillosas Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal “Panamericana” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal  “Maravillosas”, un grupo de señoras que se preocupan por su salud y todas acuden al consultorio para hacerse la prueba del  Papanicolau, a la cabeza de su presidenta  Martha E.. 
Una de las integrantes es Graciela C., quien cuenta que llegó al grupo cuando ya estaba conformado, una amiga la había invitado, es un grupo muy unido y alegre indica.

Todas las integrantes tienen diferentes negocios como la venta de comida, fruta, elaboración de muebles, tejido de mantas y otros. Ellas invertirán el préstamo en  comprar mayor mercadería/compra de materia prima y tener  productos surtidos para  ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the Panamericana Community Center, you will find the “Maravillosas” Association. These women are concerned about their health and all of them have arrived at the medical clinic to receive a pap test. Martha E. is the president of this group. One of the members is Graciela C., who joined after a friend invited her. They are a close and cheerful group.

All members have different businesses such as selling food, fruit, furniture, fabric, blankets and other items. They will use their loan to buy more merchandise, purchase raw materials, and increase the product selection offered to their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and raw materials

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en la casa que le heredaron sus padres. Desde hace más de 10 años se dedica al comercio de diferentes objetos, tales como artesanías y artículos diversos para el hogar. Además, desde hace 5 años comenzó a vender comida en la puerta de su casa, la cual está ubicada en una avenida muy transitada de su localidad. La venta de comida la realiza con preferencia los fines de semana, los días de ferias comerciales, para eso prepara platos típicos que son los más consumidos por su clientela. Para esta actividad cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo y una de sus hijas que siempre está con ella. Los demás días de la semana elabora artesanías para distribuirlas a los comerciantes de estos artículos. Para el futuro, Olinda desea continuar con la venta de comida, pero en un local donde implemente un restaurante donde ofrezca de manera permanente platos típicos de su región. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una persona que persevera y apoya el trabajo en equipo para lograr buenos resultados. Es así que se compromete, una vez más, a trabajar de esa manera en el banco comunal que integra. El dinero que vienen solicitando será destinado a la compra de los ingredientes, al por mayor, para la preparación de sus comidas, también adquirirá bancas y mesas nuevas para la atención de su clientela.
texts.en:
Olinda is a 41-year-old woman who lives with her husband and children in the house that they inherited from her parents. For 10 years, she has been selling miscellaneous items, such as handicrafts and home essentials. Additionally, five years ago she started selling food in front of her house, which is located on a very busy street in her town. She sells food preferably on weekends and on street market days. In order to do so, she prepares the traditional foods that are most popular with her patrons. For this business, she has the help of her husband and one of her daughters who is always with her. The rest of the weekdays, she makes handicrafts to distribute them to vendors. In the future, Olinda would like to continue her food business, but in a business space where she can set up a restaurant to sell regional cuisine permanently. This is the third time that she requests a loan from MFP. She is a team-player who perseveres so that she can obtain good results. Thus, she commits to once again cooperate with her microfinance institute. The money that she is requesting will be used to purchase the ingredients (wholesale) that she needs to prepare her meals. She will also obtain new benches and chairs for her patrons.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food and furniture for her business

loans.name: Thelma

texts.es: Thelma B. Z. tiene la actividad económica de venta de ropa. Es una Señora de 43 años. Tiene 4 hijos a su cargo. Ella da inicio a su negocio porque no tenía un trabajo para sustentar a sus hijos. Por lo que decide incursionar en este negocio, con sus propios esfuerzos decide comprar un poco de camisetas, calcetines y pantalones. Por lo que logro obtener muy buenos resultados y así decide mantener este negocio, a pesar del poco tiempo que tenia para sus hijos. Pero con paso del tiempo logro ordenar su tiempo con el negocio y sus hijos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de vestidos, shorts, camisas, ropa interior y faldas. Su mayor sueño es obtener una pulpería.
texts.en:
Thelma B. Z. is in the business of selling clothes. She is 43 years old and has 4 dependent children. She began her business because she did not have a job to support her children. At first she started buying a few shirts, socks and pants. She experienced good results and decided to continue with her business even though it meant spending less time with her children.

The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to purchase dresses, shorts, shirts, underwear and skirts. She hopes to open a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza runs a general store business situated in front of their house. Aside from selling different groceries, she also retails plastic wares like durabox (plastic cabinets), bamboo sala sets (living room furniture), other appliances, and a lot more. She lives in a place away from the town proper so she thought of selling those items to reach customers in their distant and remote village of Capellan, Ilagan, Isabela. She uses her income in sustaining the educational needs of her two children. 

Analiza is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to be used as her additional business capital to buy more items to be displayed just beside their house so as to grow her business.

Analiza is already 36 years old and is married to Gil, a farmer. They are blessed with two children who are both studying in the primary level: Gilina, 10 years old and Angelo, 6 years old. Analiza is hoping to give her children a full education. She doesn’t want them to experience the hardship of life she and her husband had been experiencing before because they were not able to gain a good education in college or even in high school.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Fuseina

texts.en: Fuseina is thirty – eight years old. She is married and has given birth to one child, a daughter who is in school. She is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and daughter in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Fuseina is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice and stew in the mornings by the road side in her community. She procures her raw materials from Kumasi. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Amor Y Paz 4 Group

texts.en:
Olga C. is a borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the group coordinator for Amor y Paz 1 (Love and Peace), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in her group.

Olga (Pictured: center) is 55 years old and lives with her husband and two boys, an 11-year-old and a 19-year-old. They live in Batey Caimito, a beautiful community in the hills of the east-central region of the Dominican Republic. A batey is a community of sugarcane field workers in the rural areas of the Dominican Republic. Bateyes are very remote, hard to access, and most people live in deep poverty. They often lack potable water, medicine, and any kind of reliable electricity.

In order to feed her family and send her children to school, Olga sells used clothing to her community. Typically, packs of used clothes will arrive from the United States, and Olga will buy them to sell for a profit. She will also use this loan to purchase charcoal, a valuable commodity in a community without reliable electricity. 

Olga hopes that she will be able to send her two boys to university, giving them a step up in society. One will soon be done with high school, and the other is just entering middle school. This is Olga’s fourth loan with Esperanza, and she has a perfect repayment record! Thank you for lending to Olga and the Amor y Paz group!

loans.use: Used clothes and charcoal

loans.name: G.s. Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es: El Grupo solidario Mujeres Unidas está compuesto por Raquel P. Dávila y Magda Azucena S. C. ambas son personas muy trabajadoras y luchadoras. Raque se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Ella inicio por su Mama quien era la que se dedicaba a este tipo de negocio, por lo que le enseño desde muy niña a ganarse la vida. En cambio Magda se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella tiene 3 hijos que mantener su esposo trabaja en el ejército pero como sus ingresos eran muy bajos no eran suficientes para la manutención de su familia. El financiamiento que ambas solicitan es para capital de trabajo para la inversión de sus productos ya que sin ellos no tendrían los recursos suficientes para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. El sueño de ambas es que sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
The Solidarity Group Mujeres Unidas (United Women) is made up of Raquel P. Dávila and Magda Azucena S. C.. They are both very hardworking people who never stop fighting forward. Raque works selling new clothes. She has spent more than 9 years working on this activity. She got her start from her Mama, who was the person who dedicated her to this type of business, in order to teach her to earn a living from a very young age. In contrast, Magda works selling milk products. It has been more than 4 years that she has worked at this business. She has three children to support. Her husband works in the army but as this income is very small it is not sufficient to maintain the family. The loan that these women are asking for is for working funds to invest in their products, as without the loan the women will not have sufficient resources to satisfy the demands of their clients. Their dream is that their children manage to finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Funds

loans.name: Mamuna

texts.en:
Mamuna is a 30-year-old local restaurant operator. She is married and the mother of three children who are currently in school. She prepares and sells local food like banku, fufu and omotuo with soup and other local dishes. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. Omotuo is prepared from rice and it is also taken with any kind of soup. 

She started her local food production 17 years ago and sells in her neighborhood. She is working very hard to provide for the educational needs of her children. She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditure. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Haydee Soledad

texts.es:
La señora  HAYDEE SOLEDAD J. M. tiene 44 años, vive en el distrito De FLORENCIA DE MORA, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia tiene estudios hasta 5º de secundaria. Tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales solo 2 depende económicamente de ella.
HAYDEE se dedica a la confección de calzado, solo para damas y niñas, empezó con la confección de zapatillas, las cuales opina ser mas fáciles de aprender y vender, luego ha ido confeccionando sandalias, zapatos de ocasión y ahora zapatos para niñas. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró material para la fabricación de sus zapatillas, como: lona, pasadores, plantas de jebe y de caucho, entre otros.  Con este crédito de 900.00 nuevos soles comprará material como:cuero, hilos, plantillas, suelas, hormas ,etc para fabricar mas zapatos y zapatillas.  La socia opina que este mes va a aprovechar las fiestas y sus ventas irán incrementándose mucho mas en el mes de diciembre, es por ello que en este mes ha comprado material a un costo mas económico. 
HAYDEE sueña con tener una microempresa dedicada a la fabricación y venta al por mayor de zapatillas deportivas para el colegio y ser proveedora de los centros comerciales en el Distrito de Trujillo.
texts.en:
Haydee M. is 44 years old and lives in the district of Florencia de Mora in Trujillo, Peru. Haydee was able to attend school until the fifth level of secondary school. She has 3 children, but only two are still dependent on her for financial support. Haydee makes and sells shoes for women and children. She started with slippers, which in her opinion are the easiest to make and to sell. Later, she began making sandals, dress shoes, and now children's shoes. With her first loan, she purchased materials needed to make her shoes, such as canvas, fasteners and rubber amongst other things. With the new loan, she will purchase new materials such as leather, heels, soles, etc, to make more shoes and slippers. Haydee says that this month she can take advantage of all the holidays and her business will grow even more in the month of December. That's why she wants to purchase materials this month at good prices. Haydee dreams of having a wholesale business making and selling sports shoes for colleges, and providing shoes to the commercial centers in Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for making shoes, such as heels, leather, moulds, etc

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden J. is 32 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 4 children and her children go to school.

Kiden is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and onions in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase cooking oil to sell.

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house and to purchase a television for home use.

About BRAC

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Bertha Isabel

texts.es: Bertha Isabel G. D. P. D. 41 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. La Paz. Ella posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, así mismo venD. ropa y zapatos para hombres, mujeres y niños. Bertha es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual quiere volver a surtir su negocio, ya que ella casi pierD. su negocio debido a que se dedicó D. lleno a cuidar a su esposo mientras estuvo enfermo y el cual posteriormente falleció, ahora Bertha solicita un préstamo para poder comprar todo lo necesario para que pueda surtir D. nuevo su tienda, sobre todo con productos alimenticios y así mismo comprar una mayor variedad D. ropa y zapatos. Ella necesita mucho mejorar sus ventas, ya que no tiene ningún tipo D. ayuda extra, la tienda y las ventas D. accesorios personales es la única fuente D. ingresos que ella posee para poder seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Bertha Isabel G. D. P. is 41 years old and lives in the provincial department of La Paz. She has a store selling perishable food items and clothing and shoes for men, women and children. Bertha is a very hardworking woman who wants to re-stock her store. She almost lost her business because while her husband was sick, she devoted herself to caring for her him. He later died. Now Bertha requests a loan to be able to buy everything necessary to stock her store anew with merchandise, especially with food products, and likewise a greater variety of clothing and shoes. She greatly needs to increase her sales, since she has not had any type of additional help and the store and her sales of personal accessories are the only sources of income that she has to be able to continue ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy perishable food products and shoes

loans.name: Pab

texts.en:
Pab B., age 33, is a rice farmer from Santa Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. He maintains a hectare (2.5-acres) of farmland and grows rice to feed his family and supply their basic needs. He has three children, the eldest of whom is only 8 years old and studying in the elementary grades. 

He is looking for an opportunity to expand his business and joined the Community Economic Ventures Inc (CEVI) credit program just this year. If he gets a loan, Pab will use the money to buy farm supplies. He is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. He likes the CEVI program, especially the 2% interest rate.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Victor Gabriel

texts.es:
El Señor H. M. Víctor Gabriel de de 29 años de edad, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Santa Rosa de Lima - Cercado de Ica vive en casa de suegra con su esposa y su menor hijo.
El se dedica a la actividad de transporte cuenta con una mototaxi, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 6 años, gracias a su trabajo esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado obtener sus bienes.
El Señor  goza de buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos quienes manifiestan que es bien trabajador y emprendedor.
El desea que le apoyemos para el cambio de motor de una mototaxi que compro producto de su trabajo, ya que su anhelo es adquirir un terreno donde construir su casa propia y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
H. M. Víctor Gabriel, 29, lives in the Asentamiento Humano Santa Rosa de Lima – Cercado de Ica. He lives in his mother-in-law’s house with his wife and his young son. He works in transportation with his “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle). He has been doing this for six years. Thanks to his work, effort, and dedication he has been able to obtain his assets. He enjoys good references from his neighbors. They say he is a hard-worker and enterprising. He wants us to help him in order to change the motor on a mototaxi that he bought with his earnings. He wishes to get a piece of land where he can build his own house and give his family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Motor for his "mototaxi"

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita T., 53, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Henry T., a school owner. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own mineral-water station and preschool for quite some time now.

Amelita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow 10 times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a 10,000 Philippine pesos loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying mineral water that she will supply to her customers.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can attract more students and have enough finances to renovate the school into a child’s dream of a schoolroom.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buying mineral water that she will supply to her customers

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Mrs. Hem T. is a Cambodian pig raiser who has been working in this sector in a village located in Kompong Tom province for more than nine years. Her husband helps her support their family by fishing. Hem is 47 years old and has given birth to five children; one of whom is married and the others are single. To help feed the family, one of her daughters is working in the garment factory. 

Hem T. has been planning to construct a new house for years, but the building process is not started because the construction requires essential equipment. Hem T. is applying for a loan to purchase more tools, which will allow to her to begin building a new house.

loans.use: To purchase more building tools

loans.name: Sepora

texts.en:
Sepora A. is currently in the business of selling onions and cooking oil at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and beans to sell.  Sepora is 40 years old and married to a tailor. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock tomatoes and beans to sell

loans.name: Alma Fe

texts.en:
Alma is a 29-year-old entrepreneur from Tagbilaran City, Bohol. She is married with three children, her oldest child being only aged ten. She dreams of her children someday finishing college and having a bright future.

Alma makes local delicacies for a living. She makes camote (cooked sweet potato) and ube bars (snacks made with purple yam), squash fries and many other items. Her major buyer is Bohol Bee Farm, a resort and restaurant that promotes organically grown products. She dreams of starting her own factory so that she could also help unemployed people in her community.

Alma is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 which she will use to buy raw materials and ingredients for making delicacies. This loan will help Alma reach her dreams in life.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and ingredients for making delicacies

loans.name: Anamias

texts.en:
Anamias J. is from Megcanay Tangub City. He is 57 years old. Anamias is married and has five grown children. To make a living, Anamias owns and operates a business providing shoe repair services in the local community. Anamias has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Anamias joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anamias is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Anamias from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her shoe repair business.

loans.name: Rise And Gain Group

texts.en:
Grace A. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Rise and Gain. She is 28 years old, married, and has two children, four and eight years old, and also cares for a sibling. Presently a college student, Grace has also had a business for the past five years selling used clothes on Pipeline Road in the Redlight community, Paynesville, Liberia.

Grace started selling with 3,500.00 Liberian Dollars of working capital and now has about 5,000.00. She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 38,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more used clothes, her goals being to develop her business into a store and enabling everyone in her family to get a good education.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Grace is holding the sign. Susie is inset at lower left.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Sao S., 35, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She sells silk products for an income of about USD 3.3 per day. Her husband is employed as a farm tractor operator, earning an income of USD 4.6 per day to help cover the family expenses. Sao is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more silk for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her family's house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy silk products for resale.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama D. est âgée de 54 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KOUNKANE VW depuis le 28 aout 2006 et a  7 fois de suite reçu de crédit. C’est un membre fidèle et très dans les différentes rencontres du groupe. Elle est ambitieuse et pour preuve, avec les bénéfices qu’elle réalise à partir de son petit commerce de légumes et de produits halieutiques elle a construit une modeste maison composée de deux chambres  pour ses enfants. Son  prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité et de réaliser des bénéfices qui serviront à contribuer au bien-être familial.
texts.en:
Mariama D. is 54 years old, married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Kounkane VW since August 28, 2006, and obtained loans seven times in the past. She is very dedicated and active in group meetings. She is ambitious, which is demonstrated by the fact that she was able to earn enough money from her business selling vegetables and seafood to have a modest two-room house built for her children. This loan will allow her to bolster her business and earn an income which will serve to improve the family’s life conditions.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her  business capital and expand her enterprise

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Guadalupe de la provincia de Pacasmayo, ubicado en la región La Libertad, a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cuatro años a la preparación y hamburguesas y sachipollo (plato de comida rápida originario del país, consiste en un plato de papas fritas y pollo frito). Ella ofrece su mercadería en un carrito ambulante y sale a ofrecer sus productos todos los dias por las noches en la plazuela de su distrito. El negocio goza de muy buena acogida debido a su buena sazón con la que prepara los platos que ofrece.

Esta actividad le permite a Rosa ayudar a su esposo con el mantenimiento de sus dos hijos, el trabaja como obrero en un molino de arroz cercano y ambos se esfuerzan diariamente para salir adelante. Rosa desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más insumos que le permitan preparar mas platos y aumentar sus ventas. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Rosa es una mujer emprendedora y que da lo mejor de si para salir adelante. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 37 year old mother who lives withe her husband and their children in the district of Guadalupe in the province of Pacasmayo, which is in the La Libertad region, an hour and ten minutes from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. For more than four years she has been preparing food such as hamburgers and sachipollo (a typical fast food dish of the country which consists of fries and fried chicken). She sells her products from a mobile cart and does this every night of the week in the small square in her neighborhood. The business is very well received because of the good seasoning she uses to prepare the dishes she sells. This activity enables Rosa to help her husband with the expenses for looking after their two children. He is a worker in the nearby rice mill and they both strive daily to succeed. Rosa wants to grow her business by buying more supplies that will enable her to prepare more dishes and increase her sales. To achieve her objective, she has requested a loan of $725 from Edpyme Alternativa. Rosa is an enterprising woman who gives her best in order to succeed. She has worked with our institution before and has shown herself to be punctual and responsible in making her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies to increase her production of hamburgers and salchipollo

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
This is Joey M., 39-year-old resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Irene M., a housewife.

Joey operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five Philippine pesos' (Php) worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Joey earns profit by getting supplies at a wholesale price and selling them at a piece rate. 

Joey also oversees operation of a public utility jeepney, which does rounds on the highways near his home. Joey's store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help him continue operation of his business, he is requesting a Php10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.
  
Joey dreams that his children will finish their education.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory

loans.name: Ruqaiya's Group

texts.en:
Ruqaiya lives with her family and children in Mujahid colony, which is in the city of Borewala in Pakistan. A very talented lady, Ruqaiya runs a clothing business. She has been doing this work for over six years and has become experienced at it. She not only keeps herself aware of the new changes in fashion, but also manages her clientele base and takes care of their demands. Her customers feel good when they come to her to buy clothes, because she sells clothes at reasonable prices and also offers good clothing designs. She earns approximately 10,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) from her business which is great support for her husband. He runs a carpet weaving business. He weaves carpets and earns good profit from it. He completes a carpet in three months and, in the meantime, Ruqaiya supports the family financially. 

Ruqaiya has applied for a loan from Asasah for her clothing business. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for selling

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame A. is married and taking care of four children. She is into the sale of charcoal and secondhand clothes. She has been educated up to the senior high level. Her husband is a driver.  Maame uses her earnings to support her husband in paying school fees and utility bills.  Maame will use the loan to buy charcoal and bales of secondhand clothes to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to save to rent a shop at the market place to be able to sell in larger quantities.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and bales of secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mahina

texts.en:
B. Mahina is a married mother of two children. For more than 6 years Mahina has been selling a traditional men’s coat called a “Chapan”. Considering that her husband-businessman earns little, the business of Mahina's has been a valuable source of income for her and her family over the past 6 years. Mahina has requested a loan of 6000 Somoni to purchase new inventory. This loan will help her to continue developing her business and provide a good income for her family.   
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing traditional men’s coats called “Chapan” for resale

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: essi est une femme très dynamique, elle est célibataire et pour subvenir à ses besoins, elle a entamé en 2002, le commerce d'oignons, elle tient le monopole de ce commerce dans son quartier car elle est la seule à vendre de l'oignon, sa clientèle est pour la majorité constituée de gens de son quartier. son stock s'épuise, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 5 sacs d'oignons. elle s'approvisionne au burkina faso et au niger.
texts.en:
Essi is a very energetic woman. She is single and in order to provide for her needs, she started selling onions in 2002. She holds the monopoly of this business in her neighborhood, as she is the only one to sell onions. Her customer base is mainly composed of people living in her neighborhood. Her supply is running out and she would like to stock up. She is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 5 sacks of onions. She gets her supplies from Burkina Faso and Niger.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase onions

loans.name: Maria Dominga

texts.es: La señora Maria Dominga C. L., tiene la edad de 46 años habita en el Barrio San Jose de los Ríos es madre soltera con 3 hijos mayores de edad ellos tienen trabajan y con sus ingresos apoyan a sus padres en los gastos en los que estos incurre mensualmente, la señora es agricultora desde hace mas de  17 años y fue gracias a su padre quien la educo en las actividades de la cosecha, durante los años ha presentado problemas de afectación de plagas, que disminuyen la producción de la siembra, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas que permitan un mejor mantenimiento fitosanitario para su negocio y que le permita mejores condiciones que favorezcan a su economía y a futuro poder incursionar en nuevos mercados y heredarles a sus hijos recursos económicos para s bienestar y tranquilidad maternal.
texts.en: Maria Dominga C. L. is 46 years old and lives in the San Jose de los Ríos neighborhood.  She is the single mother of three adult children.  They all work and help to support their parents with the monthly expenses.  [Maria] has been a farmer for 17 years and it was her father who taught her to harvest.  Over the years she has had to deal with crop diseases that disrupt her production, so she is asking for this loan in order to buy farming supplies that will allow her to better maintain the “health” of her business and provide her with better financial conditions.  In the future she wants to enter new markets and leave her children the financial resources for their peace and well being.

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Marineth

texts.en:
Marineth J., age 42, runs a general store, where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Marineth has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. Marineth lives with her husband and seven school-aged children in the village of Palutan.

In 2009, Marineth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Marineth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marineth is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Marineth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in her store

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah N.  lives in the Makerere neighborhood in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has six children, four of whom attend school.  Sarah  has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works six days a week. Sarah sells her products at the market.   Sarah has requested a loan for  60,0000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bags of charcoal.  She also generates additional income by selling snacks such as chips and sausages.  Sarah's main business challenges include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are  to own a delivery van and to buy a plot of land.  Sarah lives in a home, which she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and food for her family.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Josefa Aleida

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Lourdes. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Josefa  tiene 53 años y  hace varios años  su esposo falleció, pero de esta relación tuvo seis hijos, todos mayores de edad, cinco de ellos viven con ella, su hija mayor vive en España. Ella es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos. Se desempeña como fiscal de reglamentos.

Tiene un comedor en el mercado de Charapoto, trabaja los viernes, sabados y domingos, ella prepara todo tipo de platos, entre los que más le piden  sus clientes es el delicioso caldo de pata y el seco de pescado picudo, trabaja desde las 14h00 hasta las 24h00 en estos tres días. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 15 años y los clientes la prefieren por su sazón y por la alegría con la que recibe a sus clientes.
