Este crédito es para comprar productos para la preparación de los alimentos. Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
In the City of Charapoto, the Communal Bank Virgen de Lourdes gathers every fifteen days.  This locality is known for its traditional culture and for being within minutes of two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Señora Josefa is 53 years old and a few years ago, her husband passed away.  From this marriage, she had six children, all of whom are adults.  Five of them live with her.  Her eldest daughter lives in Spain.  Josefa is a founding member of the Communal Bank and likes it because of the ease in obtaining credit.  She handles tax regulations.   

She has a food stand in the Charapoto Market, working Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays.  She prepares all types of plates, amongst the most popularly ordered are her delicious duck soup and her dried fish dish.  She works from 2pm to midnight on those three days.  She has been in business for about 15 years and her customers prefer her because of her flavorful food and the happy attitude with which she welcomes them.

This credit will be used to purchase products needed to prepare her dishes.  Her dreams are to continue working and to own a restaurant.

loans.use: Purchase supplies.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 41 years old and married with five children between the ages of 5 and 18 years old. Her husband is a repairman. She runs a small boutique in the Kabuga district of Rwanda. She employs two people and her store is open from 6 am until 11 pm. Seraphine has 20 years of experience in this business. 

Seraphine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more products for her boutique. She hopes this loan will help her obtain more profit from her sales. With the extra profit, Seraphine plans to pay school fees for her children and save money for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Nubia Maria

texts.es: Nubia Maria tiene 23 años, su actividad es la venta y elaboración de repostería. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, este negocio lo inicio aprendiendo por su familia ya que ellos le habían enseñado la forma de ganarse el pan de cada día. Es una joven que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, a pesar de los desafíos que enfrenta como los problemas de salud, pues tiene que realizar muchas cosas en el mismo tiempo. El financiamiento es para la compra de mantequilla, huevo, queso, harina, cazuelas entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Nubia María, 23, is a pastry chef.  She has had this business for over three years.  She started out learning from her family because they taught her the way to earn a living.

This young woman very much wants to get ahead in life.  Despite the challenges, like health problems, she faces she has to do many things at the same time.

The loan is to buy butter, eggs, cheese, flour and baking pans, among others.

loans.use: To buy butter, eggs, cheese, flour and baking pans, among others.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame M. is married and has four children. Her husband is a corn miller. She sells provisions at Takoradi, which she has been doing for fifteen years.  Maame uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of their children's school fees and household expenses such as utility bills.

Maame plans to use this loan to purchase additional provisions to expand her business.  Maame plans to save any additional profits she makes from her business in order to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase additional provisions for a grocery store

loans.name: Stephen Kamau

texts.en:
Stephen is 22 years old. He lives in Waithaka, a small trading center in Kikuyu town. Stephen operates a small workshop where he offers welding services to his clients. He started this business about two years ago, and with this loan he wants to buy a welding machine. This will enable him to serve his customers better.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD and he hopes that his trade will expand well.

Stephen is a responsible and hardworking young man. He hopes to establish a big workshop and a hardware shop of his own.

loans.use: To buy a small welding machine

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona C. is from the village of Binaliwan, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Alona is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Alona owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying or selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods, detergents & toothpaste in the local community. She is also buying and raising pigs for sale in the future. Alona has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Alona is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like junk foods and also feed for pigs. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Alona from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like junk foods and also feedher  for pigs

loans.name: Thoung's Group

texts.en:
Four people are forming a group loan; they are located in Daeum Rues Village in Kandal Province.

Mrs. Thoung N. was born in 1961, and she has been selected to be the group leader by the other members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land, which she uses to grow rice for a living. She also earns her living by selling Khmer cake in the local village. With these businesses, she is not earning enough income to support her family. In order to improve the family’s living conditions, she would like to ask for a loan to buy piglets for breeding.

Mrs. Thoung N. is a widow with five children: two of them are seamstresses in a garment factory, and the other three are students and also support their mother's businesses.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Mryna

texts.en:
Mryna S. is from the village of Consolacion, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 57 years old. Mryna is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Mryna owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, noodles, snacks & toothpaste in the local community. Mryna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mryna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mryna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Mryna is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like beverages & breads. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mryna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like beverages & breads

location.town: Consolacion, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Felicida

texts.en:
Felicidad P., age 60, is a widow and lives in Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City. She has three children. Despite the absence of her husband, she has been able to help sustain the needs of her family. She is engaged in the selling of dried fish. Through this business, she earns Php 5,000 a month.

Being a MIGS member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, she has already accessed financial assistance. Now, she is applying for PHP 6,000 in order to buy additional dried fish for sale. She dreams of renovating the family house someday.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Rolivia's Group

texts.en:
Rolivia M. is from the village of San Ignacio, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 41 years old. Rolivia is the leader of an eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rolivia is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Rolivia owns and operates a dressmaking supply business. Rolivia has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Rolivia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rolivia is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional dressmaking supplies to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Rolivia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional dressmaking supplies to sell

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita L. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Esterlita is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Esterlita plants & harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Esterlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Esterlita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua M. runs a drinks stall in Mfuom, near Abura town, in the Central Region of Ghana. She has been in this business for three years and her income contributes to her family’s household expenses and school fees. Akua is married to a mason and they have six children.

Akua M.'s goal is to expand her business and increase her earnings. Her loan from Kiva will enable her to purchase a higher volume and greater variety of drinks. She hopes this will help attract more customers and also cater to the needs of her existing customers. 

Ultimately, she wants to save up enough to put her children through university.

loans.use: to purchase a higher volume and greater variety of drinks.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
María es una mujer casada D. 54 años, vive solo con su esposo, no tiene hijos menores D. edad,  todos son independientes, cuenta con casa propia con todos los servicios (agua, luz y desagüe), ubicada en la calle Mariscal Castillo 818 del distrito D. reque y a unos 10 minutos D. la provincia D. Chiclayo.  Este distrito tiene como actividad  principal la agricultura, ganadería y festividades religiosas muy bonitas .
María se dedica a la crianza D. animales  (gallinas, pavos,pollos y chanchos), el corral donD. viven sus animales se encuentra en la parte posterior D. su casa, los alimenta con maíz molido, polvillo D. arroz y purina.  Posteriormente venD. sus animales una vez que hayan llegado a su desarrollo óptimo en los diferentes mercados D. la provincia D. Chiclayo para poder incrementar sus ingresos y obtener cosas que le hacen falta en su casa.
El crédito que ha solicitado María es D. 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme  Alternativa, será destinado  para la compra D. cerdos D. raza y ampliar el corral donD. se encuentran sus cerdos ya que es ha quedado muy chico y además tiene cerditos pequeños que necesitan mayor cuidado, con la finalidad D. que sus animales engorden y pueda venderlo a buen precio para poder pagar su préstamo y al mismo tiempo esos ingresos le ayuden a mejorar su calidad D. vida.
María es una mujer que ante los retos que la vida le ha puesto, siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida y poder tenerlo que quiere.
texts.en:
María is a married woman who is 54 years old. She lives alone with her husband. She does not have young children. They are all adults. She has her own house with all utilities (water, light, and drainage) located in the Mariscal Castillo 818 street in the Reque district, 10 minutes from the Chiclayo province. This district's principle activity is agriculture, farming and very beautiful religious celebrations.

María is dedicated to raising animals (hens, turkey, chicken and pigs). The corral where her animals live can be found in the rear part of her house. She feeds them with ground maize, rice bran and purine. Later, she sells her animals once they have reached optimal level of development in different markets of the Chiclayo province in order to be able to increase their income and obtain things that her house lacks.

The loan that Maria has requested from Edpyme Alternativa is for 1,000 new "soles". It will be destined for the purchase of  breeding pigs and to expand the corral where she keeps her pigs since it remains small and, additionally, she has small pigs that need greater care. Once her animals are fattened and she can sell them at a good price in order to be able to pay back her loan and at the same time, this income helps her to improve her quality of life.

María is a woman who, in the face of the challenges that life has presented, has always known how to get ahead to improve her life and to be able to have what she wants.

loans.use: to buy more breeding pigs and expand their corrals.

loans.name: Frankie John

texts.en:
Frankie John is 24 years old and still single. Frankie John is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns PHP 5,000 per month. 

Frankie John is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional fingerlings (young fish) and feed. He has had a fingerlings business for almost five years.

In the future, Frankie John hopes to improve this kind of business through the loan that he will receive from Kiva lenders. He dreams that someday, he will become successful in the business through his hard work and faith in God.

loans.use: to purchase additional fingerlings and feed

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy, tiene 65 años, es viuda y tiene 7 hijos. Julia tiene una panadería, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. harina, levadura y azúcar.
Julia ésta con el negocio D. la panadería hace 32 años, elabora todo tipo D. panes. Ingresó a FINCA Perú por la invitación D. su hija. Le gusta por la facilidad con la que acceD. a los créditos, se trabaja  a base D. confianza. Con sus ahorros puedo hacer mantenimiento D. su casa y otra parte en su capital D. trabajo. Ahora está ahorrando para la educación superior D. su hijo.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the communal bank "Tarpuy". She is 65 years old, a widow, and she has 7 children. Julia has a bakery. The loan which she requests will be invested in the purchase of flour, yeast, and sugar. 

Julia has had her bakery business for the past 32 years. She bakes all types of breads. She joined Finca Peru (Kiva Field Partner) following an invitation from her daughter. She appreciates the easy loan access based on trustworthiness. With her savings she will be able to make home improvements and a part will be used as working capital. She is now saving for her son's post-secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase flour, yeast, and sugar

loans.name: Jesuwanou Group

texts.fr: JESUWANOU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans la même maison. La présidente du groupe, Brigitte (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est née le 08 octobre 1966 et est mariée à un certain Albert. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un reste à leur charge. Brigitte et son mari vivent ensemble avec leur enfant. Brigitte n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant, Brigitte exerce comme activité depuis près de six ans la vente des plateaux d'œufs frais. Brigitte s'approvisionne dans l'un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de leur clientèle, et pour mieux se prendre à charge, Brigitte sollicite un crédit avec les autres membres du groupe JESUWANOU.
texts.en: Jesuwanou is a group of three people; all three members live in the same home.  The group’s president, Brigitte (who is raising her hand in the photo), was born October 8th, 1966, and is married to a man named Albert.  The couple has three children, all attending school, with one still in their care.  Brigitte and her husband live together with their child.  Brigitte never went to school.  Over the last six years, in order to meet her needs and her child’s needs, she has been selling cartons of fresh eggs.  She gets her supplies in one of Benin’s largest markets.  Wanting to both satisfy her clients and better support herself financially, Brigitte is asking for a loan along with the other members of the Jesuwanou group.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of eggs.

loans.name: Fatima De Jesus

texts.es:
Fatima de 27 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Es soltera y tiene un hijo que tiene 5 años de edad que estudia en escuela particular. Tiene un salón de belleza.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás porque escogió estas actividad ya que estudio belleza y mucho antes ya había trabajado en un gabinete. Labora desde las 9H00 am a 19H00 pm. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción. Para mejorar su gabinete y acondicionarlo para poder incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Fatima, 27 years old, lives in Primavera de Duran (the outskirts of a city that was originally more natural, with many hills, streams, and lakes that still exist as remnants of a dissolving ecology). She is single and has a five-year-old son who goes to private school. She has a beauty salon.

Some time ago, she started this business because she studied beauty and before that had worked in an office. She works from 9 am to 7 pm. With the help of this loan, she will purchase construction materials in order to improve her space so she can grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and bricks

loans.name: David

texts.en: David has operated his retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last three years. He is 71 years old, married to Agnes and they have three children. He was introduced to KADET by a field officer, and this will be his third loan. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use this loan to buy more goods to sell in his retail shop and also to buy a hybrid dairy cow to diversify his sources of income. In the future, he hopes to extend his retail shop to wholesale and also progress in dairy farming to become a leading supplier of milk in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: to add stock to his retail shop and buy a hybrid dairy cow.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace lives in Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. Grace has a restaurant. She has been in this business for seven years and she works six days out of every week. Grace sells her products from home, by means of retail. Grace has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, a bag of rice, sweet and Irish potatoes and a bag of charcoal.  The main business challenges for Grace include thieves and the ever-increasing price of foodstuffs.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked restaurant. Grace lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, rice, sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Djèkafo 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Djèkafo 2 sont mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 37 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Sirakorobougou dans la commune rurale de Sanando dans la 4ème région administrative du Mali (Ségou) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. 
Dans le but d’avoir des intrants disponibles pendant l’hivernage et de se faire aider dans le labour et le sarclage en recrutant la main d’œuvre masculine, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt de campagne. Les spéculations cultivées par les membres du groupe sont l’arachide, le mil et le niébé.
Madame Alimata (1 ère femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter un sac d’urée, un litre d’herbicide, 25 kg de semences d’arachide et recruter les hommes pour faire le labour. Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à la foire de Tissala et en main d’œuvre avec l’association des jeunes du village. Avec une superficie de 2 hectares, elle espère produire  15 sacs d’arachide, 5 sacs de mil, 2 sacs de niébé et des fanes; plus de la moitié de la production est consommée à domicile et le reste est vendu en plus des fanes de niébé pour prendre en charge les petites dépenses du foyer.
texts.en:
The ten women of group Djèkafo 2 are in their majority married in large traditional families. They are on average 37 years old with three kids. They all live in the village of Sirakorobougou in the rural township of Sanando, Mali's fourth administrative region (Segou). They got to know each other through bonds of kinship, marriage and neighborship.
In order to have available agricultural intrants available during the rainy season and to get help for the plowing and weeding by recruiting male workers, they contacted Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first agricultural loan cycle. The species cultivated by the group's members are groundnuts, millet and black-eyed peas.
Mrs. Alimata (the first woman sitting all the way to the right in the picture) plans on using her loan to buy one bag of urea fertilizer, one liter herbicide, 25 kilos groundnut seeds and to recruit men to do her plowing. She gets her agricultural intrants from the fair in Tissala and hire workers from the village's youth association. With her five acres, she is hoping to produce 15 bags of groundnuts, five bags of millet, two bags of black-eyed peas and the beans'  greens. Over half of her production is eaten in the household, with the remainder and the pea greens sold to provide for the household's small expenses.

loans.use: to buy groundnut seeds, urea fertilizer, herbicide and to recruit workers.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo nació en la ciudad del Quillabamba del departamento del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 47 años de edad. Actualmente, él  vive en la ciudad del Cusco donde realiza sus actividades económicas, él brinda servicio de transportes urbano por las noches en la ciudad del Cusco en su propio taxi. Desde hace 6 años que se dedica a este trabajo y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Guillermo requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro pues el carro es la única fuente de ingresos de su familia. 

El Banco Comunal “El Molinito II” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Guillermo was born in the city of Quillabamba in the Department of Cusco, Peru. He is 47 years old. Guillermo currently lives in the city of Cusco, where he engages in his business activities. He drives his own taxi and provides urban transportation services at night throughout the city of Cusco. Guillermo has been in this line of work for six years and has done very well. He is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that he can maintain his vehicle since it provides the only source of income for his family.

The Communal Bank “El Molinito II” meets every 30 days in the city of Cusco in Peru. This city is known for being a tourist and business area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Eva works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from electronic re-loading and her general store. Eva is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Eva has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her businesses.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Tacumbu Group

texts.es:
Este comité de la ciudad de Asunción, llamado Mujeres Emprendedoras de Tacumbú es un comité que esta  en el décimo Tercer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres de la Fundación Paraguaya, actualmente cuenta con 16 integrantes. Ellas gracias a su inmenso sacrificio han podido ir superando todas las etapas anteriores del programa. Ellas se definen como mujeres jefas de familia, las cuales luchan diariamente por es sustento de su familia.
Una de las integrantes de quien podemos hablar es la señora Norma, ella comenta que trabaja arduamente en su negocio todos los días. Ella tiene una peluquería, mediante la cual puede mantener a su familia y paliar los gastos que diariamente surgen en la casa. Uno de sus sueños es poder abrir su peluquería en su propia casa, para que de esa forma pueda trabajar mejor.
Ella solicita el crédito para abastecer su negocio con tintes, talcos, sprays, gel y otros insumos necesarios para su negocio. Desea poder seguir creciendo y cuenta que de obtener el crédito le dará muy buena utilidad.
texts.en:
The committee Entrepreneurial Women of Tacumbú, from the city of Asunción, is in the thirteenth cycle of the women’s committee of Fundación Paraguaya program, and currently has 16 members.  Thanks to immense sacrifice, the members have been able to go beyond all the previous stages of the program.  They define themselves as female heads of households who struggle daily to support their families.

Norma is one of the members we can talk about; she works hard in her business every day.  She is a hairdresser, by which she supports her family and alleviates the daily household expenses that come up.  One of her dreams is to open a hair salon in her own home, so that she can work better.  She requests the loan to supply her business with dyes, powders, sprays, gel and other necessary products.  She hopes to continue growing and is counting on getting the loan, which will give her very good profit.

loans.use: buy dyes, powders, sprays, gel and other products.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 28 years old and married with six children. Three of the children are in school. She has a business selling rice and sugar in Jigomoni branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more rice to sell. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell

loans.name: Chiedza Group

texts.en:
Grace is a 56 year old lady, who is married and has six children, two of which to school.  She stays in Chesvingo, Masvingo with her husband and the children. Grace buys and sells clothing and footwear and has been in the business for the past two years. 

Grace's husband is employed as a deputy headmaster and his salary is their other income. Grace wants to buy clothes and footwear for resale. The family's standard of living will improve as she will be able to buy food and pay school fees for her children. Grace wishes to open more shops in town.

loans.use: to buy clothes and footwear for resale.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a fishing business in the Philippines for 12 years. She earns additional income from selling fermented seashells. Now requesting a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing equipment and repair her fishing boat, Regina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment and repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Maria De Lourdes le está haciendo falta la barda al frente. 
Solicita un préstamo para comprar el materia que es (block, sementó, arena, varilla y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora).
 Doña Maria De Lourdes se dedica a la venta de ropa y juguetes, con las ganancias que recibe planea pagar el crédito, con el dinero que le envía su esposo pagara los gastos familiares y escolares de sus cuatro hijos que están estudiando.
Desea la seguridad y mejorar la calidad de vida y que el patrimonio que tiene este en buen en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
The front wall at Maria De Lourdes’ home is missing. She is asking for a loan to buy materials (blocks, cement, sand, and rods) and to pay the person who will make the improvements. 

Maria De Lourdes sells clothing and toys. She plans to repay the loan with her income. The money that her husband sends her will pay for the household bills and for the schooling of their four children. 

She would like the security, to have a better quality of life, and for the family home to be in good condition.

loans.use: to build a wall in the front of her home.

loans.name: Bavuu

texts.en: Bavuu is 40 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business, his elder son is college students and his younger daughter is school student. He started agriculture business in 2003 on his own land. Since vegetables are more profitable when retailed by himself, he moved to the center of the province and rented a counter in the market and sells vegetables. He needs a start-up cash in order to run a business. He is a sharp and diligent man who says"It is a big step for me. I calculated all the probable costs and risks therefore I am confident that it will succeed". He is requesting 1,300,000 MNT to rent truck for delivery his vegetables from Zavhan to Ulaanbaatar and sell them.

loans.use: To rent truck

loans.name: José Rubselin

texts.es: José Rubselin de 27 años de edad, habita en casa familiar junto con su compañera de vida y su pequeño hijo.  José posee un pequeño comedor en el cual ofrece diversidad de ricos platillos. Él se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajado, responsable y muy dedicado en sus responsabilidades. Posee muy buenas referencias de los vecinos ya que con el tiempo ha sabido ganarse la confianza y ya es muy conocido en la zona. Su sueño es poder dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio con el fin de mejorar el servicio prestado de tal manera que cada día  los clientes se sientan más identificados  y lo prefieran más. Con el crédito piensa comprar los insumos necesarios (verduras, carnes, aceite, huevos, gas propano, etc.), para dar un mejor servicio a los clientes y poder cubrir una mayor demanda.  No pierde las esperanzas que de esta manera logrará su objetivo y podrá dar a su familia una mejor oportunidad de vida.
texts.en:
José Rubselin is 27 years old and lives in the family home with his life companion and their young son. He manages a small diner where he offers a variety of rich dishes. José is known for being a hardworking and responsible man who is dedicated to meeting his obligations. He has good references from his neighbors who have gotten to trust him over time. José is well-known in the area. His dream is to provide a better quality of life for his family. For this reason, he decided to request a loan from Apoyo Integral so that he can invest in his business.

By improving the services he provides to his customers each day, they in return will identify more with his establishment and prefer to do business with him. With this loan, José plans to buy necessary supplies such as vegetables, meats, oil, eggs, propane gas, and other items so that he can provide better service to his customers and be able to meet the higher demand. José does not lose hope that he will achieve his goal and be able to provide his family a better opportunity in life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, oil, eggs, propane gas, and other supplies.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 59 years-old and a widow with two children. She's from Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

Teresita owns and operate farm land, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Teresita has been farming for ten years and she earn 18,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Teresita joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor. This will be the 14th loan taken out by Teresita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en: Ma. Victoria is 39 years old and lives in Curvada, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur with her husband and three children, all of whom are currently in school. For the last five years, she has earned a living by owning and running a specialized store where she sells various kinds of fruit. She earns about 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy more items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Johnny Andres

texts.es:
Johnny Andres tiene 29 años vive en unión libre junto a la pareja no tiene hijos. Vive en el Recinto Caimito en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla LA VERDAD NOS HARA LIBRES  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Johnny Andres se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Desde hace cuatro años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de insumos, fertilizantes, líquidos, urea para la siembra del maíz, así. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia. Su sueño es poder  tener una firma propia.
En los tiempos salir a hacer deporte.
texts.en: Johnny Andres is 29 years old and lives with his partner in the Caimito neighborhood in the town of Ventanas, Ecuador. He has no children. The community bank La Verdad Nos Hara Libres ("The Truth Will Set Us Free") is located in the same area, and it is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural harvests of corn and rice. Johnny has made a living planting these crops for the past four years. He buys his supplies in Ventanas and sells his products in the same market. He is requesting the loan to purchase supplies, fertilizers, liquids and urea for planting corn. The loan will help him increase his income for his family. His dream is to be able to have his own company. He plays sports in his free time.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, fertilizers, liquids and urea to plant corn.

loans.name: Thongny

texts.en: Thongny, 32, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling clothes for over two years and is successful in her career. Her husband is a tuk-tuk taxi driver. In order to improve her husband's business, Thongny is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a new tuk-tuk for her husband to run as a taxi and change the old one because it breaks down often. In the future, she would like to purchase a house in Phnom Penh and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a new tuk-tuk for her husband to run as a taxi

loans.name: Miraluna

texts.en:
Miraluna is a 50-year-old married woman and mother of six children, from Leyte, Philippines.  Miraluna operates a food vending operation, selling home cooked foods to the people in her establishment.  

Miraluna is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients like vegetables, meat, cooking oil, condiments, rice, and others.  With this loan, she will be able to cook and sell to more customers.  

In the future, Miraluna hopes to make her business sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like vegetables, meat, cooking oil, condiments, and rice.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en: Sharon  is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she grows potatoes and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy seeds for planting. Her business goal is to be a large scale farmer within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is married with 2 children. She is trained as a hair dresser and has located her business in a very busy area of Rongai centre. Monica joined WEEC program in 2003 and has received training on Group leadership, Basic business skills, and Customer care.

 Monica wants to make optimum use of her room. She therefore wants to add cosmetics, and also buy stock of the current attires that are fashionable for the youth. When she has many customers, Monica hires trained hairdressers and pays them on commission basis. She is also preparing to start training those who want to become hairdressers but can’t afford to pay for fulltime hairdressing course.

loans.use: Monica wants to buy Cosmetics, Fashionable clothes and some plastic seats for her trainees to use.

loans.name: Darwin

texts.en:
Darwin has a small bakery where he sells bread and sweets. Darwin learned the bakery business with the help of his brother and started the business selling bread from a tricycle. He continues to offer bread along with sweets and milk products.

Darwin would use the loan to buy an oven and a blender, in order to produce more bread to distribute to stores. He has confidence that with these new tools his business will grow.

Darwin has been with his wife for 3 years; she is currently pregnant. He is 25 years old. He is convinced that this loan will improve the economic status of his family and that his business will grow.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Darwin tiene una pequeña panadería donde vende panes y dulces. Darwin aprendiendo de este negocio con la ayuda de su hermano y empezó vendiendo pan en triciclo. Ahora el continúa ofreciendo este producto junto con dulces y lácteos.

Darwin usara el préstamo para ampliar su negocio comprando un horno y una batidora para así poder distribuir mayor cantidad de panes en tiendas. El tiene la plena seguridad que con esta nueva herramienta de trabajo va ha tener crecimiento.

Darwin esta unido con su esposa hace tres años quien se encuentra embarazada. El tiene 25 años. Darwin esta convencido que con este préstamo mejorara el nivel económico familiar y su negocio crecerá.

loans.use: Buy an oven and a blender

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

texts.en: Mrs. T. is 48 years old, and her husband is 50. They have 5 children, the oldest is 22 years old and the youngest 12 years old. Because they don't have enough money, the children have had to quit school. They live in Nghe An, a rural province in the upper center of Vietnam. Her husband has a vegetable stall at the local market and she sells porridge and breakfast at this same market. She needs the loan to pay her suppliers immediately instead of buying on credit with rates of 2.5% per month flat.

loans.use: To pay the suppliers for her porridge stall immediately instead of buying on credit

loans.name: Yakuba

texts.en: Yakuba M. is twenty-nine years old and married with two children.  He started his business when he was twenty-one years old after the death of his father.  Being the eldest child in his father’s family, he took sole responsibility for the family.  Deprived of formal education by his father, Yakuba believes, that to break the poverty cycle he should educate his two brothers and his children.  He uses the profit from the previous loan for paying school fees and repairing the roof on their home.  He would like another loan to expand this business.

loans.use: Expand petty trading business

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nin chose fishing as her business because her husband is highly skilled at fishing. Her $700 USD loan was used to replace all of their fishing gears, such as the spears, goggles, fishing nets, and canoe. Her husband does the fishing and she sells the catch at the village and sometimes at the fish market.

She makes close to $160 USD every week from this business, but it falls to $80 per week if the weather is bad. She hopes that her next loan will be used to repair their house and to help their kids who are currently living overseas.

loans.use: To buy fishing gears and a new canoe.

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en: Theresia is a 44-year-old mother of three and a resident of Buza in Dar es Salaam. She runs a shop selling soft drinks, juice and ice cream, a business she has been doing for the past five years. She now wants to expand her shop, buy a bigger refrigerator, and increase her stock. She needs $550 to accomplish all this.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue diversifying the products she sells

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Mrs. Eng S., 24, is a mother of two schooling children and lives in a part of Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She and her husband operate a taxi, earning collectively on average around $12 each day in revenue. Mrs. Eng S. has requested a loan to enable her to change her car because her existing car needs to be fixed frequently, and wastes a lot of money. She believes a new car will increase her savings and change her life.

loans.use: Change to a new car for her business.

loans.name: Camila

texts.es:
Mrs. Camila belongs to the Loreto Communal Bank, located at 344 Jr. Comandante Suarez Avenue, in the district of Calleria, the state of Ucayali. Camila is 27 years old, she is the mother of 1 young son and her husband is a merchant. The first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles she decided to invest in a small store in her residence. Nowadays she talks about her store. Camila wakes at 6 AM to prepare breakfast for her son and husband and later tends to the store until 8 PM. With the loan of 1200 soles, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, 2 packages of noodles, chicken, shampoo, soap, vegetables, etc. Camila with insistence and dedication is succeeding with her business. Her son is well and her husband helps and he makes her happy.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Camila pertenece al banco comunal Loreto, ubicado en el Jr. Comandante Suárez N° 344, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 27 años, es madre de un hijo menor de edad y su esposo es comerciante. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300, decide invertir en una pequeña bodega en su domicilio. En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega. Camila se levanta a las 6.00 a.m. para preparar el desayuno de su hijo y el de su esposo, luego atiende la bodega hasta las 8.00 p.m. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 2 paquetes de fideos, pollos, shampoo, jabón, verduras, etc. Camila con empeño y dedicación está saliendo adelante con su negocio. Su hijo está bien y su esposo la apoya y ello la hace muy feliz.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Samuel F.

texts.en:
Samuel is 46 years old and married with 5 children. He has worked as a teacher for many years, but his salary of less than $150 a month means it would take a long time to save enough to build a family house.

SMT has now introduced housing loans, and Samuel is requesting this loan so that he can purchase the necessary supplies to make more concrete bricks and begin constructing the foundation of his house. He will repay the loan from his monthly salary.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for laying the foundation of a family home

loans.name: Abaya

texts.en:
Abaya Z. prepares palm oil for sale. She is married and has 3 children. She wants to buy more raw materials to increase production.

She is asking for $225 as additional capital to enable her to buy more raw materials for oil production and sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to enable her to buy more raw materials for oil production and sale

loans.name: Pong

texts.en:
Pong T. is 45-year olds and has resided in Phnom Penh where her two children are employed by garment factories and earn $85 each a month. She has two other children who are students, and two that are married and live away from home. Mrs. Pong T. owns a plot of farmland for growing rice, and normally she makes about $2.50. Her husband, Mr. Kut Kan, 57, is a construction worker and he goes from village to village building houses. He also averages $2.50 a day.
 
Because the price of rice is going up, Mrs Pong T. would like to purchase more land for growing rice. She will also need fertilizer. She hopes to save enough money to send her children to university.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and more land for growing rice

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Maria is 43 years old, she is married and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood, she has three children and her husband is a merchant who sells vegetables and contributes to the family expenses.

The business of Maria is the sale of fruits and vegetables, in which she has 14 years of experience. She started selling fire wood, currently she sells out of her house and she also goes out to sell in a cart with her children. The loan is to buy construction materials and expand the roof in her house to avoid water from getting in her home.

In the future, she would like to expand her business, improve her house and provide education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maria tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino tiene tres hijos y su esposo es comerciante, él vende verduras y aporta a los gastos de la familia.

El negocio de doña Maria es la venta de frutas y verduras, y tiene catorce años de experiencia ella inició con esfuerzos propios y comenzó vendiendo leña, actualmente vende en su casa y también sale a vender a las calles en un carretón con sus hijos.

El préstamo es para comprar materiales de construcción para construir un bajarete para evitar que el agua entre a su casa.

A futuro es agrandar el negocio, mejorar su vivienda y educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to expand the roof in her house

loans.name: Rosalbina

texts.es:
Rosalbina is a hard-working mother of two. Her children study in the capital city, and each month she sends them money to pay their university tuition and basic expenses. Rosalbina sells groceries, and she has a small store in her home. Additionally, she travels to the capital to sell fruit. Rosalbina doesn't think twice about what she'll do next; she wants to have a stall at one of the markets in the capital, where she can securely bring her fruits and other products. With the hope of being able to achieve this goal, Rosalbina is asking for a loan to purchase merchandise for her store as well as fruit to bring to Lima, so that she can continue to build a presence there.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosalbina es muy trabajadora, ella tiene dos hijos que estudian en la ciudad capital, cada mes les envía una cantidad de dinero para el pago de la universidad y de sus necesidades básicas.El negocio de Rosalbina es la venta de abarrotes, tiene una pequeña tienda instalada en su casa, con la cual solventa las necesidades de sus hijos, que ya hemos mencionado. Adicionalmente, lleva fruta a la capita para la venta. Y como cuando se trata de progreso Rosalbina no lo piensa dos veces, ella quiere tener un puesto en uno de los mercados de la capital, donde pueda llevar de forma segura sus frutas y otro tipo de productos. Con la esperanza de poder conseguir todo esto, solicita el presente préstamo para la compra de mercadería, tanto para su bodega como fruta para llevar a la ciudad de Lima, e ir implementado un puesto por allá.

loans.use: Increased capital to buy merchandise for her store and fruit to sell in the capital city.

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Mrs. Ros T. is basket maker and farmer in Bampong Phchoek Village in Kampong Chhang Province. Her husband, Mr. Um Pa, is a fisherman who has a small income to support his family. They have two children who are employed in a garment factory. (The picture shows Mrs. Ros T. and her husband.)

On their plantation, Mrs. T. faces a small problem because she does not have enough animals to plow her rice field. So she is requesting a loan to buy a second ox to plow the rice field so she can cultivate rice. Previously, Mrs. Ros T. had a loan to buy rice seeds and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: Buy one more ox to help her old one plow the rice field

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Mrs. Lay S. owns a small grocery store in the local market which is located in Kampong Chrey Village in Takeo Province. Aside from this business, she is a farmer. Last year, she got $450 from her rice revenue. She is a 41-year-old widow with two children who attend the local school. She is now in poor conditions and lives in an uncomfortable house. Mrs. Lay S. wants to build a new house to replace the old one, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy timbers to build a new house for her household.

loans.use: To build a new house for her household.

loans.name: Banco Esperanza Group

texts.en:
"Banco Esperanza" is a group of 10 women looking to receive a small loan. Each of them has taken out a very small loan already, so this would be their second. With this loan the group is going to try and expand their small businesses and start generating more income.

Eduviges is the group representative and leader of the group. Eduviges has a lot on the line because she has 6 children that she has to take care of. She told me that those children are the reason she wants to be successful. She wants to be able to provide a different life for them and show them that they can be successful as well.

Eduviges has a very small business selling shoes and Avon products. She plans to expand using this loan and dreams of success. The whole group is ready for this new challenge and are on the road to bettering their lives. On behalf of Eduviges, the group, and Esperanza International--------- Thank you for your support!!!!

loans.use: buying more shoes to sell

loans.name: Paulina Lidia

texts.es:
Paulina is a member of the Gracias Morenita Village Bank. She is 35 years old and married with 3 children. She studied to be a nurse technician, but currently sells clothing and shoes to family members and friends as well as door-to-door. She also sells at the city penitentiary on Wednesdays and Sundays. 

Paulina needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy children’s clothing and shoes.

Paulina’s dreams are to open her own shoe store, expand her business, and for her children to grow up to be working professionals. 

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Gracias Morenita.
Paulina es casada, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Paulina estudio enfermería técnica, actualmente vende ropa, zapatos, productos que vende a sus amigos familiares y de casa en casa, sus ventas son al crédito, también vende en el penal de la ciudad a donde va los días miércoles y sábados. 
Paulina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa de niños y zapatos.
Los sueños de Paulina son tener una tienda de zapatos, ampliar mas su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Gracias Morenita Village Bank. She is 35 years old and married with 3 children. She studied to be a nurse technician, but currently sells clothing and shoes to family members and friends as well as door-to-door. She also sells at the city penitentiary on Wednesdays and Sundays. Paulina needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy children’s clothing and shoes. Paulina’s dreams are to open her own shoe store, expand her business, and for her children to grow up to be working professionals. Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy children's clothing and shoes

loans.name: Hou

texts.en:
Hou S., 35, is a mother of two and, together with her husband, earns income buying rice crops from the growers and reselling them for a profit. She makes an average of US$10 per day. Each month, Hou S.'s family spends US$73 on food and US$12 on their children’s tuition. Some money is also spent on the treatment of her ailing mother.
In order to increase the profit margin of her business, Hou S. would like to take out a loan to buy a larger volume of rice crops for re-sale.

loans.use: Purchase of rice crops for re-sale

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Rubina Naheed Imtiaz Bashir Group

texts.en:
Rubina Naheed baji is a 38-year-old married lady. She is married to a man whose name is I. B., and he runs a medical store in the community. He completed his education up to 10th Standard. She is the mother of four kids: three sons and one daughter. All of her children are getting an education in a school located near their house. Since her children started going to school, Rubina baji became a seamstress, because she wants to share the financial burden with her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy medicines to increase the profit of her husband’s medicine-selling business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more women of her locality. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Nasreen baji and Nabila B. baji each want a loan to buy a buffalo for their milk-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy medicines for re-sale

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en:
Adiza I. is a married woman. She is forty-eight years old and a mother of six children, all male. Four of her children are currently in school. The first two have completed junior high school and are yet to continue. Adiza lives with her husband and children in a town called Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer. He cultivates food crops such as maize, plantains, and vegetables to provide food for the family.

Adiza enjoys trading and has been selling for over fifteen years in the town where she lives. She sells food items like beans, maize, groundnuts, and all kinds of cereals and grains. She buys her goods from the farmers in her locality and the surrounding towns. At times, Adiza travels all the way to the northern part of the country to procure goods at affordable prices. She sells to the people of her locality, most of whom are food vendors. She says she wants to buy the goods in bulk so that she can reach a larger size of the market by trekking to markets in nearby towns. She says this is possible only by increasing her working capital. Basically, this is what she aspires to use the loan for. It is Adiza’s dream to help her husband provide for their children to make it to the tertiary level of school.

loans.use: To procure cereals and grains

loans.name: Viviano

texts.es: Viviano tiene 40 años y vive  con su esposa e hija en su casa propia. Él se dedica a la agricultura desde su niñez ya que proviene de una familia de agricultores, aprovechando esta herencia de vida para generar los ingresos que ahora son el sostén de su familia. Como jefe de hogar trabaja arduamente en  el cultivo de sus tierras para lo cual sale muy temprano a cuidar sus extensiones de terrenos; la época de cosecha es de mucha alegría, ya que ve producir sus campos es gratificante, aunque Viviano sabe que en varias oportunidades las condiciones climáticas pueden tener resultados negativos en ellas. Lo que más siembra es papa y una vez realizada la cosecha la selecciona por calidades a la cual denomina papa de primera (las más grandes y sin daños) y de segunda (las que son pequeñas y tienen algunos daños), llevando su producción a venderla a los mercados mayoristas por sacos, variando sus precios según la calidad. Esta es la primera ocasión que Viviano solicita un préstamo con MFP, él  tiene toda la disposición de ser responsable y colaborador en su banco comunal. El dinero que requiere es para la compra de fertilizantes para sus tierras de cultivo e incrementar la cantidad de animales que posee para vender.
texts.en:
Viviano is 40 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in their own home. Since his childhood, he has been involved in agriculture and comes from a family of farmers, taking advantage of this legacy to generate income to support his family. As head of household he works hard at cultivating his land and wakes up very early to tend to his plots of land; the harvest season is a very happy time because watching the production of his fields is rewarding, but Viviano knows that the weather can have negative results on his harvest. What he grows most is potatoes and after the harvest he selects the potatoes based on quality, the first and largest batch (the biggest and undamaged) and the second batch (smaller and have some damage). He takes the produce to sell at wholesale markets by the sack, varying in price according to quality. This is Viviano’s first time applying for a loan with MFP, he is fully prepared to be responsible and contribute to his community bank. The money he requests is to buy fertilizer for his land and increase the number of farms animals to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and farms animals

loans.name: Rama Shahi

texts.en:
Rama Shahi T. is a grocery shopkeeper in Sainbu-Bhaishepati, Lalitpur. She opened her grocery store to upgrade her family's standard of living. She opened her grocery store four years ago. She sells different types of grocery items in her grocery store. She feels proud to help her husband fulfill the needs of the family. She sells different types of grocery items such as rice, maize, noodles, biscuits etc in her shop. Now she is requesting Rs 25000.00 to buy different kinds of grocery items for her shop.

Mrs. Rama Shahi T. lives in a single-family house with her husband and two sons. Her husband works in a private office. Her older son is a house painter and her younger son is in grade 12.

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Uktam

texts.ru: Эргашев Уктам 1960 года рождения имеет 4 сына и 1 дочь. Высшего образования не имеет, но имеет хороший источник дохода. Он работает охранником  в АТК . Он разводит скот и перепродает на рынке. Сено и другой корм он почти не покупает. Так как ест земля где сажает жмых и другой корм для скота. Сейчас он хочет расширить  свой коровник, у него 2 коровника где можно держать еще несколько голов скота. Жена Уктама любит ухаживать за своей коровой, потому что корова дает много и очень хорошего молока, которые употребляют внуки и дети. Он узнал о Микроинвесте у своего сына и обратился  за кредитом.
texts.en:
Uktam Ergashaev was born in 1960 and has four sons and one daughter. He does not have a higher education, but has a good source of income. He works as a security guard at ATK. He also raises and resells cattle on the market. He rarely buys hay and other fodder because he has a plot of land where he grows oil meal and other fodder for the cattle. At this time he wants to expand the cow house. He has two cow houses where he can keep several more heads of cattle. Uktam's wife loves to take care of her cow because it gives a lot of very good quality milk which their children and grandchildren drink. Uktam has found out about MicroInvest from his son and has decided to apply for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa M., 44 years old, is married and blessed with five children. She lives in Neopoda Villages, Tambo, Hinaplanon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte in Southern Philippines. She buys and sells dried fish. She also engages in snack-making, particularly in the preparation of traditional Filipino delicacies like puto, cochinta, and biko.

Teresa works hard to earn money to provide for the needs of the family. She is very lucky to have a stall beside the mall and the stall rental is free. She started her business with the help of her brother's money.

Due to the increasing demands of her business, she wants to apply a loan from HSPFI (a Kiva partner) amounting to Php 4,000. She wishes to use this loan to purchase additional stocks of dried fish as well as ingredients for her snack-making. This will help Teresa to generate more income and supply the needs of her customers.

If granted, this will be her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional dried fish and ingredients for snack-making.

location.town: Tambo, Hinaplanon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Elicia

texts.es: Elicia es una madre muy responsable y amorosa con sus 3 hijos; Soledad de 10, Rosmeri de 8 y Rodrigo de 11 meses, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es brindarles unos buenos estudios. Su puesto está ubicado en la explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan las ferias en Juliaca), ella vende la tan conocida hoja sagrada de los Incas, es decir la hoja de coca. Su puesto es muy concurrido y debido a la carismática forma de vender que tiene, sus clientes siempre se van muy contentos y felices con su compra. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender su producto y terminar con la cantidad prevista. Lleva 8 años en esta actividad y lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta sin poder salir a ningún lugar. Para el futuro desea hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos, sabe que el camino a sus metas es largo y sacrificado, pero está dispuesta a recorrerlo. Este es el segundo préstamo de Elicia con MFP, y sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en las reuniones. Con los mil quinientos soles solicitados planea comprar más hojas de coca, para aumentar la mercadería que vende normalmente.
texts.en:
Elicia is a very responsible and loving mother to her 3 children: Soledad, age 10, Rosmeri, age 8, and Rodrigo, 11 months. She lives in her own house, and what she wishes for the most is to provide her children with good educations. Her stall is located in the Laguna Temporal esplanade (site where the markets in Juliaca take place). She sells the well-known sacred leaf of the Incas, in other words, coca leaves (typically chewed or brewed like tea). Her stall is very busy and, given her charismatic way of selling, her customers always leave content with their purchases. What she enjoys the most about her work is selling her product, and ending the day with her predicted number of sales. She has been doing this activity for 8 years, and the most difficult part is staying in her stall all day without leaving. For the future, she hopes to grow her business to improve her income. She knows the road to get to her goals is long and will require sacrifices, but she is prepared to take it. This is Elicia’s second loan with MFP, and she knows that she has to make her payments on time. She is a very responsible member of her cooperative bank, and she always enjoys the reunions. She plans to use the 1500 soles she is requesting to buy more coca leaves, so she can increase the amount of product she has to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Azima

texts.ru: Азиме 48 лет, имеет 3 детей. Несколько лет назад у нее умер муж. Азима занимается куплей продажей детской одежды. Ей помогает ее невестка. Кроме того ее старший сын занимается ремонтом легковых машин. Азима ездит за товаром на оптовый рынок и потом продает в розницу на местном рынке. В МикроИнвест получает свой первый займ и собирается расширить ассортимент товаров.
texts.en:
Azima is 48 years old and has three children. Her husband died several years ago. Azima is involved in the sales of children’s clothing. Her daughter-in-law helps her with the business. Besides this, Azima’s oldest son repairs passenger cars. Azima travels to a wholesale market for her merchandise and then sells the goods retail at a local market. This is her first loan at MicroInvest. She plans to use it to expand her goods assortment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of goods assortment

loans.name: Abau

texts.en:
Abau L. sells various types of goods at her shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more items to sell. Abau is 36 years old and married. Her husband is a driver. She has three children and they all go to school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent at Jebel kujur.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more items for her shop.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce A. is thirty-nine years old. She is single but has given birth to one child who is currently in the junior high school. She lives with her child in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Suhum in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Joyce works hard to be able to provide for herself and her child. She deals in pastries which she prepares and then hawks (goes door-to-door) to sell in her community. She also sells in a case on the street.

Joyce has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy flour in bulk to increase her stock. She aspires to sponsor her child in school to the higher levels.

loans.use: To buy flour in bulk

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma B. is from the village of Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Wilma is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Wilma owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Wilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Wilma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is raising hogs in their backyard. She is a resident of Barangay Villa Marzo in Cordon, Isabela. She is happily married to Eufemio, who is a simple farmer.  They are blessed with six children.  Five of them are already married and only Vergel, who is 27 years old now, is still single.  He just finished a vocational course. Leonila is thankful because she is able to provide the needs of her family through the income she generates in her hog raising business and also through the earnings of her husband from farming. 

She now hopes to avail herself of financial support from Kiva lenders. She wanted to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 19,000 for the maintenance of her hog raising business. She will utilize the loan to buy a supply of feed and also to buy additional piglets if there is still enough money left.  Leonila is grateful to have the chance to raise pigs because, according to her, it was really a big help in sustaining their family's needs.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Roa

texts.en:
Roa L. is from the village of San Isidro, Talakag Bukidnon. She is sixty years old. Roa is part of a group running a sari-sari (variety) store in her community. Roa has been in business for over twenty years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. She also works occasionally as a dressmaker.

In 2009, Roa joined HSPFI to take advantage of its financial services. Roa is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional goods so as to expand her business. This will be the first loan taken out by Roa from HSPFI.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that individual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of red oil

loans.name: Waobendian Group

texts.en:
Gbolie is a 40-year-old illiterate widower with five children whose ages range from 2 to 20 years and whose level of education ranges up to college.

Gbolie has been involved in weaving (country-cloth-making) for about five years now. His challenge has been finances but he is successful in attracting more customers to his goods because of his styles and designs which could be classified as “the latest”.

Gbolie dreams of having a modern tailoring shop that will enable him to produce more to sell to the public and enable him to educate his children and assist them in other areas.

loans.use: To buy thread, cottons, needles and other materials

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
45-year-old Ofelia G. has been dreaming of a better future for her seven children who range in age from four to 13 years old. She wants to build a better house for them and be able to sustain their education until they graduate from college. However, depending on her husband’s sporadic and small income being a farm laborer and a fisherman, her dream would be out of reach. That realization led her to ASHI. 

In 2008, along with the aspiration she had in her heart and mind, G. joined ASHI and requested a loan to start her own hog fattening (pig raising) business and to support her husband’s fishing business. Proceeds she had then have enabled her to pay back on time the total amount she had borrowed. Now ASHI and its partners trust her even with a larger loan. Most importantly, she has started a business, which will be a great source for financial assistance in reaching her dream. Now, with a much larger loan, she will be growing her business and her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for fattening and materials for making fishing gears.

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en:
Adiza is 30 years old. She is married and is a mother with three children. Two of her kids are in school while her last-born is still breastfeeding.

To support her household, Adiza sells cereals like beans, maize and groundnuts (peanuts) to her loyal customers in the community market. She takes delivery of stock from the farming communities.

Adiza says the selling of these products is very lucrative and, with her four years experience, she can increase her market share. Therefore, she wants the loan to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to support her family, especially the children’s education, and business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals like groundnuts and beans

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 39 years old and has a photography business, providing photos and videos for individuals and weddings. He has been in business for eleven years and has successfully completed a previous Faulu loan of Kes 40,000. He is now requesting a loan of Kes 65,000 to purchase a camera.

Patrick describes himself as an ambitious risk-taker who is geared to achieve his goals and dreams. He says that since joining Faulu, he takes record-keeping more seriously. His hope is to become an employer and a leading player in his field.

loans.use: To buy a camera

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria where she sells sarongs at the market. She is 57 years old and married with 7 children. Rose would like to get a loan to purchase additional sarongs for the season. She is planning to purchase a variety of sarongs and will significantly expand her sarong business. Rose believes that having an assortment of good-quality sarongs will increase her sales. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es: José Santos A. M. de 38 años de edad, reside en San Martín, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposa la cual se dedica a las labores domésticas y tres hijos de 17, 13 y  11 años de edad, respectivamente. José Santos se dedica a la venta de zapatos deportivos en una de las zonas más comerciales del pueblo de Ilobasco ubicado en el departamento de Cabañas. Debido a que el fin de años es una temporada en la cual las personas aprovechan para comprar muchos productos y sobre todo de uso personal, José Santos solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar una mayor cantidad de zapatos, así mismo desea ampliar su negocio y comprar jeans para hombre y mujer, los cuales se venden mucho en esta temporada navideña. José Santos anhela poder brindarle lo mejor a su familia en todo tiempo, es por ello que desea invertir en su negocio y de esta manera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
José Santos A. M. is 38 years old and lives in San Martín, located in the department of San Salvador. He lives with his wife, who does the housework, and his three children aged 17, 13, and 11. José Santos works in sneaker sales in the busy commercial district of the town Ilobasco, in the department of Cabañas.
